Iskandar's dream is to save enough money to pay for his wedding party. He has applied for a loan of 1,600 AZN to do repairs and make his shop more attractive to customers.

loans.use: To make repairs to his shop

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She owns a small business in “Osipenkovskyi,” a local market, where she sells items such as purses, wallets and gloves. Tatyana is an experienced market vendor. She started her business 5 years ago. Currently, she has 60,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. 

Tatyana is a high-achiever. She is seeking stability in life and wants to achieve success in her business. This time, Tatyana is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital and and increase her income as a result of better sales.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita G. is from the village of Lapasan, Cagayan de oro City. She is 47 years old. Purita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Purita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Purita has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Purita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Purita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Purita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to further invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Purita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda A. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Habitat 4, Barangay Bajumpandan, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a general store and by buying and selling charcoal and fruit. Erlinda’s husband, Jaime, is 56 years old and drives a motorcycle that earns him Php 4,500 per month.They have three children who are between 22 and 34 years old, two of whom already have families while the other child is currently going to school. Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by operating a general store and by buying and selling charcoal and fruit. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,400 from her business activities. Erlinda is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and her charcoal and fruit business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 19,000 for her 12th loan which she again intends to use for her businesses. Erlinda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Olukehinde

texts.en: Olukehinde is married to a teacher and they are blessed with 2 children. Their children are doing great in school. He is a businessman. To make a living in Ibadan, he sells phone accessories. He has been in this business for a long time. His greatest challenge in his business is funds and he hopes to overcome this challenge. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 40,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. He hopes to expand his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es una señora que cuenta con 34 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años, actualmente se cambio de vivienda a una familiar, su entorno familiar es muy unido ya que tanto la madre como los hijos realizan la venta a diario juntos. Marcelina tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio, se dedica a la venta de bijouteria (joyería de fantasía), tiene dos puestos uno por el correo de la ciudad y otro cerca de una facultad (por la universidad) En su primer puesto tiene muy poca  competencia ya que son solo tres a cuatro puestos que se dedican a la bijouteria, en el puesto de la facultad simplemente NO tiene competencia ya que es la  única vendedora. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería es decir para comprar bijouteria variada. Sobre su historial en Agrocapital tuvo algunos retrasos pero justificados por la misma Marcelina, ahora en otras entidades financieras al igual que en la nuestra demuestra puntualidad en sus pagos, esto lo demostró con sus boletas de pago.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a 34-year-old woman with 2 children, aged 9 and 5. She has recently moved in with another family member. Her family is very united, since both the mother and the children work together every day to sell their merchandise. Marcelina sells costume jewelry, and she has quite a lot of experience in this business. She has two sales locations, one by the city's post office and the other near a department of the university. Her first sales stand has very little competition, since there are only three or four stands selling jewelry. At her stand near the university, she simply has NO competition at all, since she is the only vendor. The aim of this loan is to purchase merchandise -- that is, to buy a variety of costume jewelry. Regarding her history with Agrocapital, she has had a few delays, but these have been justifiably explained by Marcelina, and now she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments with other financial entities as well as ours, as she has shown with her payment receipts.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: buying merchandise

loans.name: Palangan's Group

texts.en:
Ivy P. is from the village of Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Ivy is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Ivy is married and has three children which is now in kindergarten . To make a living, Ivy owns and operates a hog-raising business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ivy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. 

In 2006, Ivy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Ivy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Ivy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina s 53 years old, single and has a 23-year-old child. To make a living, she bakes cupcakes, polvoron (a type of shortbread), and other delicacies that she sells in her community. She hopes to prosper in what she does and wants to improve her family’s living conditions. She joined CEVI and asked for a loan of Php13, 000 that she will use to buy flour, sugar and other baking needs.

loans.use: Flour, sugar and other baking needs

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Na S. is 58 years old and lives in Krasang village in Takeo province. She was selected by the thirteen members of her loan group to be the village bank president. The group members will each use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Na S. and her husband, Mr. Yory L., are farmers. They have two children. The eldest works as a laborer and the youngest is a student in the local school. To make a living, Mrs. Na S. and Mr. Yory L. own a plot of land and rent a piece of land which they use to cultivate rice. Mrs. Na S. decided to ask for a loan in order to hire farm laborers to help with her farming crop.

loans.use: To to hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis C. was born in Tete, Mozambique 56 years ago. He studied up to the sixth grade and then stopped to start military service. It was in the military where he met his wife. Being a former soldier, he gets a pension from the state. He has five children who range in age from 13 to 37.

He left his hometown to move to Maputo during the transition government, which came into power in 1974 after independence. He and her wife's pensions combined come to about 9,400 Meticais a month.

Luis is applying for a loan to buy cement, bars, sand and other construction materials to improve his house. He is concerned because prices for such materials are rising, and he may not be able to afford them if he does not make the purchase now. With help from Kiva lenders, he expects to finish construction in the near future and then begin applying for new loans to buy furniture for it.

loans.use: to buy cement, bars and sand he needs to finish building his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more guinea-pigs and chickens

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. She owns a hectare of land where she plants and harvests rice for sale. She also has a portion of land where she plants vegetables that she sells at the market and is raising a pig for breeding. She has been doing these activities for more than 10 years.

Marietta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Marietta from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Describing herself as hardworking, focused, and self-driven, Catherine is a 50 year-old green grocer who sells fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, potatoes, avocados, pineapples, bananas, apples, and beetroots) to local customers near a transportation hub in her town. Shortages of fruits in the market represent her biggest business challenge. In addition to her green grocery business, she generates income by selling sheep and goats.

Having repaid her previous loan of 20,000 Shillings, Catherine is requesting a 45,000 Kenya Shilling loan to purchase additional produce (tomatoes, leafy green vegetables, etc.) to supply to the schools around the area. In the future, she hopes to grow her business in order to supply more schools and hotels in her town. In five years, she dreams of having a wholesale business so that she is in a position to supply other green grocers.

loans.use: To purchase additional produce (tomatoes, leafy green vegetables, etc.) to supply to the schools around the area

loans.name: Hamidulo

texts.en:
Hamidulo is married and has 4 children. His wife helps him with his business selling sunflower seeds in the market. He started this business 18 years ago. Previously he worked as a driver and his salary was not enough to cover their expenses, so he decided to start his own business. Hamidulo saw that it would be a good opportunity to be independent and run this business. Hamidulo is requesting a loan of 6500 Somoni to purchase merchandise and supply a greater assortment of products. He and his family thank you for the support that you give him. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase addition foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bendiya  5 Group

texts.fr:
BENDIYA 5 est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3  enfants et vivent  dans des  familles polygames à MOSSIBOUGOU un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous-préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les cinq prêts passés se sont  bien dénoués.
La spéculation majoritairement cultivée est : le pois sucré à  l’image de MARATOU O..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et  recruter de la main d'œuvre   pour  exploiter  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue après la récolte, au marché de du village de DALLEN et au marché de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000 FCFA par campagne.
Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider son mari dans certaines dépenses de la famille.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
BENDIYA 5 is a group of 10 married with an average age of 33. They each have 3 children on average and live in polygamous families in Mossibougou, one of the villages in the commune of Loulouni in the Sikasso Region of southern Mali. They collaborate with the Microfinance insitution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their agricultural activities during winter. This is their seventh loan with the institution, with the past five being duly repaid. The main crop they cultivate is the pois sucre nut. This is the crop cultivated by Maratou O.. With her loan, Maratou O. intends to purchase the agricultural products, tools and labour requried to cultivate 1,5 hectares. The produce is sold after the harvest at the markets in Dallen and Louloni to a mixed clientele of men and women. She hopes to make an average profit of 75 000 FCFA each season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with various household expenses. She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to cultivate and even bigger plot of land and make bigger profits.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Frais de labour, semences, engrais, herbicides, sarclage et petits matériels agricoles.

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. S. K. is a village bank president who was born in 1962. She has been selected president by the 16 people who make up a village bank loan located in Damnak village, TaK. province. All the members will use their portion of their loan for different purposes to improve their lives. 

Mrs. S. K. and her husband, Mr. Rort Thorn, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Her problem is that her crop field has infertile soil and she does not have enough money to support it. So to improve production, Mrs. S. K. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and, with the rest of the loan, she will hire a plowing machine to plow her field and farming laborers to help her to grow rice. She is the mother of a child who is enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en: Emilio N. Jr. is from the village of Old Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon. He is 51 years old. Emilio is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Emilio runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Emilio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Emilio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Emilio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 48 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Clemente de 58 años y sus 5 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Teodosia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva papa y arveja, productos que luego lleva a vender a la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para aumentar su productividad.
texts.en:
Teodosia, age 48, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Clement, age 58, and their 5 young children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. With a lot of effort, Teodisa has been able to work her lands and make them very productive. She cultivates potatoes and peas, products which she later brings to sell in Tarma city, where she sells them wholesale. Her crops have provided her the necessary income to maintain her family. For this reason she wants to put all of her earnings into getting this business ahead. Her favourite part of her work is caring for her crops. She has been doing this work for 35 years, and she finds her greatest difficulty to be transporting her products to the wholesale market in Tarma, since the bags that she brings are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and thus to have more income. This is her third loan with MFP. She has been very punctual in her previous loans and she hopes to be so again. In her community bank, she is a very participatory member and is always aware of the agreements that the group reaches. With the 700 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase fertilizer to increase her productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yadira;  La socia tiene  40 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo,  La socia se dedica a la docencia ella es maestra de artes, ella realiza trabajaos manuales como bisutería, desde hace 18 años. La socia tiene bellísimos trabajos realizados por ellas en diferentes motivos, colores y materiales. L asocia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para realizar más trabajos para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para realizar los trabajos de bisutería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the MACHUPICCHU community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Yadira, 40, is the single mother of 1 son.  She is, by profession, a teacher, with a specialty in arts teaching.  She creates art pieces--jewelry, for example--by hand, work that she's been doing for 18 years.  She has created beautiful works of various motifs, colors and materials.  Sra. Yadira is applying for a loan to support her business.  She will use the loan to buy supplies to make the jewelry pieces that she sells.

Sra. Yadira is grateful that this important means of borrowing is available to her and others and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para realizar los trabajos de bisutería.

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.fr: Akuwa est une femme  de 35 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de tôles qui sert à couvrir le toit des maisons au  Togo. La plupart de sa clientèle est composée d’entrepreneurs. La demande de sa clientèle est toujours élevée, en ce moment son stock  ne lui permet pas de servir  toute sa clientèle. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit  pour s’approvisionner avec 4 douzaines de tôles. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES 2 crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.
texts.en: Akuwa is a 35 year old woman whose line of business is the retail sale of sheet metal used to cover the roofs of houses in Togo. Most of her customers are entrepreneurs. Her customer demand is always high, but currently she does not have enough stock  to serve all her customers. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to stock up with 4 dozen sheets. She is married and the mother of two children. She has already obtained two  loans from WAGES that she has fully repaid.

loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal

loans.name: G.s. Montes De Los Olivos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Montes De Los Olivos está compuesto por la señora Sofía y Arelys. Sofía aduce que este negocio le ha ayudado a tener buenos ingresos, lo que le ha permitido seguir manteniendo a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Algo que agradece a Fundación León 2000 es que con este préstamo ella incremento su inventario, aumento sus ventas y por ende logro mejorar las condiciones de vida que ella poseía, y hasta ha realizado algunas mejoras a su vivienda. Ella sueña en el futuro es que desea establecer una pulpería en su domicilio y sobre todo desea que sus hijos se puedan preparar en la universidad. Por lo que ambas solicitan financiamientos para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en: The solidarity group "Montes de Los Olivos" [mountains of olives] is composed of Sofía and Arelys.  Sofía explains that this business has helped her have a good income, which has allowed her to continue supporting her three young children.  She is grateful to the Fundación León 2000 because with this loan she increased her inventory, increased her sales and therefore was able to improve the quality of life that she had, and she has also made a few improvements to her house.  She dreams that in the future she can set up a local grocery store in her home and above all she wants her kids to be able to study in college.  For these reasons both apply for financing to improve their businesses.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Renacer San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Renacer San Francisco, actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 15 emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor D. sí mismas para aumentar sus ingresos y por enD. brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
Una D. las integrantes es L. señora Andresa quien se dedica a L. venta D. cosmetibles D. diferentes tipos.
Asi elL. todos los dias prepara sus productos para L. venta como empanadas, milanesa, tortillas, todos a precios muy accesibles para L. gente que trabajan por el barrio.
Comenta que tiene buena venta diariamente con L. misma cubre bien su cuota y los gastos diario para L. alimentacion D. su familia L. cual es muy importante para elL.,y asegura que seguira trabajando mucho.
Solicita le préstamo para L. compra D. carne y otros insumos para su cosmetibles.
texts.en:
The committee is named Renacer San Francisco ("Rebirth San Francisco").  They are currently in their first loan cycle with excellent grades.  It is maD. up of 15 entrepreneurial women, who put forth their best efforts to increase their incomes in order to give the best to their respective families..

One of the women is Mrs. Andresa, who sells different types of foods.  Every day she prepares food to sell--empanadas, breaded filets of meat, and tortillas--all at prices accessible for the people who work in her neighborhood.  Mrs. Andresa says she has good daily sales, so she is able to cover her payment installments and daily costs for taking care of her family, which is very important for her and ensures that she will continue working hard.

Mrs. Andresa is asking for a loan to buy meat and other ingredients for her food.

loans.use: Buy meat and other ingredients for food she sells

loans.name: Mario José

texts.es: El señor Mario José C. V., es un joven de 29 años habitante del Barrio de la ciudad Rural de Ticuantepe, con su pareja de vida y sus dos hijos menores de edad, su pareja se dedica a realizar las tareas del hogar, el mayor de sus hijos estudia la escuela primaria, ellos son agricultores con una experiencia de más de 15 años, atreves de los años se han enfrentado a diferentes situaciones de infección de plagas que carcomen la producción ocasionándoles problemas económicos a la pequeña y joven familia, fue con el apoyo de su papa que lograron iniciarse en esta actividad, la cual hoy en día es el sustento económicos de los suyos, es para una mejoría en la producción que solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos que brinden un mantenimiento Fito-sanitario adecuado y aumente la producción y mejore día a día las condiciones socio-económicas de sus pequeños hijos. Este no es el primer préstamo de la familia C., ha sido para ellos de gran apoyo los antiguos prestamos y el equipo de Afodenic a notado el cambio positivo que la familia ha tenido a traves de esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario José C. V. is a 29 year old young man living in a neighborhood in the rural city of Ticuantepe with his life partner and two minor children.  His spouse is a housewife.   The oldest child is in elementary school.  

They have been farmers for over 15 years.  Through the years they have faces situations involving pest infestations that consume the crops causing economic problems for the young, small family.  

It was with help from his father that they were able to start out in this line of work which today is the source of support for his loved ones.  He is asking for funds to improve production; he needs to buy products to provide crop maintenance so that production will increase daily thus improving his children’s economic situation too.

This isn’t the C.’s family first loan.  Previous loans have been of great use to them and the Afodenic team has noted the positive change the family has had through this help.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a single woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a firewood-sales business for the past four years, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mjeni faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a farmer. She owns and tills a piece of land in Sto. Niño, where she grew up. She says her parents taught her farming. Now that she has her own family, she used her skills to start her business. She plants and harvests rice and then sells it on the market. She has been engaged in rice farming for quite a while now. She hopes to make her business stable so she can help support her family.

Lorna is in need of fertilizers and other inputs. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6000 to buy what she needs for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers like manure.

loans.name: Mrs. Var Thoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Srae Vong village in Takeo Province live 14 people who comprise a village bank loan. Each will use their portion of the loan in order to improve their family living standards. Mrs. Var T., the village bank president selected by the other members, sells cakes in front of a public school, thereby earning money to support her family. Now she wants to start a cow-breeding business for which she is requesting a loan.

Var's husband, Mr. San Hem, is a farmer who owns a 1.2-hectare plot of land upon which he grows rice to sell to support his family, and he is also a construction worker. This couple has three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school; their youngest is only a one-year-old.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya D., 42, is widowed and lives with her three daughters in Darhan, the second biggest city in Mongolia. They have been living in Darhan for three years and she has been taking care of her daughters alone for six years. 

She started her retail trading business in 2000 and her working capital is 1,500,000 MNT. She is a caring mother and hardworking person who says, "My wish is to raise my daughters well-educated and  provide the opportunities that they could take care of their own living without any difficulties in the future. And I am trying hard to make them well-educated people." 

She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase more goods that she can sell during the busy time of Tsagaan Sar, the traditional Mongolian New Year.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
Santos es soltero y tiene de 28 años de edad. Reside junto a su familia en el caserío El Verde. Se ubica en el distrito de Pitipo, una zona agrícola situada en la región Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace años, se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de cereales. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar este producto. Vende su producto a los comerciantes que visitan la zona. Santos cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos y ayudar a sus padres y hermanos menores. 

Santos desea comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo. Para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es un hombre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 28 years old and single. He lives with his family in the village of El Verde, which is located in the District of Pitipo. This farming district lies in Lambayeque region and is more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos has been growing and selling grain for several years. He has a plot of land on which he cultivates this product, which he sells to traders who visit the area. Santos says that he already has an established customer base. The earnings he generates from his business are used to cover his expenses and support his parents and younger siblings.

Santos wants to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops. In order to continue with the production of his crops, he is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Santos is a hardworking gentleman who is devoted to his family. He wants to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food vending business and a general store. She lives in EB Magalona, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000. Judith is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Judith aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Harrison Nguri

texts.en:
Harrison has operated his baker shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 28 years old and married to Margaret Wangui. They have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a motorbike to assist him with distribution of his products.

In the future, Harrison hopes to grow his baker shop and be a leading baker in the area.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to assist him with distribution of his products

loans.name: Siba

texts.fr: Madame Siba habite Batomé un quartier périphérique de Lomé. Elle a un enfant. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes et friperies. Elle a commencé depuis  2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé pour les pagnes et le marché de Hedzranawoé  pour les friperies.  Ensuite elle revend au marché d’Adidogomé et Djidjolé. Son activité rapporte tellement qu’elle a reçu de Wages un crédit qu’elle a déjà soldé.  Elle espère satisfaire plus de demande et sollicite un prêt pour acheter une balle de friperie. Avec son activité, elle contribue financièrement aux charges  de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Siba lives in Batomé, a neighborhood on the outskirts of Lomé. She has one child. She has a revenue generating business selling pagnes (colorful printed cloth) and used clothes. She started this business in 2005 and she purchases her pagnes from the large market in Lomé and used clothes from the market in Hedzranawoé.  She then re-sells the goods in the markets of Adidogomé and Djidjolé. 

Her business brings in profits and so her loan from Wages (the microfinance institution) has already been approved. She hopes to satisfy more of her clients demands and is requesting a loan to buy a bale of used clothing (the manner in which used clothing is sold). With this business, she contributes financially to her child's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes (colorful, printed cloth) and used clothes

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili M. is 58 years old and lives in Zestaponi District, in the village of Puti. She has a 25-year-old daughter who works as an operator in a private company and earns 150 Laris per month. Another source of the income for the family comes from agricultural activities led by Lili. She has a milk cow and sells cheese at Zestaponi market. Also she grows maize on her plot of land with an area of 0.5 ha. Along with the above-mentioned, Lili has a vineyard (300 grape vines) and makes wine. Both of these products are sold in Zestaponi. 

The loan will be used to purchase one milk cow. It will result in increased amount of produced cheese and thus more income for the family. Lili and her daughter hope that the increased income will allow them to spend more on the household and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and is a married woman. She has a 10-year-old child.

Jocelyn is a farmer working in the municipality of Santo Niño in South Cotabato Province. She primarily grows rice crops and sells her harvest to the market. Jocelyn works hard to sustain her child's education and to improve her family's living conditions.

Jocelyn is planning to use this loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Valens

texts.fr: Valens R. est sentinaire, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il a 52 ans, il est marié, et il a 8 enfants entre 4 ans et 25 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Valens est né au Rwanda, et il a une éducation d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son quatrième cycle avec ACB, et il a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter une vache pour sa famille.  Il n’y a pas des difficultés attendues de non-remboursement du crédit.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de solder le crédit et demander un autre pour acheter une autre vache, pour vendre de lait.  Il voudrait avoir une ferme, éduquer ses enfants, et mettre sa famille en bon état.
texts.en: Valens R. is a guard and has been a client of ACB since 2010.  He is 52 years old, married, and has 8 children between the ages of 4 and 25.  Three of his children go to school.  Valens was born in Rwanda and has a primary school education.  This loan is his fourth from ACB, and he has a good history of repayment.  He will use his loan to purchase a cow for his family.  No difficulties from non-repayment of the loan are expected.  His growth strategy for his business is to settle the balance of the loan and to request another, in order to buy another cow to sell it's milk.  He would like to have a farm, educate his children and put his family in a good state.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
Lily es socia del Banco Comunal “Uniòn Arco Deustua” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos, todos independientes.  La señora  estudió educación secundaria 
Lily se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir como chompas para niños y sabanas.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, con su primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con el nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará telas para la confección de las sabanas y almohadas para venderlas a sus vecinas y amigos. Trabaja sola ya que su esposo es ingeniero economista (realiza proyectos). 
Su sueño es comprar maquinas remalladoras para su confección y crecer en el negocio.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Lily is a member of the “Uniòn Arco Deustua” communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She’s 55 years old, has a live in spouse and four independent children.  She went to secondary school.

Lily sells clothing, like children’s sweaters, and sheets.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last four years.  She invested her first, 300 new sol, loan in her business.

She will use the new, 500 new sol, loan to buy fabric to make sheets and pillows to sell to her neighbors and friends.  She works alone because her husband is an Economic Engineer (he works on projects).  Her dream is to buy overlock sewing machines for her work and to grow in business.

What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility of the members.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make pillows and sheets.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is a mother of two children who are ages two and seven. The eldest child is in school while the youngest isn’t. Her husband rides a motorcycle to generate income while Emerithe owns a store in which she sells different kind of items such as sugar, soap, sandals, candles, juices, water and other items. She is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, soap etc in order to make more profits. She plans to begin her house construction with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy items such as sugar, soap, candles etc for sale.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Raeda has two daughters and two sons. She took out a loan from FATEN to purchase furniture for her daughters. The four children used to share the same room but, now that they are growing up, the children need their own rooms. Raeda's husband is an employee and can't furnish the room from his salary, though he can pay FATEN back on a monthly basis.

Raeda's husband is photographed instead of her as she is a conservative woman (as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants).

loans.use: to purchase home furniture for her daughters' room.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en: Engracia is married. She lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer, and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Engracia has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed for her pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié , père de deux enfants. Il exerce l'activité de mareyage qu'il a démarré il y'a sept ans avec des prêts de riches hommes d'affaires qui interviennent dans le secteur de la pêche artisanale comme bailleurs d fonds.Il n'est jamais arrivé à faire des bénéfices consistants du fait du fort taux d'usure appliqué par ses créanciers.En plus, il subissait une très forte pression car devant rembourser globalement en fin de journée tout le montant reçu le matin.Cette exploitation ne lui permettait pas d'avoir les revenus nécessaires pour prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, sanitaires, d'habillement, de logement et de scolarité de sa famille.Pour se libérer des griffes de ces usuriers, il décide d'ouvrir un compte à l'IMCEC.Il obtient un premier prêt de 250 000FCFA sur 12 mois qu'il parvient à solder en 3 mois seulement et l'institution lui laisse les intérêts des 9 mois. C'est ainsi que sa part de marché s’élargit si bien qu'il approvisionne deux usines de traitement de poisson basées dans la capitale non loin de sa localité. Il ambitionne d'ailleurs de s'engager dans l'exportation du poisson frais en Europe et aux USA.Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un deuxième prêt de 350 000FCFA afin de satisfaire la forte demande en achetant 03 caisses de badége noir et 03 caisses de "thiof".Les bénéfices tirés de cet investissement serviront non seulement à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille mais participeront aussi à l'atteinte de son objectif à court terme qui est d'acheter et de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who is father to two children. He has a fish trading business which he started seven years ago with loans from rich businessmen who actively back small fishing businesses. He has never been able to make consistent profits as a result of the exorbitant interest rates applied by his creditors. Furthermore he was under huge pressure because he had to pay all the money he took in the morning by the end of the day. This business did not give him sufficient income to provide for his family's food, health, clothing, lodging and schooling. In order to break free from these loan sharks' claws, he decided to open an account with IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual loan and savings institutions). He had a first loan of 250,000FCFA over 12 months which he managed to repay in just three months, and the institution left him the interest for the remaining nine months. His market share has thus grown so much that he supplies two fish-processing factories in the capital not far from his town. His ambition is moreover to get involved in the export of fresh fish to Europe and the USA. Today he is requesting a second loan of 250,000FCFA in order to satisfy strong demand by buying three crates of black "badèches" (a sea fish) and three crates of "thiof" (another fish, common in Senegal). The profits he makes from this investment will be used not only to provide for his family's needs but will also contribute to him achieving his short-term objective which is to buy and construct his own house.

loans.use: to buy 6 boxes of fresh local fish

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 23 years old and is married with one child who is 4 months and she takes care of 2 relatives. She earns a living by selling cloths such as: African women's cloths. This is her eighth year in this business. Her business is well-organized and she operates her business from 8 am until 7 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her. 

Chantal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more women African cloths for resale. By adding more African women's cloths and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, reinvest in her business and she will be able to build her own house for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more African women's cloths for resale.

loans.name: Anood

texts.en:
Anood from Madaba, Jordan is a 21-year-old single woman.

Anood is working at an accessories shop. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase fine quality perfumes and cosmetics so that she can book a stand at the shop to sell these products.

An aspiration of Anood's is to open her own cosmetics store.

loans.use: To purchase fine quality perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Ludia

texts.en:
Ludia is 49 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Ludia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that she will use the profits for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Masiata

texts.en:
Masiata is 40 years old and a married woman. She has three children. She has been a farmer in Mau-Narok for a period of six years with an income of about KES 6,000 per month.

She learned about KADET through KADET clients in her area of residence. She repaid the previous loan successfully without complications; this is her second loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Gulaga

texts.en: Gulaga is a hard-working man of 34. He's married and a loving father. His wife is a housekeeper. Gulaga has had his own cafe and has been preparing meals for three years. His food is delicious and he has a lot of customers to whom he strives to deliver a top-quality product. He serves clients with national food and tea. He's planning to renovate his cafe. He's seeking a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to renovate his cafe.

loans.name: Baida

texts.en:
Baida is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Baida requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repay his suppliers.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора добрая отзывчивая женщина. Она замужем имеет троих детей. Для содержания семьи она помогает мужу и на протяжении трех лет занимается продажей сухофруктов. На полученные доходы они завершили строительство дома. Она хочет получить займ  в размере 4000 сомни для оптового закупа сухофруктов Она надеется получить займ и закупить товар, также расширить свой бизнес и получить больше доходов.
texts.en: Gulnora is a kind and responsive woman.  She is married and has three children.  In order to support the family, Gulnora helps her husband and has been involved in selling dried fruits for three years.  They used their received earnings to complete the construction of their house.  Gulnora wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni for the wholesale purchase of dried fruits.  She hopes to get this loan and buy the products, and also expand her business and earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits wholesale

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina is 36 years old. She is married with 6 children. Dorina is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Dorina is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been in this business for three years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Dorina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dorina is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. This loan will be her tenth taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Cecil Mariela

texts.es:
Cecil emprendedora, tiene su propio negocio venta de ropas y variedades. Desempachándose como comerciante, su objetivo es ir cambiando poco a poco la infraestructura de la casa y con el préstamo a logrado realizarle mejoras a su vivienda. Algunas tiempo se baja las venta siendo de dificulta ya que es más lenta la recuperación de lo invertido pero no ha dejado de tener su negocio siendo fuente de ingreso.
Con este nuevo ciclo seguirá proyecta en cumplir la meta de ver mejorar, construida su casa por completo para brindarle comodidad y seguridad a su familia. Comprara: cerámica, cemento, caliceh, baricaoba y bondex plus para colocar azulejos al piso de la sala de la casa. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo  que le brinda para cumplir todos sus planes en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Cecil is an entrepreneur who has her own business selling clothes and variety of other merchandise. As she develops as a merchant, her goal is to gradually make changes to the infrastructure of her house. With this loan, she will be able to make improvements to her home. Sometimes she has low sales periods that are difficult for her because it takes more time to recover her investment. However, she does not plan to give up this business because it is a source of income.

With this new loan cycle, Cecil will continue with her project of completing improvements. She built this house so that she could provide comfort and security for her family. Cecil plans to buy ceramic tiles, cement, calcium carbonate, bari caoba wood, and joint compound so that she can lay down a floor in the living room of her house. She is grateful to the microfinance organization for the support it has provided so that she can finish all of the her plans that will benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles, cement, calcium carbonate, bari caoba wood, and joint compound in order install a floor.

loans.name: Marsha

texts.en:
Marsha is 40 years old. She is married with five children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marsha has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marsha requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Marsha has been in this business for 20 years. Marsha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní se unieron con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijos y familiares. La mayoría de ellas son jefas de familia, muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a día se sacrifican. Ellas ven en el programa de la fundación una gran oportunidad de progreso y de ayuda para cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Zonia, quien gracias a la venta de ropa que realiza ha podido salir adelante y ayudar al sustento de la casa. Ella comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio ya que siempre tiene muy buenas prendas. El sueño de ella es poder seguir creciendo y llegar a convertirse en una gran comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, ya que se acerca la época de calor y quiere abastecerse.
texts.en:
Thirteen women from the city of Santaní bonded together with hopes of getting ahead and helping their children and relatives. Most of them are the heads of their families, very hard working and fighters who make self sacrifices every day. They see in the communal bank program a great opportunity to progress and to help one another.

One of the members is Zonia, who, thanks to the sales from clothing, has been able to get ahead and help to provide the household expenses. She comments that she is doing well in her business and that she always has good clothes. Her dream is to be able to continue growing and to become a successful merchant. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy summer outfits, as the warm season is approaching and she wants to stock up.

loans.use: to buy summer outfits to sell later

loans.name: Mercy Marlene

texts.es:
Mercy Marlene tiene 30 años es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante  de la VRC TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.
Mercy Marlene se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz de ciclo corto. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la siembra de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar las semillas y demás productos sin ningún tipo de problemas y podrá aportar con dinero para el bienestar de la familia.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentar son las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. El sueño es tener maquinaria para poder trabajar en la tierra.

En el tiempo libre le gusta conversar.
texts.en:
Mercy Marlene, 30, is married and lives with her husband and son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) communal band located in Recinto San Luis de Zapotal belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming.

Mercy Marlene farms short cycle corn.  Her purchases and sales of farm products take place in Ventanas.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, urea and liquids for her corn crops.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy seeds and other products problem-free and will be able to contribute money toward her family’s wellbeing.

The challenges she faces are infestations, crop diseases and weather variations.  Her dream is to have machinery to work the land.  In her free time she likes to have conversations.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by fifteen entrepreneurs from the Dioulayel association of the village of Kolufifa in the southern Casamance region of Senegal. Represented by their leader Salimata Baldé, the group describes their business:

“Context of the project: Casamance is an enclosed region of Senegal. It has the potential to be rich, but is very poor. Its population is young with a majority of women, who are preponderant in the local economy and constitute the region’s engine of development.

Purpose of the loan: To give a boost to economic activities in the area and to allow the young women of the local area to stay on their land by creating income-generating activities.

Activities: A good area of land will be put to use cultivating sesame seeds, which will be turned into oil after harvest, and the women will make use of the seeds to make cookies which they will sell, and the seeds will also be consumed by the member’s families.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: La Casamance est une région enclavée du Sénégal. Elle est potentiellement riche mais très pauvre. Sa population est jeune avec une majorité des femmes qui sont prépondérantes dans l’économie locale et constituent le moteur du développement.

Objectifs du Prêt : Relance des activités économiques dans la localité, Fixer les jeunes femmes de la localité dans leurs territoires par la création d’activités génératrices de revenus.

Activités : Un bon périmètre de terre sera exploité en culture de sésame qui après récolte sera transformé en huile, et le céréale servira aux femmes de faire des gâteaux qu’elles vendrons et aussi au familles. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Sesame cultivation

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina is 27 years old and mother of one child. She had no education at all but has managed to learn hairdressing. She has been practising for the past 5 years in her community. A product of KRABAN'S TEACH learning ssssions, Ernestina has expressed much enthusiasm for using the KIVA loan assistance to improve her services to the numerous clients who patronise the shop.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 49, has five children and has been separated from her husband for 18 years. One of her daughter in laws works helping her husband and Mercedes cares after her daughter ( her granddaughter appears in the photo alongside her). She makes craftworks, specifically clothing. She purchases fabrics and then makes blouses, trousers, purses, and also embroiders them. She also works as a cook in a private home. With the loan, she will expand her business and to buy fabric and thread. She belongs to the group Laguna Azul (Blue Lake) 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

MERCEDES TIENE 49 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS, ESTA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO DESDE HACE 18 AÑOS, UNA DE SUS NUERAS TRABAJA PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO Y MERCEDES LE CUIDA A SU HIJA (SU NIETA, APARECE EN LA FOTO JUNTO A ELLA) SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA, COMPRA LA TELA (MANTA ) Y HACE CON ELLA BLUSAS, PANTALONES, BOLSAS, Y LUEGO LAS BORDA. TAMBIEN TRABAJA COMO COCINERA EN CASA PARTICULAR. CON EL CREDITO PRETENDE CRECER EL NEGOCIO COMPRANDO TELA E HILO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 1.

loans.use:
"Craftwork Sales."

VENTA DE ARTESANIA

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a case in which to exhibit products and invest in more products.

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en:
Virgina S. is twenty-six with four children; she lives with her husband in Fagalii-uta where they run their small business, a taxi service. Virginia used to struggle a lot back when she didn’t have a hope of supporting her family. Fortunately, when the S.P.B.D programme came to her area, she decided to get involved in it . Her husband does the taxi driving, spending most of his time, day and night time in the taxi. They earn almost two hundred tala (about US$ 80) a day and they are very happy about.

Virginia is thinking of expanding her business by having two other taxis sooner or later. She has nothing to worry about now. She has money to feed her children's hunger and put them in school. Her purpose for this loan is to buy tires, pay for licensing the car, petrol, etc.

loans.use: To purchase tires, petrol, and pay for licensing

loans.name: Georgina Altino

texts.pt:
Georgina is a widow. She has 5 children. Georgina’s children attend school. She would like to use the money to buy products for stocking her store. Georgina runs her business out of her home, in which she built a small shop where she sells her products. If the business does well, she plans to renovate her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Georgina e viuva. Ela tem 5 filhos. Os filhos de Georgina estao a estudar. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para comprar produtos para rechear a sua tenda. Georgina fza o seu negocio na sua residencia onde construiu a pequena tenda onde vende os produtos. Se o negocio correr bem, ela pensa reabilitar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Georgina would like use the money to buy products for her store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther Okaosro is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She sells provisions and drinks. She has 8 years of experience in business. She is in need of $450 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Hà, 37, is a TTYM member since 1999. She operates a restaurant that caters to the night passengers of the Môi Trường transportation company. Her restaurant is located right on route #3, in the town of Nỉ, one of the most lively towns of Sóc Sơn district. Her customers are in for a treat: the food is delicious and she has such a nice personality, always smiling. Ms Hà confides that she gets a lot of help from her husband who is a transport driver for a construction company. They have 2 children who are still going to school. Her revenue from the restaurant is 200 SD a month. Ms Hà requests a loan of 650 USD to buy food & beverage for her restaurant, to offer a better service to her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà, 37 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 1999. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là bán hàng ăn đêm cho lái xe của công ty Môi Trường đô thị. Cửa hàng của chị nằm ngay trên tuyến quốc lộ 3, tại phố Nỉ, một trong những khu phố sầm uất của huyện Sóc Sơn. Thật tuyệt vời khi được là khách hàng của chị Hà, không chỉ bởi những món ăn ngon mà còn bởi nụ cười lúc nào cũng thường trực gương mặt chị. Chị Hà tâm sự rằng, để tham gia tốt Quỹ Tình thương, chị đã có sự giúp đỡ rất lớn từ phía anh Tân, chồng chị. Anh đang là phụ xe chở vật liệu xây dựng tới các công trình, anh chị có hai con còn đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng là 200USD/tháng. Chị Hà dự định đề nghị chi nhánh cho vay mức 650USD để mua thực phẩm và đồ uống cho cửa hàng, phục vụ được nhiều khách hơn nữa.

loans.use: Buy food and beverage

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila has been a member of the community bank “Orquideas” for four years. In that time she has learned to be responsible and punctual. Lucila was encouraged to join the community bank by her sister and later encouraged her mom to become a member.

Lucila is 33 years old and has four children ranging from 13 years to 18 months. She has a business selling food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar as well as fruits and vegetables. She has owned this business for six years. Before that she rented rooms in her home but ran in to problems when borders often stayed out late and did not pay their rent on time. Lucila needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying more merchandise to sell; such as rice, sugar, and pasta.

Lucila’s dream is to own a big car so that she can transport all of her merchandise.

loans.use: Lucila needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying more merchandise to sell;  such as rice, sugar, and pasta.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio is a diligent working man who on a daily basis goes to his cultivations farms with the objective of observing the development of his vegetables, getting rid of weeds, and to suitably take care of their development. The possibility of selling his crop has helped this young man move around to different cities inside his country and to get to know a little more with respect to everyone of the businesses and their benefits. That is exactly the reason for why he has planned to continue working constantly in this business earning and soliciting loans. This is so he can increase his capital with the hopes of getting the small animals for the new establishment of his profession.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

SERGIO, es un hombre diligente y trabajador que día a día acude a sus campos de cultivo con el objetivo de observar el desarrollo de sus vegetales, limpiarlos de la maleza y abonarlos adecuadamente para su desarrollo.La posibilidad de comercialización han ayudado a este joven a desplazarse por distintas ciudades de su país y conocer un poco más acerca de cada uno de los negocios y los beneficios de los mismos; por esa razón ha planeado incursionar de manera constante en el negocio ganadero y solicita un préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo a fin de adquirir los animalitos para el nuevo establecimiento de su actividad.

loans.use: Increase of capital to get more products of his sowing and to establish sooner than later his new activity

loans.name: Sutaminingsih

texts.id:
The kiosk business, which Sutaminingsih runs in front of her house, is her main job. Her husband, Sujarwo, is a merchant who sells fish powder in Pesisir beach. When there is no fish powder, Sujarwo helps her wife taking care of the kiosk. Sutaminingsih's kiosk offers quite a complete range of merchandise. Many people around her neighbourhood and smaller kiosks are her regular customers. Sutaminingsih got a loan from DINARI for buying more merchandises. She sells rice, cooking oil, eggs, and various kitchen materials, snacks, and also stationaries. The kiosk opens from 6 am until 8 pm. Sutaminingsih usually purchases the merchandises twice a week. She can spend about Rp. 500,000 to Rp. 1,000,000 for the merchandises. Her net profit is Rp. 50,000 per day. She gets additional income from this business so she can use it for her daily expenses and her children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha Warung yang dikelola Sutaminingsih yang ada didepan rumahnya, merupakan usaha yang menjadi pekerjaan pokoknya. Suaminya, Sujarwo, adalah pedagang tepung ikan yang ada di daerah Pesisir pantai. Kalau tidak ada tepung ikan, Sujarwo ikut bergantian dengan istrinya untuk menunggui warungnya. Usaha warung Sutaminingsih sudah tergolong lengkap. Banyak penduduk disekitar tempat tinggalnya yang menjadi pelanggannya, bahkan banyak warung-warung kecil yang menjadi pelanggannya. Untuk mencukupi dan melengkapi barang dagangannya, Sutaminingsih mendapat pinjaman dana dari yayasan DINARI. Barang-barang yang disediakan warungnya yaitu beras, minyak goreng, telor dan segala macam kebutuhan dapur, aneka makanan ringan, peralatan tulis juga tersedia. Warung buka mulai pukul 06.00 pagi dan tutup pada pukul 20.00 malam.Untuk melengkapi barang dagangan biasanya Sutaminingsih berbelanja dua kali dalam satu minggu. Sekali berbelanja Sutaminingsih bisa menghabiskan Rp. 500.000.- s/d Rp.1.000.000.- Dengan keuntungan bersih Rp. 50.000.- dapat diraihnya dalam sehari. Dengan pekerjaan inilah Sutaminingsih dapat memperoleh pendapatan sehingga dapat untuk mencukupi keperluan sehari- hari dan juga keperluan sekolah dua orang anaknya selain dari penghasilan suaminya.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia is a decisive woman: Having observed her neighbors’ needs to enjoy sandwiches away from home at night, she decided to buy a small cooking cart and sell from the door of her home. She has worked hard in this role for two years and has been able to provide a lot of satisfaction. .

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Celia,| es una mujer decidida; luego de haber observado la necesidad de sus vecinos por degustar de algún bocadillo fuera de casa por la noche , decidió comprarse un carrito sanguchero y vender en la puerta de su casa. Lleva dos años desempeñándose en esta labor y ha podido albergar muchas satisfacciones.

loans.use: Capital to improve her selling conditions.

loans.name: Elsy

texts.en:
Elsy S. sells provisions and runs a restaurant. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Elsy and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi N. is now 39 years old. But she was only 33 when she joined Tinh Thuong Fund in 2002. Young as she was back then, she was very willing to venture into business. She discussed joining the Fund with her husband so that she could ask for a loan to invest into making "banh da"- Vietnamese's traditional pancake. Mrs. Dao used an initial loan of 2 millions VND to purchase necessary equipment for her business. And since she was the only "banh da" maker in her area at that time, her products were sold like hot cakes. Mrs. Dao plans to invest the next loans into making "banh da", which has been a stable source of income for her family. Mrs. Dao has two children, both of whom are still in school but one of them is now old enough to help her with her business. Her husband is a motorbike- driver, with an income of 2 millions VND per month. Combined together, her family income is about 5 millions VND per month. In the next loan period, she would like to borrow 15 millions VND. 

Translated from Vietnamese h by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Nụ 39 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2002 lúc đó chị còn rất trẻ 33 tuổi nhưng chị rất mạnh giạn làm kinh tế, chị đã bàn với chồng vào Quỹ tham gia vay vốn để đầu tư làm bánh đa, với vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị vay 2.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua đồ nghề, với nghề này tại địa phương chị hiện chưa có ai làm vì vậy sảm phẩm của gia đình chị bán rất chạy, vẫn dự án như vậy các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị tiếp tục đầu tư vào làm bánh, kinh tế gia đình ngày một phát triển, chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhập bình quân  2.000.000đ/ tháng, chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học, 1 con đã lớn có thể giúp chị trong công việc làm bánh. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào làm bánh đa. 
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Rogathe

texts.en:
Rogathe is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged fourteen, twelve, eight, and four. She began selling maize and beans in 2001. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Rogathe now hopes for a loan to buy more maize and beans to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans to increase her stock.

loans.name: Ileana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ileana, 44, operates a business selling and repairing home appliances. She lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has a daughter, 17, in college. At first, she sold food in Managua's Mayoreo market but because she is always on the look-out for for something better, she sold her stand with all its accessories and bought glass cases and electronic parts that she and husband were able to use in a shop that he already operated. That's how they came to work together. With the requested loan, Ileana will buy spare parts to meet the demands of her customers and ensure that they will always do business with her. Her dream, like any mother, is to be able to see her daughter settled in a professional career. That's why she's working very hard, so that she can pay the very expensive university fees.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Ileana a sus 44 años de edad, tiene un taller de electrodoméstico y venta de repuestos, actualmente habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua, es casada y tiene una hija de 17 años que está cursando la universidad, cuando comenzó vendía comida en el mercado del mayoreo, pero por razones de buscar siempre estar mejor vendió el tramo con todo sus accesorio y comenzó a invertir en compra vitrinas y repuestos electrónicos ya que le resultaba por que su esposo se encargaba del taller, y fue así como comenzó a trabajar en sociedad con su esposo. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en repuestos de electrónica para satisfacer los servicios que demandan sus clientes y poder retenerlos para que siempre trabajen con ellos. Su sueño como cualquier madre es poder ver a su hija convertida en una profesional, y por eso es que ahora trabaja más duro para poder pagar los estudios universitarios que son más caros.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for appliance store.

loans.name: Liliolevanu

texts.en: Liliolevao V., 42, is married with 7 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business of farming taro, yams, and bananas. She sells to the village and general public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Liliolevao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve business and help out with the family. Her husband and children do the plantation too.

loans.use: To improve business status and also to help buy tools

loans.name: Pouv

texts.en:
Mrs. Pouv N. is a villager in Ampil village in Takeo Province. She is 40-years-old, and the mother of two children: one works as a grocer, while the other takes care of the house and cooking for the family. Mrs. Pouv N. owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Eim Sokoeun (pictured on the left), is a motorbike driver who provides transport services for passengers and goods. Recently her husband has been facing difficulties because his motorbike is not running well, making him unable to work very efficiently.

Thus Mrs. Pouv N. decided to ask for a loan to buy her husband a new motorbike. She hopes this purchase will help increase her family’s income and improve their living conditions.
