loans.use: To buy her husband a new motorbike for his transport business.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en: Mrs H. lives in Quang Long commune, Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province. She is 34 years old and married, with two children. She has been a member of TYM since 2006. Her primary income is raising  pigs. Her husband is a construction worker, and their combined income makes the family economy stable. Tran Thi would like a loan of 5 millionVND ($300USD) to buy more pigs and feed.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and feed for her business

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: 29-year-old Seak V. resides in Banteay Meanchey Province. His wife takes good care of their young child. He owns a plot of land in his commune to run a garage. In early 2008, he opened a motorcycle/car wash service with several employees. He currently earns an income of approximately $10 a day which remains adequate to cover his family's living expenses. Mr. V. is requesting a loan to act upon his customers requests to re-decorate and re-design his existing garage.

loans.use: To improve garage

loans.name: Abad

texts.es: Abad es casado, tiene 32 años, vive en la casa de su suegro con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años, pronto se mudarán a su propia casa. Él es un hombre que no se dejó abatir por los problemas laborales, ya que en un momento no pudo conseguir empleo seguro y decidió crear su propia fuente de ingreso, abriendo una  tienda de abarrotes, a la que le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo, por la cual siente gran satisfacción de generarse sus propias ganancias. Abad atiende todos los días, incluidos los domingos, y junto a su esposa forman un equipo en la planificación y atención de su tienda,  cuyos planes  están siendo ejecutados; uno de ellos fue el de ampliar el espacio de su bodega y así lo hicieron, ahora su meta es abastecer de productos al por mayor. Es la quinta vez que Abad tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchos deseos de seguir adelante, además es de su agrado trabajar por esta modalidad de bancos comunales. El dinero que solicita se invertirá en la compra de mercadería; como leche, arroz y azúcar, por sacos, de esa manera no se verá afectado por el alza de precios de los alimentos. Los sacos están valorizados en 150 soles, cada uno de 50 kilos.
texts.en:
Abad is married, 32 years old, and lives with his wife and four-year-old son in his father-in-law’s house. They will soon move to their own house. Abad is a man who did not let problems with work beat him down. At one point in time he could not get steady work, so decided to create his own source of income by opening a grocery store. He devotes most of his time to this endeavor, and draws great satisfaction in generating his own profits. Abad is there every day, including Sundays. Together, he and his wife partner in planning and caring for the store, plans that are coming to fruition. One of those plans was to expand his stockroom space and they have done so. Now Abad’s goal is to stock up on products wholesale. This is the fifth time Abad has taken out a loan with MFP, and he is eager to move forward. He likes working with the banco comunal, a sort of business support group. The money that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandize, such as milk, and rice and sugar by the sack. Doing so provides a hedge against rising food costs. Each 50-kilogram sack costs 150 Peruvian soles.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in shop merchandise

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. T. wants to own a store. Today, she sells a variety of goods in the streets because she doesn't have a stall for her merchandise. She is 52 years old and has 9 children. Her husband, Ronieco D. T., is very supportive of her business. She previously worked as a fish dealer but did not like the work. She started a small business instead. “I started my business in 2000 with a limited investment of Php 5,000,” she said. “With hard work, I am able to sustain my business and support the needs of my family,” she added.

She is asking for a loan of Php 16, 000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. She believes the loan will greatly help her earn bigger profits.

CEVI is helping Virginia achieve her dreams. CEVI gives their clients credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to help them grow their business.

loans.use: Buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
S. Mehriniso is 46 years old, she lives with her spouse, and works every day starting very early in the morning so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her 6 children successfully finish school and enter University. Her business is located in the central market of Dushanbe and she sells clothes for women. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of $ 900 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama F. is a fifty two year old divorced mother of four children, one male and three females. One of her children is in senior high and another is in junior high school. The rest are learning trades. She is the sole provider for the children and lives with them in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Ama works very hard to provide for her children and the entire family. She sells both washing and toilet soap, which she procures from big shops in her community and sells at a small kiosk. Ama says she also approaches houses to sell her products. Ama has been in this business for two years. She wants a loan to procure more cartons of soap and hopes to give her children all the financial support she can offer them.

loans.use: To buy cartons of soap

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en:
Isoken I. sells kerosene. She is a 65-year-old widow with 6 children.

She needs a loan of 120,000 NGN (825 USD) to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima is a vendor of different commodities in her village. She displays them in front of her house. Some of her products are vegetables, fruits, barbecue sticks and snacks. She is 50-years old and a resident of Barangay Estefania in Iguig, Cagayan. She has three children: Ricky - 28 years old; Jay-Pee - 20 years old and Rocky -16 years old. All of her children completed elementary school but have not been interested in pursuing further studies.

Aside from vending, she also raises hogs for extra income. She wants to further develop her farming business. She hopes to avail herself of a loan of 12,000 PHP that she can use to make her business grow. She believes that this loan will be of great help in maintaining her small businesses.

loans.use: To invest in vending and farming businesses

loans.name: Alishah

texts.en: Alishah S. is a 50-year-old trader on a pension who has his own food store. He has 12 years of experience in this field. He is married and has two children. He would like to purchase more food products to increase his income. For this purpose, he applied for a 1500 USD loan.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Abduhoshim

texts.ru: Абдухошим – мужчина средних лет (36 лет), женат и отец 1-го ребенка. У Абдухошима есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 35 овец и 15 коз. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти. Абдухошим каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Абдухошима пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Абдухошим за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Абдухошим очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Abduhoshim is a middle-aged man (36 years old), is married, and the father one child. Abduhoshim has a flock of livestock consisting of approximately 35 sheep and 15 goats. His wife is a housewife and processes wool in her spare time. Every morning, Abduhoshim drives the herd to the mountains, grazes them, and drives them back in the evening. Currently, Abduhoshim does not have enough cattle, but Abduhoshim wants to use this loan to buy two average bulls. After fattening them for three to four months, he can sell them for very good price. Abduhoshim is very glad to work with us because the loans help him very much.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and selling livestock

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
X. Phạm Thị is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Ninh Giang, Vietnam.  She is married and has 2 adult children. To earn a living, X. owns and operates a restaurant, serving a variety of meals to customers in the local community. X. has been involved in this business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2,600,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, X. joined the TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan from the TYM Fund, which she used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. X. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be invested in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from the TYM Fund. X. plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her restaurant business.

loans.name: Babi Berna’S  Group

texts.en:
Berna is a leader of 4 members of the group.  She is a 33 year married woman with three children between 10 and 16 years old.  She rents a two room house where she is staying with six people (Berna takes care of additional family members). There is electricity but no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.  Berna is a poultry farmer in Bakuli, one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transport to and from shopping from Kampala and goes for shopping twice a week.  She sells to about 20 people a day, mainly women .She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees for her children.  She has been in this business for the last seven years. Berna has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. Besides poultry farming, Berna sells second-hand clothes at her home and is a property agent She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed and chicks. Berna aspires to see her business grow bigger and also to complete her house which will also work as her business place.

.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty L. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Betty owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In July 2009, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Betty is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: N. Eva is a married business lady of twenty-five years old. She owns a drug shop known as Mwebaza drug shop. Her drug shop business is located at Kijjabwemi village in Masaka district. N. began her business in the year 2005. She is using the loan to purchase more and various types of drugs (medicine) in her shop to meet the recommended needs of drugs to the patients. Her future hope is to extend or expand on her business that is her drug shop into a big clinic where she wants to buy machines like heart pampers, microscopes and other drugs so that she can be able to meet the demands of her clients. With this, she will be able to increase on her profits and on her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more and various types of drugs (medicine) in her shop to meet the recommended needs of drugs to the patients.

loans.name: Valle Hermoso Group

texts.es: Es un grupo  antiguo, y  a partir del anterior ciclo marcharon muy bien sin problemas en sus pagos , formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio,  que se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "VALLE HERMOSO", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su  8º Ciclo y esta organizado de la siguiente manera como presidenta la señora Carmen L. de C., quien dirige al grupo,  y a partir de su ingreso como presidenta el grupo mejoro bastante,  tiene 5 hijos y solo mantiene a dos de ellos, el credito lo utiliza para mantenimiento de su auto, como taxi de linea fija, lo conduce su esposo. Como tesorera esta la socia Claudia C., una socia muy responsable y ademas  maneja y conoce bien el dinero, ella trabaja con taxi de linea fija, es soltera y conduce su movilidad, el credito lo utiliza para compra de accesorios y llantas para su movilidad, ella vive y colabora a sus padres. Como Secretaria del grupo esta la socia Janeth B. R., socia nueva en el grupo, responsable, tiene 2 hijos, vive en alquiler ayuda al esposo en su trabajo, trabaja en taxi de linea fija (llamado en Bolivia "Trufi"), tambien utulizan el credito para mantenimiento de su auto, ella siempre esta presente en las reuniones.
texts.en:
This is an older group. Since their last loan, things have gone very well without any problems with their payments. This is a group of women that live in the same neighborhood. Their group is called, "Valle Hermoso" (Beautiful Valley), where the communal bank is on its eighth loan. In terms of their income, the group has improved considerably. The president of the group has 5 children, but only 2 of them are still her dependents. She will use the credit for maintenance on her car, since she has a taxi that her husband drives. The treasurer is Claudia C., a very responsible member who also manages and knows money very well. She has a taxi as well, and she is single and drives it herself. She will use the credit for accessories and wheels for her car. She lives with and helps out her parents. The secretary is Janeth B. R., a new member in the group. She is responsible and has two children. She lives in a rented home and helps her husband with his work. He has a taxi (which is called a Trufi in Bolivia. They will also use the credit to maintain their car. She always attend the group's meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair their taxis

loans.name: Senior

texts.en:
Senior, as she is called, is 52 years-old and married with six children. All her children are in school in the community development school. Senior is a petty trader and sells items such as cooking oil, yams, plantains, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes and bags of rice. These products sell very fast and she easily recovers her capital in order to buy new stock. Senior takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi.

With her six years experience in her business she now wants to add other food items which are frequently demanded by her customers such as maize and eggs. She believes that this can be possible with the help of this loan and she plans to use the loan to buy bags of raw materials. She is also convinced that the loan will help increase her stock in the event of a price hike.

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Neri Olga

texts.es:
La señora Neri es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 02 hijos, vive en el centro poblado de Pusuyo, estudio educación secundaria incompleta (4to grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá aumentar su capital en su actual negocio de trasporte urbano, dice que con ello pagara el SOAT, la señora Neri tambien se dedica a la elaboracion de artesanias.

Su mayor deseo es darles una profesión a sus hijos

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para pago de SOAT.

loans.name: Leilita

texts.en:
Leilita E. is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City. She is 35 years old. Leilita is single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leilita owns and operates a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling variety of products in the local community. Leilita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leilita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leilita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leilita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 55 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo, su hija y sus nietos. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y amistosa que se dedica al tejido D. chompas, las cuales venD. por pedido a los diversos clientes que tiene en la zona en la que vive. 

Además D. esta actividad también se dedica a atender la bodega que tiene en su casa, la cual puso en asociación con su hija, para así apoyarse mutuamente en la generación D. más ingresos económicos.
Es así que Teodora se dedica paralelamente a los dos negocios, tejiendo mientras atienD. su bodega y lo hace D. lunes a domingo, ya que es muy demandada por los clientes que día a día se acercan a adquirir sus productos que son muy variados. 
A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le da cierta libertad para poder valerse por sí misma sin depender del sueldo D. su esposo. En un futuro le gustaría hacer crecer su bodega para así generar mayores ingresos a su familia.

Teodora es una clienta muy antigua en MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en sus pagos, sintiéndose muy orgullosa por ello. Con el dinero que ahora solicita abastecerá su tienda con productos más variados y así implementarla D. una mejor manera para captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Teodora, 55, lives in her own house with her husband, daughter, and grandchildren. She is a very happy and friendly woman. She makes sweaters, which she sells by order to the diverse customers that she has in the area where she lives. In addition to this activity, she also tends a convenience store, which she has in her house. She set up the store with her daughter in order to support each other in generating more income. That is how Teodora works simultaneously in two businesses. She weaves while she works in the store. She does this Monday through Sunday. Her various products are in much demand by her customers. They come to the store day to day to get her products. She really likes her work. It gives her a certain amount of freedom and the ability to believe in herself without being dependent upon her husband’s salary. In the future she would like to make her store grow in order to generate greater income for her family. Teodora is a long time client of MFP. She has always been characterized by the punctuality of her payments, and she is very proud of that. She will use the money she is now asking for to stock her store with a greater variety of products. That way the store will be set up better in order to get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up her store with food

loans.name: Shernazar

texts.en:
A. Shernazar raises and sells cattle. He is 23 years old, married and has two kids. He purchases cattle in the central market, feeds and cares for them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Shernazar has been in this business for five years – thanks to his father who is a farmer and taught him a lot. He is an expert at choosing and caring for the animals. He gets up at five o'clock every morning to feed the cows and look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful, but his family is still quite poor because of the high prices they have to pay for everything.

Shernazar applied for a loan of $1500 US to purchase more cattle to expand his business. You could become an important part of his family's life. Shernazar deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ayda Lina

texts.es: La señora Ayda Lina tiene 55 años de edad, es casada con 4 hijos mayores de edad. La señora tiene una mini tienda ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual además de vender vestuario también vende zapatos, joyas, ropa de niño, etc. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 12 años, primeramente su mama tenía una pulpería y fue la que la indujo a tener su negocio propio, ya que a través de ese negocio la señora mantenía a sus hijos. Allí fue que la señora se armó de valor y empezó a vender primeramente ropa al crédito, por encargo y poco a poco se fue haciendo de un inventario grande. Comentaba la señora que a pesar de la crisis económica sufrida por el país, no le ha afectado tanto ya que de un tiempo para acá empezó a vender solamente a contado y no a crédito y pese a que ella tiene bastante clientela ha logrado mantener el volumen de sus ventas. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  mayor cantidad de mercancías para surtir más el negocio ahora que se acerca la época navideña. Su meta siempre ha sido construir un local más grande y apropiado para su negocio, ya que actualmente utiliza la sala de su casa.
texts.en:
Ayda Lina is 55, married, and has four adult children. She has a mini store, which is located in her house. Besides selling clothing, she also sells shoes, jewelry, and children’s clothes, etc. She started this business 12 years ago. First, her mother had a mini market. She was the one who introduced her to having her own business. The woman supported her children through this business. That is where, armed with courage, she started to sell primarily clothes by order on credit. Little by little she was getting a large inventory. She says that in spite of the economic crisis that the country has suffered, it has not affected her so much. A while back she started selling for cash only, no credit. Because she has plenty of customers, she has been able to maintain her volume of sales. The loan is to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to stock her business more now that the Christmas season is getting closer. Her goal has always been to build a larger and more appropriate place for her business. She currently uses the living room of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Cette femme a à sa charge 02 enfants. Elle est veuve et assure aux besoins de ses enfants grâce à ses activités de coiffure. En effet, elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure depuis 1999  et dispose de nombreuses clientes qui apprécient la qualité de son travail. En cette période de fin d’année, elle a besoin de renouveler son stock de mèches ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 cartons de mèches. Le reste du prêt servira à couvrir d’autres frais.
texts.en:
Adjovi V. L. is responsible for two children. She is a widow and is able to provide for her children thanks to her hairdressing business. She opened her salon in 1999 and does the hair of many clients who appreciate the quality of her work. During this time, at the end of the year, she needs to refresh her supply of hair extensions. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan from WAGES, to purchase 15 boxes of hair extensions. The remaining funds from the loan will serve to cover her other expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products for a salon

loans.name: Liahona Group

texts.en: Kingsley is a 47-year-old man. He is married and has three children. All of his children are in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Kingsley is a trader. He runs a cold store where he sells fish. He is the leader of a trust bank group called Liahona. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Kingsley, the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his store

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora J. is from the village of Marapong. She is 57 years old. Nora is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Nora has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Nora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Nora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Nora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 24-year-old gentleman who operates a grocery shop in Naivasha town. He sells onions only, and this he has done for the past three years

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy more onions to sell as he has already received large delivery orders.

His future hope is to get more and bigger distributorship deals for onions in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy morre onions for sale

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus M. is single and 27 years old. Justus lives in Kilifi where he owns a quarry in an area called Maweni. He has been a major supplier of stone to his area residents for two years. Justus also has a secondary business where he operates a retail shop in the area, selling household goods.

Justus is not very old in KADET and this borrowing marks his first loan to finance his business. He plans to expand his quarry and to purchase quarry equipment. He also plans to increase the stock of flour, sugar and cooking oil in his retail shop. He hopes that his quarry business will be able to expand and be able to meet the demands from the constructors around the area.

He also hopes to diversify his business further into different fields.

loans.use: To expand his quarry, purchase quarry equipment, and to increase the stock of flour, sugar and cooking oil for his retail shop.

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “25 de Julio” es una de las más antiguas del Centro Focal de Santiago, ya esta en su ciclo Nº 27 . Los negocios de las socias son diferentes: costura, venta de medias, carpintería, artesanìa, comerciante de Interiores, venta de calzados, ropa, pan y vajilla.
La Presidenta Juana A. C., refiere que se encuentra trabajando en Pro Mujer desde el año 1997.  Comenta con nostalgia que el proceso de capacitación fue largo, utilizaban la plaza de la zona de Santiago II para reunirese, su primer crédito fue de Bs.500.-  en ese entonces todo era nuevo y Pro Mujer estaba aún muy jóven.  La señora Juana actualmente tiene negocio de compra - venta de calzado, durante estos años a tenido crédito por diferentes montos de acuerdo a sus necesidades, actualmente está solicitando Bs. 2000.-.
En lo personal ella refiere que tiene 6 hijos y que hace unos años quedó viuda, razón por la cual debe trabajar con mayor energía.
texts.en:
The July 25th Communal Association is one of the oldest groups from the Santiago Community Center. They are already on their 27th loan cycle. The different businesses of the members are as follows: sewing, selling stockings, carpentry, handicrafts, interior design, shoe sales, bread, and dinnerware.

Juana A. C., the President of the group, has been working with Pro Mujer since 1997. She remembers with nostalgia that the training process was long back when they used to meet at the town square in the Santiago II District. Her first loan was for 500 BOB, back when everything was new and Pro Mujer was still a young organization. Sra. Juana currently has a business buying and selling shoes. Over the years, she has had loans of different amount based on her needs. She is currently asking for 2000 BOB.

On a personal note, she references her six children. She became a widow a few years ago, so she has to work with greater energy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes in different sizes & colors

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Baljinnyam operates a meat-trading business with his wife in his home province. He has been operating his business since 2004, and has steadily expanded the business. He has a loyal customer base and has been cooperating with small restaurants. He purchased a plot of land with a yard and a new car for his family with his business profits.

The most important thing to Baljinnyam is being able to provide for his children's education. He says, “I would like to provide a good education for my children. I have been planning to support my children when they study in a university.”

Baljinnyam is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of meat before prices rise.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a forty-seven-year-old mother of three children. She has been living in Bourj el Barajneh, which is in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Fatima has been selling saj bread for twelve years. A saj is the metal oven used to make saj bread; it is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome. The saj is used to make several types of bread, including markouk (thinned) bread and doughy confections, or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza; the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but it somehow tastes better in the morning. For the first time, Fatima has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw material for her saj, as well as to purchase a refrigerator for her work. Fatima is very well known in her region for her good and tasty saj. She is also a good cook in general, but she decided to focus on the saj because it is demanding. When she first started her business, she wanted to improve her family’s income, but now that she has been working, she is glad that she has independent work. For the future, she plans to keep on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her saj and a refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian C. is from the village of Matuga Bajo Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Vivian is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Vivian has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide transportation services. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Vivian from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transportation services

loans.name: Maria  Transito

texts.es:
María Tránsito O. es una mujer de  55 años, casada y  madre de ocho hijos de los cuales una hija es casada y vive independiente,  cuatro de sus hijos trabajan y ayudan muy poco en la economía de su hogar porque lo más utilizan para sus gastos personales, los otros tres hijos se encuentran estudiando en la escuela y colegio de la localidad, su esposo de profesión albañil y  gracias al esfuerzo de su unión conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.


Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de granos cocinados en el mercado 12 de abril hace 10 años y trabaja todos los días de domingo a domingo  en su puesto propio, es socia del Banco Comunal Las Caleras hace mucho tiempo ubicado en el sector Virgen del Milagro en la ciudad de Cuenca al centro sur del país donde se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza en todo su esplendor como sus paisajes naturales, los ríos que atraviesan la ciudad su gente y su cultura.  Con su nuevo crédito comprará mote, fréjol, arveja, habas, etc.  por quintales para  abaratar costos y seguir con su negocio.

Su meta es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Transito O. is a 55 year old woman, married, with 8 children of which one daughter is married and lives on her own, 4 work and help very little with household expenses as they use it mostly for themselves, and the other 3 are still in school. Her husband is a construction worker and thanks to their hard work they have been able to build their own home. She sells all types of cooked grains and the April 12th Market and has done so for 10 years; she works every day Sunday to Sunday in her own stand. She has been a long-time member of the Las Caleras village bank located in the Virgen del Milagro area of the city of Cuenca in the south central part of the country. It is a region known for its natural beauty with many amazing natural landscapes and rivers that pass through the city. With this loan, she will buy wheat, beans, peas, and green beans, etc. in large quantities in order to get better pricing. Her goal is to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat, beans, peas, and green beans, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: EL SR. JULIO VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE SAN JOSE COMUNIDAD DE LA GUARDIA DISTANTE 25 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, PADRE DE UN HIJO, ES DE OCUPACION TRANSPORTISTA( TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS ), PERTENECIENTE A LA LINEA DE TRANSPORTE DE LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO, SE ESTA RECUPERANDO ECONOMICAMENTE YA HACE UNOS AÑOS TUVO UN ACCIDENTE DE TRANSITO DE CONSIDERACION,  POR TAL MOTIVO VENDIO PARTE DE SU CASA PARA SALIR UN POCO ADELANTE, EL SR. JULIO ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE ESTA VELANDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE LA FAMILIA YA QUE EL SOLO MANTIENE EL HOGAR Y DESPUES DEL ACCIDENTE PASARON MALOS MOMENTOS COMO FAMILIA PERO SOBRELLEVARON LOS PROBLEMAS Y SALIERON ADELANTE POR LO CUAL EL SE SIENTE AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION POR DARLE LA OPORTUNIDAD DE LEVANTARSE ECONOMICAMENTE.
texts.en:
Julio lives in San Jose in the La Guardia community. It is 25 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He has one child. He is a driver (transports passengers). He is a member of the El Torno transportation line. He is recovering economically. Some years ago he had a serious traffic accident. He sold part of his house in order to get a little ahead. Julio is a responsible and hard-working person. He is always looking out for the well-being of his family. He maintains his home by himself. After the accident the family experienced some bad times. But, they overcame the problems caused by the serious accident, and got ahead. He is grateful to the institution for giving him the opportunity to lift himself up economically.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. has been involved in farming for more than 21 years now. She is a 60-year-old married woman from the town of Sto. Niño. She has four grown-up children. Teresita plants and harvests rice crops that she sells in the local market. She owns her own carabao (water buffalo) that helps in her farming. She also raises some pigs and chickens.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be her ninth loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah G. is from the village of Kinura in the municipality of Kalilangan in Bukidnon Province. She is 34 years old. Leah is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Leah owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products in the local community. Leah has been engaged in her business for over 3 years, and she earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kikanae Ole

texts.en:
Kikanae Ole R. is 24 years old. He is a married to Susan R. and he is a father of one child. He also supports three other members of his family. Kikanae is a farmer. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last five years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already registered as a member in KADET. This will be his first loan. He plans to spend fifteen thousand to plough, ten thousand on harrowing, fifteen thousand on seeds, and ten thousand on planting his ten acres with wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by acquiring more land to increase his wheat production.
.
Kikanae's dream is do large-scale farming and buy his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking young man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds, and to harrow and plough his farm

loans.name: Kabirizi Kwetungura B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
A respectful and very hardworking B. Vianah, aged 35 years, is a married mother of two children.

Vianah operates a retail shop business from Kabirizi Trading centre selling general merchandise, especially items for home use, like basins, jerrycans, cups, buckets, groceries, sugar, salt and more. She started this business four years ago using her tea-growing sales business and, at the end of every month, she is able to pocket profits to the tune of 160,000 Ugandan shillings.

Vianah’s main drawback has been having a small stock in her business that cannot match the purchasing rate of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan that she figures will help her to stock more goods that will satisfy the customers’ high demand and also transform her enterprise into a big enterprise.

Being very committed to the business with good customer care, Vianah hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in her business and enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for her family’s requirements especially to fulfill her dream of educating her children.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Kihihi, Vianah from  Uganda

loans.use: To restock her business with items like sugar, drinks, salt, and so on

loans.name: Filmen

texts.en:
Filmen L. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he provides hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately $180 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Filmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This will be his 1st loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide his services

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan runs a cyber café to earn a living. He has been running the business for six years and has two employees. He also sells cereals to supplement his family’s income.

Jonathan is a member of Ushindi Kala group in Faulu Kenya which has guaranteed his loan of 40,000 KES. He will use the loan to buy more chairs, tables and printer paper.

Jonathan hopes to expand the business and be in a position to educate his four children. In ten years, he wants to have more business outlets in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, tables and printer paper

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
la señora Maria Julia R. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Zope.
durante estos años a trabajado en su negocio para poder sacar adelante su familia, el esposo se dedica a la pesca artesanal, juntos se ayudan con los gastos del hogar.
Maria actualmente se dedica a vender abarroteria, frescos, jugos, agua, pollo y pescado en su pequeña pulperia.
Maria y su esposo no tienen hijos que dependen de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria ya que quiere surtir mas su pulperia y asi y obtener mejores ganancias.
su proyecto a corto plazo es la recontruccion de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Julia R. is 46 years old. She lives in the village of El Zope. For years she's worked at her business to be able to help her family get ahead. Her husband is a fisherman and together they cover the home expenses. Currently Maria sells groceries, soft drinks, juices, water, chicken, and fish in her small general store. Maria and her husband don't have children that depend on them. The loan will be used to stock her store with groceries in order to increase her income. Her short-term goal is to remodel her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soap, butter, oil, margarine, rice, sugar, coffee, beans, bread, cookies, soup, soft drinks, juice, cereal, oatmeal, candles, matches, and batteries

loans.name: Ivan Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ivan;   el tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero;  El socio se dedica al transporte el socio tiene su unidad vehicular que presta servicio de transporte en la ruta Pachacutec, el  socio requiere el préstamo para mantenimiento de sus vehículo. El socio solicita el dinero para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehiculo.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “MUJERES UNIDAS” ["Women United"] communal bank. The communal bank is located in the San Sebastián district, in the province and department of Cusco.

His name is Ivan, and he is 22 years old and single. He works in the field of transportation; he has a vehicle which he uses to provide transportation services on the Pachacutec route. The borrower needs the loan to carry out maintenance on his vehicle. He is requesting the money to invest in maintenance for his vehicle. 

The borrower appreciates and values the loan provided to him in this way, and accordingly, he is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: Investing in maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D. is currently in the business of selling food items like maize flour, cassava, etc.,  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour to sell.  Agnes is 37 years old and is married to a policeman. She has eight children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente. Reside junto a sus padres en el sector urbano del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a media hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que tiene instalada en su domicilio ubicado en una de las calles céntricas de su distrito. Su negocio ya tiene más de cinco años de antigüedad y debido a ello cuenta con una clientela fiel que prefiere la calidad de productos que brinda y el buen trato que ofrece.

Delicia desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos con los cuales pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos por ventas. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder sacarlos adelante y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Delicia is 44 years old and has1 dependent son. She is a single mother and lives with her parents in the urban sector of Mochumi district, a farming community located in Lambayeque province, half an hour by road from Chiclayo city. 

Delicia sells basic household goods and groceries in a general store set up in her house, which is on a centrally located street in her district. Her business is already more than 5 years old and has a loyal customer base because of the high quality of the products Delicia stocks, and the good customer service she offers.

She wishes to expand her business by acquiring more products to meet the needs of her customers and thus increase her sales income. For this reason she has found it necessary to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 PEN, which will help her achieve her goal.

Delicia is a very responsible woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life through her work.

loans.use: Purchase of basic household goods and groceries to expand business.

loans.name: Juvenal Angel

texts.es: El Sr.  Juvenal de 32 años y de estado civil soltero, tiene ya varios años dedicándose a la venta y comercialización de ropa, actividad que realiza para ayudar a sus padres a seguir adelante ya que ellos son personas ya de la tercera edad. Juvenal cuenta con un puesto en el Mercado y además de aquello cuenta con un puesto en la populosa Feria. A raíz de la creciente demanda Don Juvenal se vio en la necesidad de acudir a nuestra institución ya que le es imprescindible el poder adquirir más mercadería para los meses venideros ya que la influencia de gente en los distintos Mercados y Ferias se triplica. Don Juvenal presenta un buen historial de deudas en las diferentes instituciones donde ha trabajado y además de aquello cuenta con domicilio conocido en el B. Amboró del Sur de nuestra ciudad, razón por la cual no se le negó dicho crédito el Comprara mercadería por fardo de camisas.
texts.en: Mr. Juvenal, age 32 and single, already has several years experience selling and marketing clothing. He does this activity to help his parents to continue moving forward, since they are already quite old. Juvenal counts on his job in the market, and besides that, he counts on his job in the crowded Fair. Due to the growing demand, Mr. Juvenal saw the need to turn to our institution. For him, the power to acquire more merchandise is indispensable for the upcoming months, since the influence of people in different markets and fairs will triple. Mr. Juvenal presents a good record of debts in the different institutions where he has worked. Besides that, he counts on his well-known address in the "B. Amboró del Sur" ["B. Amboró of the South"] in our city, which is the reason he does not neglect the said loan. He will buy merchandise in the form of bundled shirts.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shirts to sell as merchandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widow with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a clothes-selling business for over three years, selling at retail and from home to her neighbors. Florence faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mr. Men M. (in the photo) is 50 years old and his wife, Mrs. Ream Mom, is 45 years old.  They have been married since 1988 and have four children  – two sons and two daughters. Two work in a garment factory and other two are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road number five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ream is a rice farmer.  Men is a fisherman and construction worker. He also assists his wife in the farming business. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for use on their rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase motorized hand tiller for rice farm

loans.name: María Maricela

texts.es:
La Señora. María M. es socia del banco comunal 12 de Abril, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, cuenta con su centro histórico el mismo que en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrado  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

La Señora María es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija   estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija esta en una escuela de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre en la que viven arrendando y ayuda en la economía de su hogar.
 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de jugos en un mercado de la ciudad, lleva realizando esta labor hace 14 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en el que trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas, de bebidas como maltas para la realización de sus jugos. Su meta es  crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
María M. is a member of the '12 de Abril' community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is well known for its natural beauty.  Its historic center was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  The people in the city maintain its traditions and culture.

María is a single mother who has 2 children aged 12 and 8.  Her eldest daughter is in middle school and her youngest is in elementary school.  They don't have their own home but live in her mother's house.  They pay her mother rent and help with the household finances.

María's business is selling juice in a market in the city.  She has been in this business for 14 years.  She has her own stall in which she works from Sunday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 5.00pm.

María has been a member of her community bank for 2 years.  She will invest her loan money in buying fruit and malt drinks for making her juices.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy fruit and drinks

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: U. is currently in a busines of selling kimbo, suko and beans. She is 25 Years old, married to a mechanic with six children and four of them go to school. U. borrowed a loan to stock more kimbo, suko and beans.  She hopes to increase her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more kimbo, suko and beans to sell.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana V., 32, is married and supports her family by operating two business ventures: ready-to-wear clothes and motorcycle transport. She lives in Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her ready-to-wear clothes and transport businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,500. 

Emeliana is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase a motorcycle. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Emeliana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To use as downpayment on a motorcycle

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard T. is from the village of Turod, Quezon, Isabela. He is 28 years old. Richard is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Richard owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Richard has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Richard joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richard is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Richard from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mary Grace's Group

texts.en:
Mary Grace V. is from the village of Nampicuan. She is 33 years old. Mary Grace is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Mary Grace V.".

Mary Grace is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Grace owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mary Grace joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 32,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Mary Grace from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en: Avetik M. lives with his wife in Dashtadem village, Armenia. Avetik’s children are married and have settled in Russia where they can have jobs and earn sufficient income to raise their families.  Avetik and his wife keep a fruit orchard growing world-famous and delicious Armenian apricot, apple and walnut trees. He also keeps a cattle farm and 15 beehives, and cultivates 1 hectare of land.  Both his sons try to help their father financially, and their father and grandfather enjoy sharing the fruit produced on their orchard with the children and grandchildren by sending them to cold Russia to remind them of  the taste of delicious fruits from sunny Noah’s land.  To diversify his source of revenue, Avetik has applied for a loan to increase his number of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle for his farm

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is 31 years old and lives in the Cocotomey district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. Together with her husband Florent, she looks after their three children, all of whom are schooled.

For the past seven years, Roselyne has run a general store outside her home. This is her second loan with ALIDE, following successful repayment of the first, and it will allow her to purchase charcoal, oil, and foods for resale from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock the store with charcoal, cooking oil, and foods

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 62 years old and is married with seven children.  For a living, he runs a bookshop.  He also rents out houses to earn a living.  William was previously employed as a teacher.  He went into business so that he would get enough income to meet his family’s needs.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy books and stationery.

loans.use: to buy books and stationery

loans.name: Duishonaly

texts.en:
Duishonaly A. is 62, married and has six grown children. He worked as a teacher at the local school and is known as a responsible and open-hearted person.  Now he is on pension and in order to cover the expenses of his household, he decided to engage in cattle breeding.  Duishonaly started this business with the help of his first loan from Bai Tushum in 2008 and managed to develop a farm with 2 horses, 23 sheep, 12 goats and 3 milk cows. With the revenues, he was able to build a barn at the village outer territory, where he pastures his cattle until the first snow. 

Duishonaly has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cattle. It will allow him to increase the number of animals and further broaden his business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lucy Marlene

texts.es:
Lucy es una señora de 42 años de edad  y  vive en el distrito de Chiclayo – Lambayeque. Lucy es  conocida por ser una persona alegre y trabajadora y sobre todo amable con los demás, siempre dispuesta a ayudar.

Lucy se dedica a la venta de ropa, específicamente de prendas de vestir para fiesta (gala), ella tiene experiencia en su rubro y cuenta con un puesto fijo en una feria de variedades muy conocida de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lucy  solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles,  para invertir en la compra de mercadería (vestidos) que sus clientes le han pedido. Lucy necesita hacer una renovación de mercadería, para contar con mayor variedad de esta, es decir mayores ventas y clientes satisfechos.

Lucy solicita el préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa porque no desea recurrir a préstamos indirectos  o  prestamistas informales. Es una cliente con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the District of Chiclayo-Lambayeque. She is known for being a cheerful and hardworking person. Above all, she is kind to others and always willing to help.

Lucy sells clothing, specifically party gowns. She has experience in this field and an established location at one of the most well-known variety fairs in the city of Chiclayo.

Lucy is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 PEN. She will invest in the purchase of merchandise (dresses) that her customers have ordered. Lucy needs to restock her inventory so that she will have a greater variety to satisfy her customers and to generate more sales.

Lucy requested her loan from Edpyme Alternativa because she did not want to borrow through indirect channels or from informal lenders. She is a client who possesses good personal and work-related references.

loans.use: to purchase dresses to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Angela Maura

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 35 años  de edad, es madre soltera de cinco hijos de 18, 13, 11, 10 y 6 años de edad, dos de sus hijos estudian en colegio y los dos menores en escuela, lo que para nuestra amiga resulta una gran carga ya que ella es padre y madre a la vez.

Ella tiene dos negocios, vende  agua en bidón y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días, el agua lo vende en su casa aunque a veces también entrega a domicilio y los productos por catálogos  los vende puerta a puerta los mismos que  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Sus hijos le ayudan en sus ventas sobretodo en las entregas a domicilio. Sus productos los recibe en su casa. Tiene tres años que se dedica al comercio y le va muy bien tanto que le ha ayudado para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y agua en bidón. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque le han ayudado mucho con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar mejor sus ventas.
texts.en:
The members of the “Marianita de Jesús” communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez noted for its beaches, its rich cuisine and the warmth of its people.

We met Ángela, 35, here.  She’s a single mother of five children who are 18, 13, 11, 10 and 6 years of age.  Two of her children go to high school and the two youngest are in elementary school which is quite a burden for our friend since she’s both father and mother at the same time.

She has two businesses.  She sells large jugs of water and Yanbal products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies’ accessories).  She works every day.  She sells the water at home although she sometimes does home deliveries.  The catalogue items she sells door to door selling on credit and collecting every two weeks. Her children help her with the sales, especially with the home deliveries.  Her products are delivered to her at home.  She’s been in business for three years and does well since she’s managed to move her children forward.

This loan will be used to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and large jugs of water.  This is the third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because they’ve helped her a lot with the loans.  Her dream is to own a car to better carry out her sales.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and large jugs of water.

loans.name: Maribel Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maribel, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 12 y 6 años de edad, el mayor este año termino el colegio y espera poder ingresar en la Universidad y sus otros hijos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y productos de Yanbal y Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de esto también se dedica a realizar trabajos de bordados, nos cuenta que estos trabajos los hace a base de pedidos ya que una señora de la ciudad de Chone cada quince días llega a hasta su casa a comprarle lo que ella ha elaborado hasta la fecha y le deja mas modelos y encargos para la próxima quincena,  lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Las ventas de las zapatillas y de los productos Yanbal y Esika lo hace dos días a la semana y estas ventas son puerta a puerta.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería, y materia prima para los bordados como telas e hilos. Está en el banco comunal hace cinco ciclos y le gusta la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the “Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche” (Enterprising Ladies of Pachinche) Communal Bank meet every two weeks at the place known as Pachinche, which is in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is known for its hard-working people who are devoted to agriculture and to raising livestock.

This is where we met Maribel, age 37.  She is married and has three children; ages 17, 12, and 6.  The oldest finished school this year and hopes to be able to enroll in the University.  Her other children are in elementary school and high school.  Her husband is a farmer.

She is a housewife.  In order to get her own resources she sells sneakers and Yanbal and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  

She also does embroidery work.  She tells us that she does the embroidery work by orders.  Every two weeks a woman from the city of Chone comes to Maribel's house to buy what she has made so far.  She leaves Maribel with more patterns and orders for the next two weeks.  Maribel has been doing this for three years, and it is going very well for her.  She sells the sneakers and Yanbal and Esika products door to door two days a week.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry, and supplies like fabric and thread for the embroideries.  She has been in the communal bank for five cycles.  She likes the help she receives with the loans.

Her dreams are for her children to become professionals and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry, and supplies like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and four children, two of whom are still attending school. She has owned a mini-market in her village since 2009. She sells in her grocery store all types of food products like juices, breads etc. She cooperates with her husband who works in the construction field to be able to handle the heavy living expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve her business and further expand it by increasing her store’s inventory. She is very positive and hopes that the loan will help her achieve a significant growth in her business.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry is 38 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with one school-age child.

Larry works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. Each month he earns approximately PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 6,500 from GDMPC to purchase a brand new fishing net. 

Larry has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Larry hopes to gain more profit from this work.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new fishing net

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, aged 45, is a single mother of three children. She runs a green grocery and fruit stall. The business has been in operation for ten years and earns her a monthly income of KES 50,000.

This is her third loan term with KADET LTD. She has successfully managed to repay the previous loans. She will use the loan funds to buy vegetables and fruits for sale. She intends to use the anticipated profits to put up some rental units on her piece of land and hopes to have flats for rental in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née à Sikasso, Fatoumata est une veuve et mère de deux enfants (1 garçon et 1 fille), elle vit chez son oncle avec un de ses enfants à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Madame Fatoumata mène cette activité d’achat et vente de condiments alimentaires il y a environ cinq années au grand marché de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cessait d’accroitre, elle décida ainsi de collaborer avec institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ un année. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel  qui lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de condiments en achetant, 4 cartons Maggi, 3 cartons concentrée de tomate,  quelques sacs oignons, 5 cartons de moutardes et quelques sacs de sel de cuisine. 
Fatoumata s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de la ville de Sikasso et effectue sa vente en détail au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes.
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
