texts.en:
Fatoumata was born in Sikasso. She is a widow with two children (a boy and a girl), and she lives at her uncle’s with one of her children in Bougoula-Ville, in downtown Sikasso.

Mrs. Fatoumata started buying and selling food condiments about five years ago at the Grand market of Sikasso.

In order to better satisfy a customer base which is steadily expanding, she decided a year ago to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is her first individual loan, which will help her to replenish her merchandise by buying four cartons of Maggi stock cubes, three cartons of condensed tomato, a few bags of onions, five boxes of mustard, and a few bags of cooking salt. She buys her stock from Sikasso wholesalers and sells at retail for cash, occasionally on credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which she will use to help with the household expenses and pay the interest on her loan. Any remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments for resale

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong is a 51-year-old married woman with two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Minh City. Her husband is a driver. 

For the past 25 years, Suong has supported her family by running a general shop in front of her house. She sells a large range of products from household items to personal use products.  

Suong would like to get a loan to buy new products such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in her store to better meet her customers' needs.

She hopes that she will be abL. to increase her income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: To buy cakes, green tea, milk and beverages for selling.

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Âgé de 46 ans, père  de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 17 et 5 ans est propriétaire d’une boucherie /alimentation dans le marché.
Les prêt passés lui a permis d’augmenter son activité, ces revenus journalières ont connus beaucoup d’amélioration.il a réaliser des bénéfices énormes ce qui lui a permis d’avoir un prêt important au quatrième cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il  va acheté : 5 cartons de cuisses de poulets, 5 cartons de viande arrière, 3cartonsde viande avant, 2 cartons des tripes , 2cartons de queue de bœufs,2 cartons de poulets à bouillir, 1catons de viande des porcs, 1carton de rognons, 1carton de foie de bœufs, 1sac de riz, 3packs d’eau minérales, des boites des conserves (sardine , maquerelles, petits pois , macédoines, champignons, tomates concentrées, tomates  pelées, saucisses..).
Ses ventes du jour sont de 50.000F et 150.000F et il vend beaucoup le weekend  et pendant le jour de fête
Il vend plus des viandes et des volailles que les poissons car avec le manque d’électricité il a un problème de conservation quand il y a les  coupures de courant.
Père de famille  responsable, il supporte la scolarité de ses enfants sans problèmes et depuis qu’il est a Hope, ses bénéfice lui ont aidée a finir sa maison et a y habiter, il pense qu’avec les enseignements reçus, il va réaliser son ambition : celui d’élargir son activité en ouvrant une autre boucherie / alimentation.
texts.en:
This father of a family of three children whose ages vary between 17 and five is himself aged 46 and owner of a butcher shop and grocery store in the market. 

Past loans have allowed him to grow his business. His daily revenue has greatly improved. He has made enormous profit which has allow him to request a larger fourth loan. 

With this loan he plans to buy 5 cartons of chicken thighs, 5 cartons of rump steaks, 3 cartons of other beef, 2 cartons of tripe, 2 cartons of oxtails, 2 cartons of stewing hens, 1 carton of pork, one carton of kidneys, 1 carton of beef liver, 1 sack of rice, 3 packages of mineral water, and tinned food (sardines, mackerel, peas, mixed vegetables, mushrooms, tomato paste, peeled tomatoes, sausages, etc.) 

 
His daily sales total 50,000 to 150,000 francs and he sells a lot on the weekends and holidays. He sells more meat and chicken than fish since when there are power outages he has a hard time preserving food.

A responsible father, he pays the school fees for his children with problem and since he has been with Hope, his profit has allowed him to finish his house and live in it. He thinks that with the training he has received, he is going to achieve his dream: expanding his business and opening up another butcher shop and grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cartons of meat, tripe, stewing chickens and chicken thighs.

loans.name: Helen Zulema

texts.es:
Helen nació en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 33 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. 

Actualmente, Helen vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella tiene una agencia de turismo mistico y tiene como nombre Munaypacha, ella también tiene una jugueria. Ya son ocho años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Helen requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina conservadora de empanadas.  

(Munaypacha que quiere decir El Amor Universal, empresa dedicada al turismo Místico Especializado)

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
33-year old Helen was born in the city of Cusco. She is married and has two children.

Helen still lives and works in the city in which she was born. She runs a tourist agency called Munaypacha (which means Universal Love), specializing in mystical tourism.  Helen also has juice stall, a business she's had for eight years. All is going well. She now needs a loan to buy a freezer for empanadas.

The Comuzone 1 Community Bank meets monthly in Cusco, Peru. The city is well-known for its tourist attractions, business zone, the traditional festival of Inti Raymi, and because one of the wonders of the world Machupicchu is found there.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for empanadas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for the shop

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 34 years old, engaged in a hog fattening business for two years and a fish and meat vending business for three months.   With diligence, she successfully added this new livelihood.  With a loan amount of P25,000 she will buy  three hogs and feeds.  Part of the loan will also be used for her other business. She wants to grow her business, so she can afford to send her two children to school.

She wishes to lift her family from poverty, so she is working hard to provide for the educational needs of her children. She hopes, with the help of this loan amount, she will earn net income to save for their future.

loans.use: to buy  three hogs and feeds. Part of it will be used for other business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy has been selling cereals and green grocery items for the last five years to make a living. She also practices livestock farming to earn extra income. She is married and blessed with one child who goes to school. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. Mercy dreams of buying a piece of land and building rental houses. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize and beans.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de 5 enfants.Pour appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille, elle a implanté une boutique devant son domicile pour vendre des produits ménagers et des denrées de premières nécéssité notamment le mil, le riz, l'huile, l'arachide et d'autres produits divers...Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter du riz, de l'huile et des ustensiles ménagers.
texts.en: This borrower is a married mother of five children. To support her husband in providing for the family, she established a store in front of her home to sell household products and basic food items, notably millet, rice, oil, peanuts, and various other products. In order to strengthen her working capital, she is seeking a loan of 300,000 F to buy rice, oil, and household utensils.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, and household utensils.

loans.name: Ganzul

texts.en:
Ganzul is 28 years old and lives with her mother in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her mother is retired. 

She started her hairdressing business in 2005 by renting a space in a hair saloon. She is well experienced and she is known for her flawless work. 

Now that her equipment is getting old, she needs to buy new equipment for her customers' satisfaction. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I enjoy my work and I am good at it. However, my customers demand is getting high," 

She is requesting 600,000 MNT to replace her equipment.

loans.use: To replace her equipment.

loans.name: Hurelsuh

texts.en: Hurelsuh is 48 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and their kids are all employed and independent. He started his business in 2003 by retailing garments. However, since 2010 he started selling cart food, which is more profitable. It is more profitable,but, it is difficult to run it on a sunny hot day or blistering cold day. He sells his products by using his own car. He is lacking 2,800,000 MNT to buy grocery products from Erlian to sell in the rural area. He is a sharp and diligent man who says, "Now that my kids are old enough, it is time to concentrate on my business".

loans.use: To buy grocery products from Erlian to sell

loans.name: Diana Mireya

texts.es:
La señora Diana tiene 43 años y vive en Pueblo Nuevo, un barrio que pertenece al municipio de Puerto Cortes. Se casó hace 6 años con Armando, lo cual es transportista y tiene un bus propio. Diana tiene dos hijos varones de 20 y 21 años de edad y ambos están estudiando. 

Doña Diana tiene 8 meses de tener una glorieta (tipo comedor) en una escuela pública en la aldea. Ella vende churros, topogigios (helado en una bolsita de plástico), golosinas, refrescos y jugos. Su esposo le dio capital para empezar el negocio. 

Solicitó este crédito de L7,000 para invertir en la compra de golosinas para la venta. Ella espera obtener mayores ganancias. Diana es muy luchadora y espera en el futuro construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Diana is 43 years old and lives in Pueblo Nuevo, a neighborhood that is part of the Puerto Cortes municipality.  She has been married for six years to Armando, who works in transportation with his own bus.  Diana has two sons aged 20 and 21; both are students.

Doña Diana has had a food stall for 8 months in a public school in the village   She sells churros (fritters), topogigios (ice-cream in a plastic bag), candy, soda, and juice.  Her husband gave her the capital to start her business.

She requested this loan for L7,000 to invest in purchasing candy for sale.  She hopes to generate better earnings.  Diana is a hard worker, and in the future she hopes to build her own home.

loans.use: to purchase candy.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
A decade or so is the time this 34-year-old mother of 3 has spent plying her retail sales business in Kyenjojo. Faith also subsists on profits from farming.   Prior to taking root in this trade, Faith was mostly engaged in odd jobs.

Monthly, this business generates for her sales income to the tune of UGX 30,000.   Her plan for the future is to expand her shop into a wholesale enterprise.  She plans to use her loan to purchase more retail items like maize flour, washing soap, blades, biscuits, etc. to resell

loans.use: buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gaby Alejandra

texts.es:
La Sra. Gaby, es soltera y tiene 22 años de edad, La socia es economista y se sigue dedicando al negocio de ferreteria que trabaja junto con su madre,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere terminar de hacer su tesis,el sueño de la socia es ser profesional. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar los derechos de estudios para que pueda hacer su tesis.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Señora Gaby is single and she is 22 years old. She is an economist and she is still working in the hardware business with her mother. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. The member wants to finish writing her thesis. Her dream is to have a professional career. She is requesting the loan to pay her education fees so that she can do her thesis.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.
.

loans.use: to pay her education fees so that she can write her thesis.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 60-year-old woman who lives in the Sabirabad district of Azerbaijan. She is not married and lives with her brother's family. 

Rahila is a very hardworking woman. She engages in beekeeping. This is her second loan from Aqroinvest CU in the amount of 1,500 AZN. Rahila will use it to buy more bees because she wants to expand the business. She knows that she can earn more money for her family by selling honey because honey has a good price at the market. Besides that she has a plot of land by her home where she grows vegetables. She has been in this business for 18 years.

loans.use: to buy more bees

loans.name: Mutemi

texts.en:
Mutemi is 38 years old and married to Jane. They are blessed with three children. He has been in a livestock trading business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy more livestock for trading. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hope and dream is to buy a pick-up car for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FIGURACORO, un des villages de KANGABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   NAGNOUMA , 4eme assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de FIGUARA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 215.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milkah is a mixed farmer who resides in Nyamira, Kenya. She has been in the farming business for 13 years now. The mother of three sells milk, tea and various varieties of food crops as a means of livelihood. 
Having been influenced by the successes of poultry farmers, she became part of Juhudi Kilimo through a group she mobilized so as to qualify for a loan. On joining Juhudi Kilimo, she attended a two-month training on basic business and financial skills which empowered her to take an income-generating asset loan. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Milka is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. 
She is confident that she will take good care of the poultry in order to maximize productivity. After the training, she saw the need to diversify in order to spread the risk and evade shortcomings that may be forthcoming in other farming sectors. Besides, she doesn’t find tea picking quite enjoyable. Poultry farming may be her way out of tea farming.
Milkah dreams of expanding her poultry farming in future into a wholesale business given the marketing opportunities in Nyamira.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.en:
This is a group loan, requested by the thirty members of a women’s rotating savings and credit association in the traditional fishing village of Yoff just outside the capital city, Dakar. The group describes their business activities as follows:

“This project is located in the village of Yoff, the traditional village of our country’s capital city. Yoff’s proximity to the downtown area of Dakar doubtless provides it with several strategies for survival, which are integrated simultaneously with local traditional and with modern methods of sustainable development.

The purpose of the loan is to increase the income of the group members in order to reinforce their capacities of production. The business activities the group plans to undertake are:

• The production of traditional hand-dyed cloth

• Purchase and retail of seafood products

• Purchase and retail of various food commodities”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet : Le projet se situ dans le village de Yoff ; village traditionnel de la capitale du pays . Sa proximité du centre de Dakar lui permet sans doute de tenter plusieurs stratégies de survie, intégrées à la fois à la tradition locale et aux nouveaux mots d’ordre de développement durable

Objectifs du Prêt : Augmenter le revenu des membres du groupement pour mieux renforcer leurs capacités de production.

Activités Les activités que compte mener le groupement sont :

- Teinture

- Achat et ventes de produits halieutiques

- Achat et vente de denrées alimentaires »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and dyes for traditional cloth-dying; bulk purchase of seafood from fishermen; bulk purchase of food commodities (dried red peppers, black peppercorns, garlic, fish bouillion); purchase of a scale; transport of goods to market

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Back in September 2003 Rustam had a very limited assortement of goods. He worked in an open-air market every day and made about $30 per month. His goal was to improve working conditions and to increase the number and variety of goods. He received his first loan - $100, gradually developed his business and step by step increased his loan amount.  He rented another trade site located near his current place and he is managing both places himself. As he continued his cooperation with MicroInvest and he also improved the quality of sold goods and obtained constant clients. He brings his goods from Uzbekistan and Kyrgystan. Since 2003 his profit has increased 5 times and he thinks the loans he has received have had a very positive effect on his business. As a result, Rustam also has improved the living conditions of his family: wife and two children. The new loan will be used for building shelves. This way he can use his business location more effectively and present more goods to sell.

loans.use: Building shelves for goods to be sold

loans.name: Tre

texts.en: Miss Tre is 38 and her husband is 39 years old. They have 4 children and their children’s ages are 17, 15, 13 and 9. All of them are going to school. They have 2000 square meters of growing cassava land. Mr Canh, her husband works on their land and besides, he has to work as a daily laborer but the work is not stable. Miss Tre sells soya milk from door to door daily and raises one female pig at her hut. Miss Tre borrowed a loan with no interest from the project, which has been important for them, as it increased their income by about $1/person/month. Average income is $10/person/month. Miss Tre has repaid a loan of $50, and now she asks to borrow a loan of $75.

loans.use:
selling soya milk  and growing
cassava

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is married and she lives in the city of Apodaca in New León. She has been preparing and selling tamales for the past three years in order to help her husband with the family’s expenses because his salary is very low and they were suffering hardships. Nelly has helped to improve the quality of life of her family with this business, now she is also selling cosmetics and fortunately with very good results.

Nelly is requesting for a loan of $200 to help grow her business. She will use it to buy the ingredients for the preparation of tamales, as well as to buy cosmetics to supply existing orders. She is confident to repay the loan in three months. She is very grateful for your trust and the help you can provide.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelly es casada y vive en el la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, desde hace tres años se dedica a elaborar y vender tamales para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar ya que el salario que él recibe es muy bajo y pasaban por muchas necesidades, con este negocio Nelly ha contribuido a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ahora también ha incorporado la venta de cosméticos y afortunadamente ha recibido muy buenos resultados.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio Nelly está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los tamales, así como en la compra de cosméticos para surtir pedidos ya le han solicitado, ella confía en devolver esta cantidad en tres meses por lo que agradece mucho la confianza y ayuda que puedas brindarle. la confianza y ayuda que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Faasegi

texts.en: Faasegi S. is a businesswoman of fifty-five, and she has four children.  Her husband died three years ago. She wanted so much to have a business of her own to help her put her children in school and to develop her family.  Finally, she did what has she been dreaming of - having a plantation as a small business. Faasegi works so hard every day until the evening to clean and plant as many goods as she can to sell in order for her to earn money to satisfy the needs of her kids.   She’s happy of the way she runs her business even though her husband is not there to help out, but she has nothing to worry about as everything is going well.  She’s thankful to S.P.B.D for making the programme available for those who do not have a job to earn money.  She will use her loan to buy seeds to plant, and wire, nails, hammers, etc., for the fence.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, hammers, wiring, fencing, and nails

loans.name: Luz Angélica

texts.es:
Luz is a single mother of six and currently living with one of her daughters who is pursuing a career in education at the university. Despite having been left alone to raise six small children, Luz never lost hope of improving their lives and of dedicating herself to some endeavor that would help to support them all and secure their educations. She decided to focus on making local crafts, learning from her mother what a great art form this could be. This became her passion, and the means by which she could better her family’s quality of life. She travels to many places to market her products, supported in her endeavor at home by her daughter. She has generated earnings by taking the products around with her to sell, or to exchange for other goods with the farmers she meets in her travels. With the growth of her business, Luz is hoping to create more opportunities to increase sales by making more crafts and purchasing clothing to offer for sale. She is looking for a loan to make her plans into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz es madre soltera y tuvo seis hijos, actualmente vive con una D. sus hijas, que esta cursando la carrera D. educación en la universidad, a pesar D. haberse quedado sola cuando sus hijos aún eran pequeños jamás perdió las esperanzas D. sobresalir y desempeñarse satisfactoriamente en alguna actividad para generarles bienestar y educación.Decidió dedicarse a la elaboración D. artículos artesanales aprendiendo D. su mamá este bello arte. Convirtiéndose en lo que sería su pasión y fuente D. trabajo con que el que pudo sacar adelante a su familia; ella actualmente trabaja viajandopermanentemente por los ríos, chacras y por la carretera ofertando sus productos, mientras que en su casa es la hija quién la apoya en la elaboración D. los productos, convirtiéndose en un elemento D. gran ayuda para ella; paralelamente lleva consigo mercadería para vender o canjearlas por animales que puedan ofrecer los moradores D. las chacras, generando una muy buena fuente D. ingresos para su hogar.Como se le presentan las oportunidades D. aumentar sus ventas gracias a las novedades que ofrece se encuentra en la necesidad D. producir más artículos y D. paso comprar ropa para ofertarla y así seguir trabajando.Solicita un préstamo con el objetivo D. concretar sus planes y ayudar con el término D. su carrera D. su gran socia.

loans.use: Purchase accessories for crafts/clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand curtains

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz M. is a 25-year-old trader who owns a small food store in a village in Sattli. He has 3 years of experience in trading. He started out selling candies and now sells many different kinds of products including food and cosmetics. Parviz would like a loan of $900 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his small food and sundries store

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul F. is 39 years old, and he is married with four children.

After the collapse of the Soviet Union, Rasul started a private bakery in his house. He bakes the traditional bread called “lepeshka”. His wife and two elder children help him. He is a hard-working and honest entrepreneur. In his life he has faced difficulties and it was mainly due to the lack of money.

Rasul is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 US Dollars for a term of 4 months. The loan will be spent on increasing the working capital and undertaking a major repair of his bakery. Rasul would like to thank all the lenders and IMLF IMON in particular for supporting him during the last three years of his cooperation with IMON.

loans.use: Increase the working capital and repair the bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads and other supplies / Invertir en telas, hilos y otra materia prima

loans.name: Neur

texts.en: Mrs. Neur C. lives in Tropeng Angkrorng Village in Kompong Speu Province. She is 22 years old and has two children, one of whom attends school, while the other is still too young. Mrs. Neur C. is a water supplier who sells water in her village. Mrs. Neur's husband, Mr. Lim Tha, is a motorbike driver and also delivers water containers to the villagers. Currently, the couple is facing financial difficulties, since Mr. Lim's motorbike is old and always needs repairs. Therefore, Mrs. Neur would like to request a loan to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motorbike

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura is a young and responsible mother, 22 years old. Since she started her family, she has been devoted to her family and is prepared to give the best of herself so they can get ahead. That's why she decided to dedicate herself to selling electronics and small appliances in the Pinaya district, a little town far away from her home city of Santa Lucia. With this business, she is managing to keep up her household, and at the same time support her husband with his higher education expenses. Currently, they are living with her in-laws, and she hopes to build her own home to provide their own safe roof for their three-year-old little boy, Franco.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Laura, es una joven y responsable madre de 22 años de edad. Desde que formó su hogar siempre estuvo consagrada a su familia y presta a dar lo mejor de sí para seguir adelante, es por ello que ha decidido dedicarse a la venta de artefactos en el distrito de Pinaya, pueblito muy lejano de su ciudad natal, Santa Lucia. Con este negocio está logrando sostener su hogar y al mismo tiempo apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su educación superior.Actualmente viven en el domicilio de sus suegros, y tiene la esperanza de construir pronto su propia morada para ofrecerle un techo propio y seguro a su pequeño niño Franco de 3 añitos de edad.

loans.use: Increase cash to increase the supply of her products

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is the mother of two children, ages 17 and 18.  Juana has a variety of businesses, which include killing/selling pork, running a little shop and selling agua dulce (sweet water) and other products.  Juana has successfully paid back four loans to Esperanza International and her businesses are doing very well.  With a fifth loan, Juana hopes to be able to own her very own house, made of cement blocks.  She also wants her two children to be able to finish their education and continue studying at the university.  Juana is currently halfway through her own bachelor’s degree at the university.

loans.use: To invest in her businesses so that she can put her kids through college

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam E. lives in the Prey Tachap Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a wedding chef who makes only a small income to support her family. Mrs. Sam E. is a 48 year old widow with five children, all of whom are employed in different business activities. Even though they are all working, they still live in poor conditions in an old house. Thus, Mrs. Sam E. decided to request a loan to repair her house in order to improve the hygienic conditions and decrease the incidence of illness. Previously, Mrs. Sam E. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To repair her house in order to improve the hygienic conditions and decrease the incidence of illness.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap E., 39, was married to her second husband in 2006. She has one son with her first husband. Her son studies in secondary school. Sopheap lives with her elderly mother on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sopheap has been a silk weaver for twenty years - a skill she learned from her mother. Her mother has been a silk weaver for forty years. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Sopheap's husband is motorcycle repairman in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her and her mother's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita is 23 years old and lives with her 33 year old husband Maguin, a teacher in one of the city’s schools. She is a young businesswoman who has been selling pelts for the past 5 years in her furrier business, with the help of her husband Maguin they have made this business a success. Jovita devotes her time to the furrier business, devoting all morning and part of the afternoon, as she doesn’t yet have children that she has to take care of, this business is her sole focus and she is happy to do the work. She works hard to be able to create a stable family with her husband Maguin, they plan to have children and she hopes to be able to meet their needs. With the loan she plans to buy more pelts to increase her sales and make some improvements to her locale. In the future Jovita wants to create another business, she is still analyzing the area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Jovita tiene 23 años, vive con su pareja Maguin de 33 años, quien es maestro en una escuela de la ciudad. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de la peletería (venta de pieles de animales), con la ayuda de su pareja Maguin sacan adelante este negocio. Jovita solo se dedica a atender su peletería, a la cual le dedica toda la mañana y parte de la tarde, como aun no tiene hijos que cuidar, este negocio significa para ella su única fuente de distracción, es feliz al realizar su trabajo. Trabaja duro para poder conformar una familia estable con su pareja Maguin, tener hijos, y a los cuales les pueda brindar todas las comodidades. Con el dinero del préstamo piensa adquirir más pieles para aumentar la venta de su peletería, y hacer algunas refacciones de su local, en el futuro Jovita quiere conformar otro negocio, aún está analizando el rubro.

loans.use: increase the number of pelts in her furrier store

loans.name: Aseria

texts.en:
Aseria I., 42, is married with 10 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the public and to villagers 2 days per week. 

She has taken 2 previous loans from South Pacific Business Development (SPBD).  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Aseria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. She will use the money earned to buy chemicals, weed killer, sack of fertilizers and bush knives for the farming business. Her husband is helping her operating the business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, weed killer, sack of fertilizers and bush knives

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: Hul N., 41, is married and lives with two young children and her husband in the Kandal, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has been worked selling groceries in her village to earn a living and is able to make US$13 in revenue each day, while her husband, Vann Bros, 42, is a policeman. He makes US$6 each day. One of their children is a student, and the other one is too young to attend the school. Each month she spends around US$60 on foods, US$6 on utility, US$10 on her child's education, and US$50 on their transportation. Hul N. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase rice for sale. This will increase her daily profits. In the future, she plans to build rooms onto her home to rent out to the garment factory workers.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Adjarath

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans et née à OUAKE, dame M. Adjarath est  mariée à Harouna (Agent au port) et est mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisé. Elle est dans la vente d’huile de palme depuis 04 ans juste après son arrivée à  Cadjèhoun où elle y réside actuellement. Avec son premier crédit, elle a su fidéliser sa clientèle ce qui lui a permis d’accroître son activité. Ainsi, voulant satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 100000 f CFA.
texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Adjarath Moumoni is 35 years old and was born in Ouake. She is married to Harouna (a port agent) and has 3 children, all attending school. She has been in the business of selling palm oil for the last 4 years, since she arrived in Cadjèhoun where she currently lives. With her first loan she was able to secure the loyalty of her clients, in turn that allowed her to increase her activity. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 100000 f CFA to meet her customers’ demands.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 drums of palm oil

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mr. Son V. lives in Dambouk Kor Kos village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a battery charger who uses electricity to charge batteries for an income. His wife, Mrs. V. Phally, is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice. Even though they have different businesses, they still cannot support and provide a good life for themselves. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Son V. decided to ask for a loan to purchase two cows for breeding and he hopes to improve his living conditions after he sells his cows.

He is 38 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mr. R. is 65 years old and sells Cambodian traditional baskets; he lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. He works making baskets to sell with his wife from their house and earns around US$ 3 per day. The baskets are made of bamboo and used for store rice, also popular for Cambodian farmers. He is skilled in making baskets and has been working at the business since 1995. He sells to his regular customers who give him orders. He has four children, two of whom are married and live separately. The other two are single- one is studying at university; one daughter works in a garment factory.

To increase production, R. would like to ask for a loan to purchase raw materials to make baskets. R.'s wife is shown in the photo because he was not available for photographing.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make baskets

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif Q. is a 41-year-old man who sells men's shoes in the central Imishli bazaar. He started his business in 1999, and since that time he has gained respect as a very polite and friendly man. Akif is married and has 2 sons. He starts his working day early in the morning, and after lunch he goes to his second job, where Akif works as a school teacher. Akif would like to purchase new shoes for the spring season, and for this purpose he applied for $1200. This loan he will repay in next 15 months. Let's do our best to help this hard-working man.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal shoes to resell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew has a motorcycle that he uses to convey passengers from one location to another in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. He is 32 years old and married with a child. He hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase another motorcycle. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: A Carmen tener una familia la embarga de felicidad, pues vivir con su esposo y su hija en una casa muy acogedora era el sueño que deseaba realizar hace mucho tiempo. Se dedicó a estudiar desde muy joven, siendo muy aplicada, y con el tiempo acabo su carrera de técnica en farmacia y trabajó en diversas boticas o farmacias de su ciudad. Pero conoció a un químico farmacéutico quien le enseñó diversos conceptos esenciales dentro de su carrera y con el tiempo el destino los unió y juntos buscaron la manera de tener algo propio, e instalaron en su casa una farmacia. Desde hace 13 años viene funcionando su negocio y gracias a sus habilidades se ha convertido en una de las farmacias más concurridas, a quienes se les garantiza una eficiente atención de esta dulce pareja. Sin embargo, desean aprovechar la acogida del público para instalar una sucursal en otro sector de su ciudad, convirtiendo este servicio de salud en un negocio duradero para su familia. Carmen viene trabajando con MFP hace tres  años, este es su cuarto préstamo y espera seguir trabajando de una manera organizada junto a las socias que conforman su banco comunal. Invertirá los 1000 soles que solicita en la compra de medicamentos necesarios para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Having a family fills Carmen with happiness. Living with her husband and daughter in a very cozy house was the dream that she had hoped to accomplish for a long time. She studied when she was younger and was very dedicated. She finished her studies as a pharmacy technician and worked in various pharmacies in her city. She met a pharmaceutical chemist who taught her various essential concepts throughout her studies and with time, fate united them, and together they searched for a way to have something of their own. They started a pharamacy in their home. For thirteen years, they have run their business, and thanks to their abilities, it has become one of the most frequented pharmacies among those who are guaranteed efficient service from this sweet couple. They hope to make the most of being accepted by the public and start a location in another part of the city, making this health service a lasting business for their family. Carmen has worked with MFP for three years, and this is her fourth loan. She hopes to continue working in an organized manner with the members that make up her communal bank. She will invest the 1,000 soles that she is requesting in purchasing necessary medications to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is 65 years old. She is married and has sons and daughters who are all grown up and live independently. She lives with her grandchildren and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 
Adwoa is a trader. She trades in foodstuffs such as yam, plantain, cassava, etc. and other food items such as onions and eggs. She procures the goods from the farmers in the nearby small communities at effective prices. She treks to other towns to sell. Adwoa says food vendors and other retailers normally purchase from her. She has been in business for so many years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to be able to distribute to more customers.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs and fruits

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 42-year-old store operator in her village. Her husband Ernesto is working as a farmer and sometimes accompanies her in her business when not busy on their farm. They have three children: Claire - 24 years old, a college graduate, as is Denver - 22 years old. The youngest is Cherry Ann - 18 years old, first year college. Evangeline prays for the success of their business and hopes that their youngest will finish her college education.

Aside from her sari-sari store (community-based store) that she has been managing for 17 years in Magsaysay, Quirino, Isabela, Evangeline is also managing an eatery for additional income. She is in need of financial assistance to improve her enterprise, thus, she would like to borrow PHP 7, 000 since her income is not enough to sustain her business and the immediate needs of her family. Evangeline is doing her best to become successful and somehow extend help to others because she believes that “it is better to give than to receive”.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 43-year-old trader. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She lives with her family at Kasoa in Ghana.

Cecilia has sold used clothes in the Dansoman market of Ghana for the past nine years. With this business, she has been able to support one of her children to complete senior high school.

With low capital, she is not able to buy larger-bale quantities of used clothes to sell. She would like to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes with variety to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children education.

She is a member of the group called ‘Prosper Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and provide support assistance in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bales

loans.name: Jo-An

texts.en:
Jo-an D. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is twenty-four years old and married with two  infant-aged children. To make a living, Jo-an owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Jo-an has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jo-an joined one of Kiva's field partners, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Jo-an has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Jo-an is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jo-an from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 34 years old. She is a micro-entrepreneur and the mother of two and she is married to Reymundo, a policeman. Their children are: Ace Angelo, 7 years old and now in grade two; and Joker, 4 years old. Nida has a lot of dreams for her two children. She hopes that, with her patience and perseverance in running her business, she will be able to help her husband provide for the education of her children as they achieve their own goals in life someday. 

Nida is seeking the support of Kiva lenders in improving her general store business so as to be able to increase her daily income for her family, especially her children. She is requesting to borrow PHP 8,000 as additional working capital to buy more goods and other merchandise to sell in her store.

Nida also shared that she was already happy to see her children eat at least three times a day. But, as time goes by, she realizes that she could be even happier if they will also not only be given their basic needs, but also satisfy their wants to become diligent and consistent in their studies. She hopes that, through her business and with the help of our almighty God, her dreams for her children will be achieved.

loans.use: To buy more goods and other merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Анвар – мужчина , который занимается продажей жвачками «Орбит». Он покупает с фирмы и развозит по торговым точкам в районы Истаравшан, Спитамен,  Масча. Для увеличения товарооборота он хочет получить повторный кредит . Он заметил , что с периода первого займа у него увеличился оборотный капитал и прибыль.
texts.en:
Anvar is a man, who sells Orbit chewing gum. He buys from a firm and delivers the product to retail outlets in the districts of Istaravshan, Spitamen and Mastchoh. He wants to obtain another loan in order to increase his goods turnover. Anvar noticed that his working capital and profit increased since his first loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Normumin

texts.en:
D. Normumin is 52 years old. He is married and has seven children. Normumin produced the national chest box used to save the dowry of brides. The national chest in Tajikistan is made of wood and very colorful. Normumin has been in this business for 20 years. He strives to improve his family's living conditions.

Because of the high demand for his products, Normumin requests a loan of 3500 Somoni to purchase raw material to produce more chests. Normumin thanks all lenders who are giving him a chance to get ahead. ----------------------------------------------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase raw material for production of the chest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mtama  Kulangwa Group

texts.en:
Rehema R., age 32, is married with one child who is 1 year old. She has had a fish business for a year now. She works from 5:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $150.

This will be Rehema’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more fish for sell and has paid her loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her stock.

Rehema will share this loan with the loan group, Mtama Kulangwa. The group has 19 members. In the picture, Rehema is 4th from right with a pink head-wrapper, back row.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Nai N. sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells items like soft drinks, sweets (candies) for kids, and some cooking supplies. To meet her family’s living expenses, her husband works as a room preparer for a hotel and gets a specific salary. This couple has three school-aged children.

Recently, part of Nai N.’s inventory has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan to accumulate more inventory to continue selling.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Barrio Laykacota, estudio educación secundaria incompleta.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace ya 3 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de artículos de limpieza.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar artículos de limpieza, pasta dental, papel suave, ganchos de ropa, lapiceros, cuadernos, escobillas, etc.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda grande  bien surtida.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de artículos de limpieza, pasta dental, papel suave, ganchos de ropa, lapiceros, cuadernos, escobillas, etc.

loans.name: Darline

texts.en:
Darline A. is from the village of Sinayawan in Valencia City. She is 58 years old. Darline is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Darline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food, daily-use products, and "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) in the local community. Darline has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Darline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darline is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Darline's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is from the village of Bantangan, Valencia City. She is 29 years old. Emma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products like t-shirts, plastic ware, bags, pots, and more in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of drinks in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
el señor Santos M. P. tiene 47 años de edad, es viudo, su esposa se murio hace unos dos meses, el vive con una sobrina y su hijo.
Santos se dedica a la venta de refrescos de cola al por mayor y al detalle tambien vende tarjetas y agua en fardos, sus ventas son diarias y le va muy bien. tiene dos años de tener este negocio y Santos tiene su propia casa.
esta solicitando un credito porque lo necesita para surtir de refrescos y tarjetas para esta navidad ya que es la epoca en donde las ventas son altas.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos M. Pavos is 47 years old. He is a recent widower since his wife passed away about two months ago. He lives with a niece and her son.

Santos sells cola at wholesale. In addition, he is a retailer of phone cards and cases of bottled water. His daily sales have been doing well. He manages his business from home and has been in operation for two years.

He is requesting a loan because he needs to restock his supply of soft drinks and phone cards for the Christmas season. His sales are higher during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & mobile phone calling cards

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette femme vend du bois de chauffage dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à  Akatti, localité située à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. Ses clients apprécient la qualité de ses bois de chauffage. En ce moment elle voudrait lancer une nouvelle commande pour prévenir une éventuelle rupture de stocks ; raison pour la quelle elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander du bois de chauffe en quantité suffisante.
texts.en:
This woman sells firewood in the Agoè area of Lomé. This business allows her to take care of herself and provide for her children. She gets her supplies in Akatti, an area located a few tens of kilometres from Lomé. Her clients appreciate the quality of her firewood. Currently, she would like to put in a new order to prevent an eventual stock shortage; this is the reason why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to order a sufficient quantity of firewood.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Laura Consuelo

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Laura G. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora que ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos por mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos en edades escolares a los que debe de mantener y brindarle las perfectas condiciones para que estos se desarrollen y así mejoren su nivel de vida.

El crédito solicitado lo utilizará en la compra de cemento, cuartones, hierro y zinc para realizar un anexo a su vivienda ya que así lo requiere porque por medio de esto mejorará las condiciones de vida de sus pequeños hijos a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
In the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Laura Garcia is noted for being a very hardworking woman who has managed to get ahead, thanks to her many efforts to improve her housing conditions. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. She must support them and provide the perfect conditions they need to develop so that they can improve their standard of living. This loan will be used to buy cement, lumber, iron and corrugated metal sheeting in order to build an extension to their house which they need because it will improve the living conditions of their small children, who they love so much.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement, lumber, iron and corrugated metal sheeting

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 47 years old and is married with six children between 5 and 21 years old. She lives in Nyaruguru, in the Southern Province of Rwanda.

Immaculee has been in the business of selling foodstuffs since 2000 and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. every day.

Immaculee is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more foodstuffs such as beans, rice, etc. With these additional foodstuffs for sale, she will be able to satisfy the demands of her customers as well as earn more profits than previously.

Through the earned profits, Immaculee will continue to help her husband in taking care of their children as well as in building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ikoagba

texts.en:
Ikogba sells garri to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. Garri is mA. from cassava, and it is the most common foodstuff in Nigeria. She has been in this business for over 13 years and has had success. She hopes for a big business in the future. She hopes for NGN 100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell.

Ikogba is married and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old. She hopes to support her husband in sponsoring their children for higher education. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a 73-year-old widow with six children. They range in age from 22 to 40 years old, with her two youngest children currently attending college. She operates a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, and has been farming for over twenty years. While she used to focus more on fruit and vegetable production, her primary income now comes from the sale of milk, which she does personally at the local markets. She says that the main challenge currently is finding a good, reliable market for her product where she can maintain profitability.

Jenifer requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 71,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She will also use a portion of the money to improve the sleeping shed she built for her current livestock.

Jenifer says that with this loan she will have sufficient milk to become a supplier to the KCC - the Kenya Cooperative of Creameries. This will result in a more stable income which she will use to pay for her children's college fees and their basic needs.

Looking to the future, Jenifer hopes to build a modern grazing unit to ensure her animals are well taken care of. She feels this will help get maximum benefit out of her income-producing assets.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Mirian D. D. F. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo D. 65 años D. edad, el cual trabaja como albañil. Mirian posee una venta D. carne D. pollo y embutidos, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado municipal D. San Martín, lugar en el cual durante 18 años ha vendido este tipo D. productos, es por esto que ella cuenta con mucho clientes quienes la conocen desD. hace mucho años, ganándose así la confianza D. las personas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más pollo y mayor variedad D. embutidos, ya que ella cuenta con muy buena clientela y lo que más desea es poder atenderla a toda para lograr tener más ganancias. Mirian es una mujer que goza D. muy buenas referencias, ya que es alguien trabajadora, quien día a día junto a su esposo se esfuerza por obtener el sustento diario para vivir.
texts.en:
Mirian D. D. F. is 52 years old, and she lives in the Cuscatlán department. She lives with her 65 year old husband. He works as a bricklayer. Mirian has a business selling chicken and sausages. The business is located in the San Martín municipal market. She has sold this type of product there for 18 years. Therefore, she has a lot of customers who have known her for a long time, and they trust her. She is requesting a loan to buy more chicken and a greater variety of sausages. She has good customers, and what she wants most of all is to be able to take care of all of them in order to have greater earnings. Mirian has very good references because she is a hard-working person. Together with her husband she puts forth great effort everyday to bring home the daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken and sausages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing automotive paints

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna D.est mariée et mère de 4 enfants (1garçon et 3filles). Elle est née vers 1977 à Manankoro dans la préfecture de Bougouni, 3eme Région administrative du Mali.  Elle vit avec son mari avec leurs enfants à Kadiolo quartier Koko.
Elle fait le commerce d’articles divers (essence, savons traditionnels, préparation et vente d’encens) il y a plus de 6 ans ans. L’activité dominante chez Maïmouna est la vente de l’essence et  elle se fait aider de temps à autres pour les besoins de la circonstance par son mari. Elle mène son activité avec beaucoup de réussite.
Elle est à sa sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 1000 litres d’essence. Elle s’approvisionne en République de la Côte d’Ivoire  qui est un pays frontalier du Mali et précisément à Tomikoro auprès des demi grossistes. Elle vend au comptant, souvent à crédit (sur commande) et en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 145.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie pour aider  son mari à gérer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maimouna D.is married and the mother of four children (one boy and three girls). She was born around 1977 in Manankoro, in the Bougouni prefecture, the third administrative region of Mali. She lives with her husband and children in the town of Kadiolo, Koko district. Her business is selling various articles (gasoline, traditional soaps, preparing and selling incense), which she has been doing for six years now. Her main activity is selling gasoline, and as the need arises, her husband also aides her. Her business has been going very well. This is her sixth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yriwaso, and all previous loans have been duly reimbursed. With this loan, she plans to purchase 1,000 liters (about 264 gallons) of gasoline. She buys her stock in Côte d’Ivoire, a country neighboring with Mali, more precisely in Tomikoro, from mid-size wholesale distributors. She sells retail, for cash, often in credit (upon request) to a customer based composed of both women and men. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 145,000 West African Francs, a part of which will be used to bolster her business capital and the other part will help her husband with the everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing gasoline (for resale)

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is a single mother of two children and both her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Robinah owns her house and her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Robinah sells second hand clothes at her home and at times sells door-to door, depending on the available clothes. Besides this clothing business, she also sells piped water to her neighbors. She has been in this business for a long time and wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. Robinah works six days a week. Her major business challenges are the ever-increasing prices of second hand clothes and the rainy season.  Robinah aspires to see her business grow bigger so that she could earn enough profit to build rental houses in the available space. Robinah joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business as MCDT was giving out timely loans.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothing

loans.name: María Elia

texts.es: María Elia C. D. C. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. María posee una tortillería, en la cual se encarga D. elaborar tortillas cada mediodía y cada tarD. D. lunes a domingo. Ella es una mujer muy esforzada quien gracias a este negocio ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos, los cuales en la actualidad se dedican a trabajar. Cada día María coloca la cocina para hacer tortillas llamada plancha, frente a su casa, y se dirige al molino a moler el maíz con el cual elabora este alimento tan básico para las personas D. este país. Debido a que ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales desD. hace muchos años compran en su negocio, sabiendo que están consumiendo calidad D. producto. María solicita un préstamo a Integral con el enorme deseo D. poder comprar maíz por mayor para comprarlo a precios más bajos, y D. esta manera elaborar más tortillas y así atender a más clientes, esto será D. mucho beneficio para ella y su hogar, ya que podrá contar con el dinero necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Elia C. D. C., 47, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department. María has a tortilla shop where she manufactures tortillas every noon and every afternoon from Monday through Sunday. She is a very hard-working woman who has managed to raise her three children with earnings from this work; all her children are currently employed. Every day María sets up the stove to make tortillas, called “plancha” in front of her house and heads to the mill to grind the corn that’s used to make this basic food item of inhabitants of this country. Because she’s a very responsible and hard-working woman, she has many regular customers that have bought her tortillas for several years knowing that they are consuming a high-quality product. María is asking for funds from Integral with a great wish to buy corn at wholesale so that she can get it for a lower price, be able to make more tortillas and thus tend to more customers. This will be of great benefit to her and her household because she will be able to count on the necessary income to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Zannou Moïse

texts.fr: E. Zannou Moïse est né le 16 Septembre 1984 à Aguégué au Bénin. Marié à DJOSSOU Colette, Moïse a sept enfants à charge, dont deux sont ses enfants. Tous les enfants de Moïse sont scolarisés. Il y a près de huit ans que Moïse s’est installé au quartier Klaké, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec sa femme et ses enfants. Moïse n’a pas été à l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Moïse exerce cette activité depuis onze ans environs et a son atelier situé à son domicile. Moïse achète ses matériaux de coiffure à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Moïse sollicite un premier prêt de ALIDé, en vue d’acquérir certains matériaux nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son atelier, ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Zannou Moïse E. was born on 16th September 1984 in Aguégué in Benin. Married to Colette DJOSSOU, Moïse has seven children in his care, two of which are his own children. All his children are at school. Almost eight years ago Moïse settled down with his wife and children in the Klaké district of the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. He did not go to school but learnt hairdressing. He has been carrying out this activity for around 11 years and his salon is at home. Moïse buys his hairdressing equipment in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, with a view to acquiring certain equipment which is necessary for the smooth running of his salon. This will allow him to satisfy better his customers' demands.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairdressing equipment (chairs with caster wheels, clippers etc.)

loans.name: Doljinsuren

texts.en: Doljinsuren L. is 48 years old and lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of  Mongolia. She and her family live in their own apartment. Her children, two daughters and one son, range in ages from 16 to 26 years old. Doljinsuren has been operating a clothing and shoes trade business in Narantuul Trade market in the city since 2002. She provides a variety of shoes to satisfy her customer's needs and imports them from China twice a month. She owns a stall in the market where she sells her products. After some years of positive growth with her business, she afforded her children tuition fees. Today the family enjoys a stable operation with the businesses and is focused on expanding their shoes trade business in the near future. The family lives in a two-room apartment in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia and the living conditions are good as well. She is a very modest person. Doljinsuren is requesting a 1,425,000 MNT loan to import products from Beijing, the capital city of China.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda P. is from the village of West Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Rosalinda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bivamuntuuyo Katakala Farmers Group-Mityana

texts.en: K. Samuel is 70 years old and has banked on profits from his farming business in Katakala-Mityana for the last 50 years. Farming, as any Ugandan will tell you, has always been a dependable source of finance for most households. Samuel is a testimony to that. In a week, this hardworking old man makes profits that add up to 50,000 UGX. He is very involved in his business despite his age, and this is what he cites as one of the reasons behind his longevity. With this loan, Samuel wants to pay for the mulching of his gardens and he also wants to buy manure.

loans.use: To mulch his gardens and to buy manure

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 53 años, vive con su hijo en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace 7 años vende comida, en donde adecuo un espacio para su propio restaurante en su mismo domicilio. Su hijo es su apoyo principal y cada día se esfuerza en la preparación y atención  a la clientela. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo, es su sentido de esfuerzo que cada día tiene y se pone el reto de lograr que todas las porciones de comida que ha preparado se vendan en ese día,  ya que de eso depende la rentabilidad de su jornada. Por tal motivo se siente contenta y se proyecta para el futuro ampliar y que sea mas acogedor su restaurante. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Gladys, 53, lives with her son in a relative’s house. For the last 7 years she has sold food in a space in her home that she set up as an eatery. Her son is her main helper and every day she strives to prepare the best meals and provide customer service. What she enjoys about her work is the effort she puts into her daily preparations facing the challenge of insuring that all her meals are sold daily since that is what her profitability depends on. She is happy, therefore, and plans for the future to expand and make her eatery more attractive. This is her 1st loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on having financial support. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible, mutually supportive persons. She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting in that it will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy non-perishable items needed in her food preparations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy non-perishables.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline M., a 48-year-old business lady in Jomvu, Mombasa, is married and has four children. For over six years she has been in the business of selling groceries, women lessos and charcoal.  Jackine is now requesting her second loan from KADET to purchase vegetables, lessos, and one sack of charcoal for her store. With the profits she hopes to assist her husband in paying for the children's school fees.  Jackine aspires to become a great and very successful business lady.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, lessos and one sack of charcoal for her grocery store

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en: Ricarda C. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old and is married with eight adult children. Ricarda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas and charcoal in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ricarda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.
