She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ricarda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Maria Venancia

texts.es: Maria Venancia tiene 31 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, pues busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, el negocio fue iniciativa propia. Pues siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos cada día, por lo que ha sido muy gratificante para ella y su familia. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Sueña con realizar su pequeña pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Maria Venancia is 31 years old. She has had a general store for more than 10 years. She has one child. Every day, she works to improve her income, which is very satisfying to her and her family. This loan will be used to buy basic goods, such as sweets, soft drinks, bread, biscuits, juice, detergent and grains. Her goal is to turn her general store into a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en la zona urbana del distrito de Jayanca, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de cuatro años, el trabaja como obrero en una fábrica agroindustrial que se encuentra localizada en su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar como agricultor independiente ya que cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo de su propiedad. Eugenio depende estas actividades para mantener a su familia y salir adelante por lo que siempre se esfuerza en ambas para mantener asegurado su sustento.

Eugenio ha instalado en su terreno un sembrío de maíz y está trabajando de la mejor manera para obtener una buena consecha. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas con los cuales va a aplicar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

Eugenio es una persona que pone toda su energia y esfuerzo en las labores que realiza, en la zona el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Eugenio is a 32 year old father who lives with his wife and children in an urban zone in the Jayanca district, an agriculture district which belongs the Lambayeque province and is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than four years now he has been working in agriculture. He is an agroindustrial factory worker in his district. In addition, he works as an independent farmer since he depends on a small piece of cropland in his property. Eugenio depends on these jobs since they help his family assure they have their basic necessities since it is difficult to maintain them.

Eugenio has planted corn and is working his hardest to have a good crop turnout. This is why it is convenient for him to request Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles (Peruvian currency) to buy fertilizer and pesticides which he will use to maintain his crops.

Eugenio is a person who puts all of his energy and effort in the work he does. He is well known in the area and respected by his neighbors. He has previously had loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when paying back his loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to maintain his corn crops.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of two young children. He has earned his income as an experienced van taxi driver almost 10 years ago.  His main service route is between his town and its surroundings, which is almost a two hour drive. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body after being in an accident. He wants to renovate it to present a comfortable transportation service to his customers. In the coming year, he expects that his business will continue to grow and he wishes that we wile be able one day to purchase an additionA. van to increase his business operation.

loans.use: to perform maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Norng's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of twelve members. They are located in Damrei Chhlang village, Kandal province.  This village loan group selected Mrs. Norng P., a 38-year-old married woman as the village bank president.

 Mrs. Norng P. and her husband, Mr. Sok Ne, are fishermen who are able to earn a good income to support the family. They now live in a house that is old and uncomfortable. Thus, Mrs. Norng P. would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to fix her house up. This couple has four children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To add to her savings to fix her house up

loans.name: Sandra Yamile

texts.es:
Sandra de 39 años, vende Cd de películas, videos y da servicios de lavandería a sus vecinos. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Comenzó con su negocio porque en el sector donde vive no había una tienda de CD y películas. Trabaja con sus hijos desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días vendiendo Cd de películas y videos de música. Para tener más dinero ella ahora trabaja dando servicios de lavandería y así mantener estables a sus hijos en la economía ya que es madre soltera. Ella quiere continuar con su negocio para poder seguir manteniendo a sus hijos que están pequeños por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo Cd y una lavadora para incrementar sus servicios como lavandería.  

En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento porque ahora es de ladrillos y hacer mas grande su local de películas.
texts.en:
Sandra, 39, sells movie CDs, videos and provides laundry services to her neighbors.  She lives in a periurban zone, El Fortín de Guayaquil, noted for its unpaved streets.

She started the business because her neighborhood did not have a store that sold CDs and movies.  She works with her children from 7am until 8pm every day selling music and movie CDs.  To have more money she now also works providing laundry services in order to keep her children stable economically since she’s a single mother.

She wants to stay in business in order to continue to support her children who are still small so she wants to use the loan to buy CDs and a washing machine to increase her laundry services.

In the future she’d like to have a cement house because it’s currently made out of bricks and to enlarge her movie store.

loans.use: To buy CDs and a washing machine.

loans.name: Elton

texts.en:
Elton is a married man and lives in a rental house without electricity or running water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has operated a kiosk (retail shop) for over four years, and his customers are neighbors and those who pass by his kiosk. His major challenge is the cost to transport his goods from the marketplace to his kiosk location. Elton hopes to have a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, cooking oil and washing soap. Elton decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, cooking oil and washing soap.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: The man shown in the picture is Mr. Chea K., 47.  He is a fisherman. He usually fishes eight hours a day in and around the Tunle Sap River.  He catches around 8 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers, who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Vai Phaiy.  She is 46 and works with him in the fishing business. The couple is blessed with six children  –  five are single and the one is married and living in in another house.  Mr. Chea K. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.  With the remainder of the funds, he will use to repair his house.

loans.use: To purchase nets & fishing implements, and to repair house

loans.name: Sharito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre "Sharito", esta localizado en la comunidad de xalpatlahuac perteneciente al municipio de Tecoanapa Guerrero, las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así es como se llama uno de los hijos de la señora que formó el grupo y que además es la presidenta, la historia es acerca de la señora Celina C. X., ya que es la presidenta, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos Luis ángel de 10 años, Eleazar de 8, Sharito de 5 y Alberto de 2 años de edad, de los cuales solo tres estudian dos primaria y la niña esta cursando el segundo año de preescolar, ya que el menor todavía es muy pequeño. 
La señora Celina tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva mas de 7 años. Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que quería buscar la forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante y darles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación, aparte de que esta actividad le permite estar al pendiente de ellos y no descuidarlos, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como son: leche, aceite, refrescos, huevos, pastas, arroz, azúcar, sal, agua, papel higiénico y jabón, ya que es lo que mas vende.
Con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio se esta beneficiando bastante por que esta sacando a sus hijos adelante, y mejorando mucho mas su calidad de vida, aparte de que ahora puede apoyarlos al cien por ciento con sus estudios, para que tengan un mejor futuro.
Comenta que con su negocio también esta beneficiando mucho a las personas de su comunidad, ya que como es la única que tiene una tienda de abarrotes, todos compran ahí y así no tiene que ir hasta el otro pueblo a comprar y así se ahorran tiempo y dinero. 
La meta que se ha puesto doña Celina es darles una educación a sus hijos, para que asi puedan estudiar una carrera y obtener una muy buena profesión y puedan tener un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, ya que esta pensando en ampliar un poco mas su local para tener mucho mas surtido y mas variedad de productos, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.
Ella dice que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones y les gusta mucho trabajar, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad.
Doña Celina le da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su familia a FRAC y a kiva  por que gracias a ellos pudo cambiar su vida y la de sus hijos, puesto que ahora tendrán una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
Los integrantes "sharito" y las actividades a las que se dedican cada uno de ellos, son las siguientes:
Embertina B. G.-venta de pollos
Velia B. A.-venta de ropa
Celina C. X.-tienda de abarrotes
Natividad H. H.-venta de dulces
Vianey R. B.-venta de pan
Epifania R. A.-frutería
Irma Z. C.-bordadora
Cirila C. G.-venta de choco miles
Leonarda G. Z.-venta de masa
Lucina S. G.-venta de aguas frescas
texts.en:
This group is called 'Sharito' and is located in the community of Xalpatlahuac, in the town of Tecoanapa Guerrero.  The members of the group decided to give it this name because it is the name of one of the children of the lady who formed the group.  This lady is also the group's president. 

This story is about Celina C. X. since she is the group's president.  She is 36 years old and a single mother.  She has four children: 10 year-old Luis Ángel, 8 year-old Eleazar, 5 year-old Sharito and 2 year-old Alberto.  Three of her children are in school.  Two are in elementary school and her daughter is in the second year of pre-school.  Her youngest is still too young for school.

Celina owns a grocery store which she has had for more than 7 years.  She says that she decided to set up her business because she wanted a way of getting her children ahead in life and providing them with a better quality of life and a good education.  Her business also allows her to look out for her children and not neglect them.  She will use her loan money to invest in buying more groceries for her store such as: milk, oil, soft drinks, eggs, pasta, rice, sugar, salt, water, toilet paper and soap since these are the products that sell the most.  She uses the profits from her business to get her children ahead in life and improve their quality of life.  She can also now support them 100% with their studies so that they can have a better future.

She comments that her business is also benefiting the people in her community since she is the only person to have a grocery store and everybody shops there as it means that they don't have to go to another town to do their shopping which saves them time and money.  Celina's goal is to provide her children with an education so that they can study at university and get into good professions so that they can have a better future.  She also wants to grow her business a lot more.  She is thinking of expanding her premises a bit more so that she can have more stock and a greater variety of products to improve and increase her profits.

Celina says that all her fellow group members are responsible people who fulfil their obligations and they all really like to work to improve themselves and overcome any difficulties.  Celina thanks FRAC and Kiva on behalf of herself and her family because thanks to them she has been able to change her life and her children's lives since they will now have a better education and quality of life.  The members of 'Sharito' and the business activities that they carry out are as follows:


Embertina B. G. - chicken sales
Velia B. A. - clothes sales
Celina C. X. - grocery store
Natividad H. H. - sweet sales
Vianey R. B. - bread sales
Epifania R. A. - fruit store
Irma Z. C. - embroidery
Cirila C. G. - chocolate milk sales
Leonarda G. Z. - dough sales
Lucina S. G. - 'aguas frescas' sales ('aguas frescas' are drinks made from fruit, cereals or seeds mixed with sugar and water)

loans.use: To invest in buying more groceries such as: milk, oil, soft drinks, eggs, pasta, rice, sugar, salt, water, toilet paper and soap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expending her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 70-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a rice field business. She lives in Payao, Binalbagan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1993 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and rice field businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,400 PHP. 

Rosalinda is borrowing 16,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosalinda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell to customers

loans.name: Enkhzaya

texts.en: Enkhzaya, 44, is married and has two children. The eldest son, Chinzaya, 20, attends Art College to become a craftsman. They all live in their own small wooden house in Ulaanabaatar, the capital of Mongolia. For over twenty years, Enkhzaya worked in the “Urt Tsagaan” market as a cobbler. For the last six years she has been working for “HOM” LLC as a cobbler. She custom-makes products to her customers' order and design. Therefore, customers always remain satisfied and happy. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy furniture for the improvement of her house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the improvement of her house.

loans.name: Gladys Kahaso

texts.en: Gladys Kahaso K., a 46-year-old fish monger who has been in business for the last two years, is married to Morris and they have two children. This being her second loan from KADET LTD., Gladys plans to purchase more fish to sell, and the anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady who is able to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita N. is from the village of Kilon-ac, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Expedita is married and has 4 adult children. She makes &  sells snacks & other delicacies like rice & cheese cakes in the local community. She also buys and sells charcoal. Expedita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Expedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Expedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

Expedita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like flour & eggs needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Expedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for food production

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata  Traoré est âgée  de 41 ans mariée, mère de 5 enfants et vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux ,ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants dans le quartier  Médina coura de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruite,  pour cela elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa maman . Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle finit par opter pour la vente de bois de construction, il y a 11 ans.  Cette activité est rentable car elle peut vendre plus de 2 chargements de bois dans la semaine. 
Pour l’agrandissement de son activité,  Madame Fatoumata a fait  recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 1an. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, et le précédent a été bien remboursé. Elle compte augmenter  son achat de chargements de bois dans les  villages environnants de Koutiala et elle effectue sa vente  au marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle essentiellement masculine et au comptant.  
Avec l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaire, elle compte sur un bénéfice de 100.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera  pour le remboursement de l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux petites dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Traoré is 41 years old, married and mother to five children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her two co-wives and their children in the Médina coura district of the town of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region). She did not have the opportunity to be educated and for this reason she launched into revenue-generating activities at an early age, learning from her mother. Having tried several revenue-generating activities, she ended up opting for the sale of timber eleven years ago. This activity is profitable because she can sell more than two loads of timber per week. 

In order to expand her business, Fatoumata turned to the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, a year ago. She is on her second individual loan and the previous one was repaid in full. She is planning to increase her timber purchases in the villages surrounding Koutiala and she sells them at the market in Koutiala to a customer base made up principally of men, on a cash basis. 

With the increase in her turnover, she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to contribute to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase loads of timber

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar M. O. is a member of Faulu Kenya with the Exodus group. He runs a private school so as to earn a living. He opened the school three years ago and has employed eight people. He runs the business in a very competitive environment; thus, he puts in extra effort.

Oscar hopes that his school becomes the best school in his area. He has requested 30,000 KES to buy lab equipment for the school.

loans.use: To buy lab equipment for the school

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalinda is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. 

Rosalinda requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis S. de 33 años de edad es una mujer c de 33 años de edad, cuya dedicación al comercio y a la actividad de confecciones es una tarea que disfruta porque le ayuda a generar ingresos para su  su hogar en el que  sostiene a 4 pequeños hijos en las edades de 2 a 11 años. Su negocio inició porque trabajaba en una factoría y al ser despedida emprendió  por iniciativa propia, buscó una forma de generar ingresos  aprovechando su conocimiento y su potencialidad en el mercado. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con la cual comprará telas, hilos y otros insumos así como también invertirá en mercancía como suéteres, colonias, pantalonesy calzado deportivo.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia porque vive en condiciones de arrendamiento  y en la actualidad tiene el gran desafío de incrementar su propio capital de trabajo, porque son muchas las veces en las cuales no puede financiar oportunamente pedidos de mercancias a crédito que le solicitan sus clientes.  En la actualidad genera una utilidad  de un 25 % que aspira más adelante aumentarla, mientras sus mercancías rotan cada dos días porque trabaja sobre pedidos que entrega inmediatamente invierte todo lo que recoge..
texts.en:
Denis S. is 33 years old.  Her business is selling products and making clothes.  This is work that she enjoys because it helps her to make income for her household and she has four young children aged 2-11 to support.  She used to work in a factory and when she was laid off she started this business through her own initiative.  She was looking for a way to make income, making the most of her knowledge and her potential in the market.

This is Denis' first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy fabric, threads and other supplies.  She will also invest in merchandise such as sweaters, colognes, pants and sports shoes.  Her dream is to own her own home because she currently rents.  Denis faces the challenge of increasing her working capital.  On many occasions, her customers make orders for merchandise on credit and she cannot fund them in a timely fashion.  Denis currently makes a 25% profit and she hopes, in the future, to increase her profits.  Her merchandise has a turnover of two days because she works on orders which she delivers immediately.  She invests everything that she makes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and other supplies and to invest in merchandise such as sweaters, colognes, pants and sports shoes

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Agustina vive en el estado de veracruz en el municipio de Tierra Blanca o mejor conocida como la novia del sol, la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera y sus abuandantes calores en verano  de hasta 54°c. Doña Agustina tiene la edad de 73 años estudio hasta el quinto año de primaria, es viuda y tiene una hija de nombre Maria, la cual ya esta casada.

Ella nos platica que hace mas de 40 años cuando su esposo aun vivia decidieron iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ganarse unos pesos extras y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija asi que pusieron una pequeña tienda de abarrotes a la cual llamaron "abarrotes huvero" la cual se encuentra ubicada a unas cuadras del cbetis 66 en la cual ademas de vender abarrotes vende dulces y refrescos.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol,aceite, servilletas, cloro, jabon,papal de baño, arina, sal, azucar, galletas, cafe, dulces y refrescos para resurtir su tienda y porteriormente  venderlos.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea que en un futuro agrandarla y seguir inveritiendo en ella ya que siempre le a gustado tenerla bien surtida para que sus clientes siempre encuntren lo que busquen y asi con confianza vulevan a regresar a hacerle el gasto.
texts.en:
Agustina lives in the state of Veracruz, in the town of Tierra Blanca, better known as the Sun’s Girlfriend.  It is noted for being a cattle raising area and for its extreme summer heat of up to 54 degrees Celsius.  Agustina is 73 years old and finished fifth grade.  She’s a widow and has a daughter whose name is María and is already married.

She relates that over 40 years ago when her husband was still living they decided to work at their own business to earn a few extra pesos and provide their daughter with a better quality of life.  They opened a small grocery store that they called “Abarrotes Huvero” and is located a few blocks from the CBETIS 66 (technical high school).  Besides groceries they also sell candy and soft drinks.

She needs the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, napkins, bleach, soap, toilet paper, flour, salt, sugar, cookies, coffee, candy and soft drinks to restock the store and sell them.

She hopes that with this investment her business will prosper because she’d like to enlarge it in the future and continue investing in it because she’s always liked to have it well stocked so that her customers can find what they are looking for and confidently keep coming back to buy from her.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato, 49 years old, is married and blessed with seven children. He has been growing corn for almost 25 years. At the last cropping, his net income is 35,000 PHP. He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional farm inputs for his corn farm such as seedlings and fertilizers. He would like to continue taking loans and hopes Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to him in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 45, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a technician, and is also a stay-at-home mother who manages the household while she attends to her business.

Teresita operates a photocopying business. She finds that there is more need for her services now than previously as customer demand has increased. Her main customers are students who require her services for their schoolwork. She also has customers who require photocopying for documents, form replication and so forth. Her regular customers are students from the school near her business site and members of the local community. Teresita earns a minimum of 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) profit every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, Teresita is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy bond paper, toners and ink, and other supplies for her business. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy spare parts and pay repair fees for her photocopying machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Teresita dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bond paper, toners and ink, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is married and a mother of one school-age child. She is 26 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ginalyn is a farmer. She grows different kinds of vegetables like peaches, beans and cucumbers. She has been dong this for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,200 doing this type of farming. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 at GDMPC to pay labor costs for land plowing. Ginalyn has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Ginalyn hopes to gain more profit and expand the vegetable farm.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for land plowing.

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армен родился в 1964 г. в городе Каджаране, окончил среднюю школу села Давит-Бек, затем окончил Ереванский Политехнический институт по специальности инженер-механик. Женат, имеет сына и дочь. Жена работает вместе с Арменом в совместно созданном ателье. Сын работает в страховым агентом, дочка учится на на платном заочном отделении Ереванском педагогическом университете на пятом курсе.
С 1998 г.  занимается бизнесом: производит рабочую спецодежду, обувь, рабочие перчатки. Полученную продукцию он поставляет на восемь предприятий Капана и Каджарана. Полученную от бизнеса выгоду Армен тратит на содержание семьи и на оплату обучения дочери.
Сумма кредита в размере 1.000.000 драм необходима для закупки сырья: ткани, нити, пуговиц, подошвы, кожа и т.д.
Данный кредит является 11-ым по счету, полученным Арменом из организации Нор Оризон.
texts.en: Armen as born in 1964 in Kadzharan.  He finished Davit-Bek school and them graduated from the Erevan Polytechnic Institute and an engineer-mechanic.  He is married and has a son and daughter.  His wife works with Armen in their tailoring shop.  His son is an insurance agent and their daughter studies without a scholarship in her fifth year at Erevan Pedagological University.  He has been in business since 1998.  He manufactures specialized work clothes, shoes, work gloves.   He delivers his goods to eight enterprises in Kapan and Kadzharan. Armen spends his income on supporting his family and paying for his daughter's education.  He is taking out a loan of 1,000,000 drams to buy raw materials: fabric, thread, buttons, soles, leather, etc. This will be Armen's eleventh loan from Nor Orizon.

loans.use: to buy raw material (fabric, thread, buttons, soles, leather, etc.) for clothing manufacture.

loans.name: Messanh Comlan

texts.fr: Messanh est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il a 01 enfant. Messanh travaille comme revendeur de sodabi et liqueur depuis 2009. Il vend aux clients  à AVEPOZO. Il achète les produits à LOME et TABLIGBO. Messanh a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 08 bidons de sodabi et 30 bouteilles de liqueur.
texts.en:
Messanh is 32 years old, married to a hairstylist, and has one child. He has worked as a retailer of sodabi (West African palm wine) and liquor since 2009. He buys his products in Lomé and Tabligbo, and sells to customers in Avepozo.

Messanh has requested this first loan from WAGES so that he can buy 8 barrels of sodabi and 30 bottles of liquor.

loans.use: to buy 8 barrels of sodabi (West African palm wine) and liquor.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es: Leoncia, natural D. la ciudad D. San Francisco D. 66 años, es una mujer que siempre a trabajado muy duro por sobre salir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fortunato D. 67 años y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez muy tranquila.La actividad a la que se dedica Leoncia, es la venta D. ropa, en su puesto ubicado en el mercado “Gamarrita D. la ciudad D. San Francisco del departamento D. Ayacucho - Perú”, ella  todos los días atienD. a muchos compradores, quienes sabiendo D. la buena calidad y lo novedoso D. las prendas que ella misma trae desD. la ciudad D. Lima, no dudan en comprarle en grandes cantidades.Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es distraerse con cada uno D. sus clientes a la vez aprovecha en aconsejar a sus compradores sobre las prendas que mejor las quedan, ya que así se gana la  confianza D. cada uno D. ellos, lleva 45 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer largas horas en espera D. clientes. Leoncia agradece al apoyo solidario D. los financistas ya que gracias al apoyo D. ellos va progresando y obteniendo buenas comodidades. En adelante espera contar con la misma fuerza para los años posteriores  ya que su negocio es su único sustento.Este será su crédito número 06 con MFP y por ello espera D. su colaboración para poder comprar la mercadería a la vez se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas D. pago ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa D. la ciudad D. Lima, para implementar mejor su puesto D. ventas.
texts.en: Leonica, a native of the city of San Francisco, is a 66 year old woman who has always worked very hard to get on in life. She lives in her own house with her 67 year old husband, Fortunado. What she most want is to live a peaceful old age. The business she works in is selling clothes and she has a stall in the "Gamarrita" market in the city of San Francisco in the department of Ayacucho-Peru. Every day she serves many customers who know that the clothes she brings from Lima are good quality and in fashion so they don't hesitate to buy in large quantities. What she most likes about her work is distracting herself with each of her customers and taking the opportunity to advise them about the clothes that will best suit them. In this way, she gains the confidence of each customer. She has been doing this work for 45 years and thinks that the most difficult thing is that she has to work long hours waiting on customers. Leoncia is grateful for the support of the financiers as, thanks to their support, she is progressing and is able to afford some comforts. In the future, she hopes to have the same strength she has had in previous years as her business is her only financial support. This will be her 6th loan from MFP and she hopes this collaboration will enable her to buy the merchandise and at the same time she promises to make her repayments on time as she wants to be able to access more loans later. She will use the $375 she is requesting to buy more clothes in the city of Lima to better stock her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from the city of Lima, to better supply her business.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda nació en la comunidad de Amaru de la ciudad de Pisaq (Perú) y tiene 35 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora bisutería artesanal como por ejemplo anillos, pulseras, collares, brazalete y pendientes, ella realiza sus productos a pedido del cliente.  Ya son 9 años que se dedica a la artesanía y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Leonarda requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo alambre, mostacillones, perlas, villa y otras cosas más. 

Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Leonarda was born in the community of Amaru in the city of Pisaq (Perú).  She’s 35 years old and is in a common law relationship; she has four children.  At present, she lives in the city of Pisaq where she carries out her activities.  She has a small workshop at home where she makes artisanal jewelry like rings, bracelets, necklaces, arm bands and pendants.  She makes the items on order for her customers.  Leonarda needs the loan to buy materials like wire, beads, pearls, and other supplies.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank meets every thirty days in Pisaq District, Calca Province (Cusco, Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, its commerce, its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Ana Soledad

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, donde se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres de sus antepasados.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  12 y 2  años el mayor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es artesano.
       
Ella es una gran ama de casa que para tener sus propios recursos instalo un local en las afueras de su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, allí también hace poco empezó con un nuevo negocio de venta de gas de uso domestico lo cual le está dejando muy buenas ganancias ya que en este lugar son pocos los lugares que venden este producto tan necesario para los hogares,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 en la venta de artesanías y hasta las 21h00 en la venta de gas ya que a veces llegan sus clientes hasta esa hora. Nos cuenta que lleva 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y con la venta de gas apenas tres meses ya que empezó con el crédito anterior.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía y bombonas de gas. Está  en el Banco Comunal 6 años y le gusta por la ayuda que dan para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
In La Pila in the canton of Montecristi the communal bank Para el Futuro De la Mujer meets every 15 days. This place is well known in both the province and country for its rich traditional culture and it is a place where you can find a great variety of handicrafts made by the local inhabitants following the customs of their ancestors.

Here we met Señora Ana. She is 34 years old and married. From this marriage, she has 2 children, 12 and 2 years of age. The eldest one studies in school. Her husband is a craftsman.

She is a great housewife who, in order to have her own resources, set up an area outside her house where she sells all kinds of handicrafts. Recently, she also started a new business selling gas for domestic use which gives her very good profits as in the area there are few places that sell this product which is such a necessity for homes. She works every day from 08:00 until 18:00 selling handicrafts and until 21:00 selling gas as customers sometimes arrive as late as this. She tells us that she has been selling handicrafts for 10 years and selling gas for just 3 months as she started the busness with her previous loan.

This loan is for the purchase of more handicrafts and gas cylinders. She has been with the communal bank for 6 years and she enjoys the support they give her to get ahead.

Her dream is to have a big business.

.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts and gas cylinders.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Rolando provides karaoke or videoke where customers pay five pesos per song. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to pay for the electricity for maintenance.

Rolando is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rolando hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for electricity

loans.name: Jusufu P.'s Group

texts.en:
Jusufu is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kenema city, this 26-year-old has been in the teaching profession for 11 years now. He is married and has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Jusufu has requested this loan in order to buy local produce like cocoa and coffee for resale.

Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, seeking a loan of 7,000,000 leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy local produce like cocoa and coffee for resale

loans.name: Rouguiata Samba

texts.fr: Madame Rouguiata est âgée de 50 ans. Elle vit dans l’une des localités du territoire  sénégalais et s’active en même temps dans le commerce de tissus et la couture. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans ses activités qu’elle a choisies par opportunité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus qu’elle va confectionner et vendre à l’ occasion de la fête de Tabaski qui approche. Son objectif est de répondre à la demande   de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle. Son objectif final est d’accroitre au maximum les bénéfices tirés de son activité.
texts.en: Madame Rouguiata is 50 years old. She lives in a town in Senegal and is in the business of selling fabric and tailoring.   She has three years of experience in this type of work that she chose as the opportunity presented itself.  She has been a member of l'U-IMCEC since March of 2011.  She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs in order to buy fabric that she will use to make clothing to sell at the upcoming festival of Tabaski.  Her goal is to meet the growing demand of her customers. Her ultimate goal is to make maximum profits from her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric to be made into clothing to be sold.

loans.name: Mathews

texts.en: Mathews is a married man, 28 years old and blessed with one child who is in school. For the last five years, he has been running a welding business to bring up his family. He also makes bricks for additional income. Mathews has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. With 50,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to add to his stock of metals for his business. In the next five years, he wants to establish his business and become an employer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more metal.

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en:
Edmar, 25 years old, is engaged in farming. He has been in this business for 4 years. He needed to work in this field because he is the only one of his siblings who could work. Nevertheless, he accepted it wholeheartedly because it helps a lot towards finishing his vocational education.

Edmar is asking for a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to be use in his corn field. He wants to improve his production for the betterment of their lifestyle. His parents and siblings are depending on Edmar  to have better income.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is a 55-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 5 children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 3 years.

Tu would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confections, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate more income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confections, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Solicita el crédito para adquirir más mercancía de temporada de invierno ya que es lo que se vende más en tiempo de frio y tener variedad de ropa nueva y usada. 
La señora Maria Del Carmen tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de ropa en diferentes partes de la ciudad, con estas ganancias le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares y escolares ya que el trabaja en una fabrica. 
Desea invertir más en su negocio y así poder tener más variedad de mercancía y ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen has been selling clothing in different parts of the city for more than 5 years. With her earnings she is able to help her husband, who works in a factory, with their family and school expenses. She wants to invest more in her business so that she can have more product options and make more money.

She asks for a loan to get more seasonal winter merchandise, since that's what she sells most during the cold season. She wants to have a variety of new and used clothing.

loans.use: to buy winter merchandise for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four working children. They all cooperate together to enrich their life and live properly. She started her own home business as a tailor eight years ago and has already thirty years of experience in the tailoring field. As for her husband, he owns a textiles shop. 

Today, Mona needs to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a tailoring machine and added raw materials such as textiles. She’s sure that this loan will boost her productivity, therefore her sales and thus her revenues.  In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and added raw materials such as textiles.

loans.name: Las Cumplidas Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Marisol quien junto a varias compañeras mas quienes invitaron y organizaron a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres emprendedoras.
La sra. Marisol está casada hace 18 años con el señor Agustín quien es Militar, tienen tres hijas menores que van a la primaria. Ella nos comenta que tiene una cantina donde tiene muy buenos ingresos y por consiguiente puede ayudar en los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, golosinas, galletitas, etc. Ella sueña con agrandar su negocio y lograr ofrecer a sus clientes buena variedad de comidas y bebidas y golosinas, logrando asi aumentar sus ingreso y brindar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The contact person who established this committee was Marisol.  Together with several others, she invited and organized a group of friends to join the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) program.

Marisol has been married to Agustín, who is a soldier, for 18 years.  They have three dependent daughters who are in elementary school.  Marisol tells us that she has a snack bar which makes her very good income and enables her to help with the household expenses.

Marisol is requesting a loan to buy drinks, candies, cookies, etc.  She dreams of expanding her business and offering her customers a good variety of food, drinks and candies.  This will increase her income and she will be able her to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy drinks, candies, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 26-year-old young man. He is single and lives with his parents. His father is a worker with a decent salary. Fadi wants to share with his parents the expense of making repairs to the house such as changing tiles, changing windows and doors, installing lights, etc. 

Because his father has a decent salary, which is not enough to pay for these repairs, Fadi needs to take a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will enable Fadi to share with his family the expenses needed to repair the house, which will offer to Fadi and his family better home living conditions. 

Fadi is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for repairing the house

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 32 years old and married with five children. He owns a produce business. He started as an errand boy, and after accumulating enough wages, he ventured into rice selling. He has a challenge of high transportation costs, and his business dream is to buy his own vehicle. His family dream is to educate his children up to the university level. Christopher needs the loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice for selling.

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en: Hiam is a 32 year old single woman from Sahab Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to pay for clothes to sell, she wants to increase her income. In the future she would like to expand her project.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Eya

texts.en:
Madam Eya A. was born toward 1955 at Ahépé (P/Yoto). She is illiterate and mother of six (06) children. Her husband , a volunteer teacher at a private school, with meagre salaries but always irregulars. What puts him to spend several weeks in the village without trying to meet the family giving up a large part of the charges in the woman hands. Dynamic and undertaking, she growths her small activity of food selling before the schools. From that activity which she controls well and in which she is making profit, she assumes as much as possible, her children elementary needs. Honest and rigorous, she has succeeded to manage with rigour, the two credits obtained repaid promptly. She requests today a credit of $550 which will serve to buy cereals in view to strengthen her activities of mould paste. So, she could increase her incomes and provide for the family needs.

Madame A. Eya est née vers 1955 à Ahépé dans la préfecture Yoto. Elle est analphabète et mère de six (06) enfants. Son mari est un enseignant volontaire dans une école privée aux maigres salaires mais encore irréguliers. Ce qui fait qu’il passe des semaines dans le village sans chercher à revoir la famille laissant une bonne partie des charges sur la femme. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle développe sa petite activité de vente de nourriture devant les écoles. A partir de cette activité qu’elle maîtrise bien et en qui elle doit sa survie, elle assume tant que mal, les besoins élémentaires de ses enfants. Honnête et rigoureuse, elle a su gérer avec rigueur, les deux crédits obtenus et promptement remboursés. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $550 qui servira à acheter des céréales en vue renforcer ses activités de vente de boule de pâte. Ainsi donc, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary intends to buy 7 bags of maize and beans

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura is married and helps support her own family and her parents. Because of a lack of finances, she had to stop her studies at the college. With 5 years experience working at the market, she has gained experience and has made a successful business with consistent customers. She started her business by trading food products because there is a constant demand for them but she has recently added household goods to her trade. She has two dreams: get a good education and provide for her family.

loans.use: Increasing the variety and amount of goods sold in her business, by adding household goods to her inventory

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pelagio is 50 years old and married. He lives with his wife who is 52 years old and helps him in the business. They have 6 children ages 30, 25, and 20 plus twins who are 15 years old and the youngest one who is 7 years old. The three youngsters are still in school and their oldest daughter is already a nurse.

Pelagio comments that 30 years ago, he learned the trade from his brother-in-law with whom he worked for 3 years. Then, he became independent and was able to establish his own upholstery shop. The shop is located at his home where his wife helps him with the daily tasks of the business.

He says that he always turn to the loans for investing on his activity. His goal is to grow financially and be able to provide his home with basic comforts and to provide his children with what they need.

His customer base is mainly composed of local city bus owners that trust his work and request that Pelagio does the upholstery repairs to the seats on their vehicles.

He wants to apply for a loan to invest it in buying leather and fabrics which are the raw materials that make up his work's foundation. Many times, due to a shortage or lack of them, he can't take large scale orders or wholesale orders as well.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Pelagio tiene 50 años, es casado, vive con su esposa que tiene 52 años. Ella lo ayuda con el negocio. Tienen 6 hijos de 30, 25 y 20 años respectivamente, además de una pareja de mellizos que este año cumplieron 15 años y la menor tiene 7 años. Los tres hijos menores aún estudian y la mayor de ellos ya es enfermera.

Pelagio comenta que hace 30 años aprendió la profesión con un cuñado con quien trabajó durante 3 años hasta que pudo independizarse y montar su propia tapicería. Actualmente su negocio funciona desde su casa en donde su esposa también le ayuda en dicha profesión.

Comenta que siempre recurrió a los préstamos para invertirlos en su actividad a fin de crecer económicamente y lograr por sobre todo llenar de comodidades su casa y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.

Su clientela está conformada principalmente por los dueños de colectivos que confían en su trabajo y le encargan el arreglo de los tapizados de los asientos de sus vehículos.

Desea acceder a un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cuerinas y telas que constituyen la materia prima fundamental para su trabajo y que muchas veces por falta de las mismas no puede llevar a cabo trabajos de mayoristas.

loans.use: Buying leathers and fabrics for his upholstery shop.

loans.name: Silafaga

texts.en: Silafaga is a thirty-eight year old mother of three kids. She owns a convenience shop in her village of Alaoa. She started her business with a canteen selling ice cakes, cigarettes etc. And now she has expanded her business to a grocery shop. The income is used for multiple reasons, but her first priority is her payment every week as she wants to continue her relationship with SPBD. She earns $28 profit daily after all expenses.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Chapparo is 39 years old and is married to Maria Balbina Gomez. Together they have two children: a girl of 17 who is now in her senior year of high school; and a boy of 11 who is in the 5th grade. The family lives in their own house in Villa Universitaria, a neighborhood of San Ignacio.

Since 1997, Mr. Chapparo has had a stand that sells magazines. He sells magazines of all kinds with both national and international distribution, as well as newspapers, lottery tickets, and other similar items. His wife, Maria, helps run the store when Roberto has other work. Occasionally, Roberto works as a photographer or videographer for special events. Additionally, he works as a photographer for a weekly paper called “La Jornada”.

He has asked for a loan in order to repair his magazine shop. By maintaining his business he hopes to improve day by day his life and that of his family .

loans.use: To repair his magazine shop

loans.name: Ira

texts.en: Ira K. is a 36-year-old-woman. She lives with her partner and their four children in Sassandra, a rural city on the southwest Atlantic coast of Cote d'Ivoire. She sells various housekeeping products in her store in the Sassandra market. Ira is also a member of the women's association of trade development of Sassandra. She is very dynamic and cares for her family and for her brothers, who have been affected by the recent conflict in Cote d'Ivoire. All her four children go to school and she contributes to the education and household expenses. She wants to use the loan to purchase goods in bulk and improve her margin.

loans.use: To purchase goods in buk

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru:
Erkin I. is in need of a loan to purchase furniture. He is married and has 4 children. He works as one of the truck drivers in Geological expedition. He delivers goods (heavy) from the location of the expedition to the organization. He is a contract worker, so he has work only when there are goods to be delivered. However, this is not enough to provide his family with all the necessities. His parents pension is very small. The children ares till little and do not work. The loan from MicroInvest will allow him to improve his family's financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Исмоилову Эркину необходим кредит для приобретения мебели. Он женат, имеет четверых детей. Работает водителем грузовых машин в Комплексе Геологической экспедиции. Он привозит товары (тяжелые грузы) с места в свое предприятие. Он работает по контракту, когда есть товар , есть работа. Но этого мало, что бы обеспечить семье всем необходимым. Его родители получают очень маленькую пенсию. Дети еще малы и не работают. Микроинвест является очень кстати для того что бы обеспечить самым необходимым.

loans.use: consumer credit

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en: Nargiza A. has been a MicroInvest client since 2007. She lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. She started her business practically from scratch but now she has her own trade outlet to sell household goods. She trades various products that are daily necessities (haunches, ropes, kettles, clothespins, thermostat phials, etc.) and she has recently expanded her business to sell children's clothes. She has a wide assortment of goods for sale yet she is seeking a loan of 2100 TJS ($625) in order to purchase additional products Chinese suppliers.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods from China.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Mrs. Lila lives to attend to her customers and proviD. them with good service. She works selling chickens in a local market of her city. She has been doing this for a long time and thanks to her hard work she has formed good relationships with many of her customers. Mrs. Lila is a mother of 4 children. Only one of the children lives at home, as he studies at the city university. This diligent mother would like to have more capital to invest in her business so that she can continue her hard work. She wishes to increase her earnings so that she can help her beloved son realize his dreams. Your support will help turn her own dreams into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Dar una buena atención a sus y clientes es la rutina diaria D. la señora Lila, quien se dedica a la venta D. pollos beneficiados en un puesto del mercado D. su ciudad, ella se dedica a esta actividad desD. hace mucho tiempo y gracias a su desempeño dirio ha podido entablar amistad con muchas amas D. casa que la visitan diariamente.Es madre D. cuatro hijos y sólo uno D. ellos permanece actualmente en casa debido a que se encuentra estudiando en la universidad D. su ciudad. Ésta trabajadora madre tiene deseos D. incrementar su capital D. trabajo a fin D. continuar con su labor y elevar sus ganancias para contribuir un poco más con los sueños D. su querido hijo.Tu importante aporte hará realidad los deseos D. ésta trabajadora madre.

loans.use: To offer a wider variety of chickens to customers

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en:
My name is Parween A.. I was born in Pakistan’s second largest city, Lahore, but after marriage I had to move to a small city, Borewala, with my husband. I am a mother of four sons. Two of my sons are married and live in our native village and the other two live with me. When my kids were young I used to sew clothes on order. However, I do not stitch anymore. My husband is a plumber. My two sons sell milk. Currently we need to expand our milk business, and therefore need to buy a cow. We are requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow.

My group members need loans for the following businesses: Nasreen B. will invest her share of the loan in her husband’s business. He is a plumber. Safia B. plans to sell bangles from her house. Khursheed B. is a widow and wants to invest her share of the loan in her juice corner.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nandasakulira Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Caroline A. is an average young Kenyan, married with 3 children of her own and 2 children of her late sister.

Caroline started her tailoring business two years ago after completing her tailoring course in the district of Busia. Before venturing into the tailoring business, Caroline used to work for a friend for a commission fee in the Busia Municipality market, from which she accumulated her savings to start her own business. She initially started with one sewing machine, but she has worked hard to expand her business, and she currently has two sewing machines.

With the little profit she gets from her business, she is still able to provide food, clothing, and shelter for her children and to pay school fees. With the help of her loan, Caroline will be able to purchase one more sewing machine and clothing materials for her business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Krut

texts.en: Krut Y is a grocery seller in her village in the Chamkarchek Choeung Village, Pursat Province. She is a widow and lives with five children, three of whom are working as road construction workers. One is studying to be a hairdresser and one other is attending school. Desiring to start a new karaoke business, now she is seeking a loan to purchase karaoke materials for her new business and use the remainder of the loan to purchase her grocery stocks.

loans.use: To purchase karaoke materials for her new business and purchase grocery stocks

loans.name: Oliveta

texts.en: Oliveta Vaioso, 42, is married with 2 children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Oliveta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be all use to maintain the business. Her husband does the farming

loans.use: to finance equipment needed for the taro plantation

loans.name: Imara Lisseth

texts.es:
Imara is requesting financing to invest in making repairs to her home; she will construct a bathroom. She works as an educator at Salomón Ibarra Mayorga School and has been there for 5 years. She has no children, but she helps her mother with the household expenses. Her husband is a cab driver.

Imara is a young woman with high hopes of self-improvement and very responsible. She is an educator who loves her job being that she helps many from the Los Angeles neighborhood in the municipality of Nueva Guinea learn to read and write.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Imara está solicitando financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, hará la construcción de un servicio higiénico. Labora como docente de la Escuela Salomón Ibarra Mayorga desde hace 5 años, no tiene hijos pero ayuda a su mamá con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja como taxista.

Imara es una joven con alto espiritud de superación personal, responsable, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos a aprender a leer y escribir de la colonia los Angeles del municipio de Nueva Guinea.

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Shekha's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Shekha is 25 years old. She is married with one child aged 1 year old. She has been selling televisions and radios since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Shekha now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mashavu, Mwandawa, Mwanabaraka, and Hidaya.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Faava

texts.en:
Faava T., age 49, is married with 1 child. She has many years of experience in the chips and vegetable farming business. She sells to the villagers and the public four days per week. 

She has taken 1 previous loan from South Pacific Business Development (SPBD). She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$83 USD). SPBD loans are Faava's only access to capital, because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable oil, plastic, paper, and bananas

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Originaire de Ouidah, dame K. Antoinette est âgée de 42 ans . Placée très tôt auprès d'une tutrice, elle n'eut pas la chance d'aller à l'école mais fut initiée par cette dernière à la vente de nourriture. Après son mariage, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de divers articles, ce que d'ailleurs elle finit pas abandonner au profit  de la vente de nourriture. Aux dits de dame K. Antoinette, cette activité lui procure d'énormes revenus. C'est pour la renforcer qu'elle opte pour ce troisième prêt de 150000fcfa. Mariée à DOVONON Pascal, menuisier de profession, elle est mère de 08 enfants dont la dernière Yabo est en classe de CM2.
texts.en:
Originally from Ouidah, Benin, Mrs. Antoinette K. is 42 years old. Placed with a guardian at a very young age, she did not have an opportunity to go to school, but instead her guardian introduced her to selling food. After getting married, she became involved in selling various things, but she ended up abandoning these sales in favor of the profit to be gained from selling food. According to Mrs. K., this business generates a huge income. She is going for this third loan of 150,000 FCFA ($300) to improve her business. Married to Pascal Dovonon, a carpenter by profession, she is mother to eight children, the youngest of whom, Yabo, is in the 5th grade at school.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, two cans of vegetable oil, two cases of pasta and half a case of tinned tomatoes.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela baji is 24 years old and is married to M. who sells food items such as candies, biscuits at wholesale.  Nabeela baji lives in a city Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of two daughters. Nabeela baji owns a milk selling business. She gets milk from her buffalo and sells it at different milk shops. Her monthly income is from $10 to $12. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to help expand her milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk business

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lưu Thị D. năm nay 52 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị D. chỉ chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ, sau khi tham gia Quỹ nhờ có thêm nguồn vốn công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được mở rộng hơn. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi khoảng 100 con lợn thịt  cho thu nhập 2.500.000đ/tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luu Thi D. is 52 years old. She has been with TYM Fund since 2006. Before joining the fund, she had only been able to raised livestock on a small scale. After joining the fund, with additional investment and funding, she has been able to expand her business. Currently, her family raises about 100 pigs for meat, which brings her an income of 2,500,00 VND per month. She would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to buy more pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Lilliam Del Socorro

texts.es: Lilliam, una joven comerciante que comenzó su propio negocio de venta de mariscos  hace ya tres años por iniciativa propia con la ayuda de su esposo. Tiene 29 años de edad, casada con un hijo de 7 años estudiante de primaria, residente de La Comarca sabana grande en la ciudad e Managua. Entre sus planes esta el obtener más ingresos para poder mejorar su vivienda y de esta manera lograr un mejor estilo de vida para ella y su familia. Para llevar a cabo sus metas esta solicitando  un préstamo con un periodo  de devolución de ocho meses, que le permitirá la compra de más producto y así obtener más ganancias y cubrir  la demanda. Gracias a la ayuda que le brinda AFODENIC, lograra su anhelo.
texts.en:
Lilliam is a young shop keeper who started her own business selling seafood three years ago on her own initiative and with the help of her husband. She lives in the Sabana Grande area of the city of Managua, Nicaragua, is 29 years old and married with a 7 year-old son who is in primary school. One of her goals is to increase her income, which would enable her to make improvements to her home and therefore provide a better quality of life for her and her family. For her to achieve her goals, she requests a loan on a repayment term of eight months, which will allow her to buy more goods and therefore increase profits and meet demand. Fortunately, with the help of AFODENIC, she will realise her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to repair her home

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo ("Hello!") from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Joyce M. from Mwanza. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 15 years old. Joyce owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items. She has had her shop since 2006. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Joyce currently earns about $160 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase kanga, cosmetics and soda. In the future, she plans to add more business. Joyce thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase kanga, cosmetics and soda.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata  Kandé, 25 ans est mariée avec 01 enfant  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé depuis 4 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter  et revendre des  thioubs (tissus teintés). Aminata assure la dépense quotidienne chez  elle. Elle veut renforcer son commerce  pour avoir plus de revenus. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aminata Kandé, age 25, is married and has a child to support. She has been a member of the village council of Vélingara Foulbé for four and a half years. He work consists in buying and reselling thioub (dyed cloth). Aminata ensures that the day-to-day expenses at her place are covered. She wants to boost her commerce to have more income. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell dyed cloth

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con la necesidad de mantener su hogar y con dos pequeños niños que debe brindarles el alimento, la señora Esperanza V. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de venta de comida y atoles ambulantemente por las calles de su municipio de El Sauce donde a diario se desempeña en esta labor.

Es importante destacar que la señora Esperanza ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a esta labor y ha logrado salir adelante, La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de su materia prima y así salir adelante en su negocio de venta de comestibles ambulantemente por las calles de su municipio.
texts.en:
In order to maintain her home with two little kids to feed, Ms. Esperanza V. works very hard to sell food items and "atoles" (maize drink) in the streets of her municipality of El Sauce where she daily carries out this work.

It's important to highlight the fact that Ms. Esperanza has dedicated a large part of her life to this work and has successfully been able to get out ahead. The reason why she's come to Ceprodel is to be granted a loan to purchase basic materials and to move forward in her business selling food items in the streets of her municipality.


Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer T. is 32 years old. She is married and a mother of one child. Currently, her daughter Afua is in school. She lives with her husband who is a businessman. She was involved in a severe accident when she was going to buy supplies of goods in Accra. Unfortunately her left hand was chopped off. Her insurance claim was reduced and as vulnerable as she was, she could not get a good lawyer to defend her to collect what is due her. Looking at her situation, Jennifer wanted to commit suicide but she did not upon the advice of her religious leaders and other people. Before that, she used to sew dresses and undertake other businesses that demanded the use of both hands. Right now Jennifer cannot sew dresses apart from patching her daughter's dress. Currently she is into the sale of cooking utensils and selling of lace and clothing materials. She sells through hawking, house-to-house selling; she had 10 years experience in sewing until the pathetic incident occurred. Jennifer also travels to the nearby communities to sell during their market days. She is adapting to her new predicament. Jennifer needs money to provide for her child, herself and the family. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy cooking utensils, lace materials, clothing materials etc. With your support, she believes that she would be more prepared to provide for her family and rent a store to sell. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means cry for help.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, cooking utensils, lace materials etc.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael S. is a high school graduate and he got married at the age of 19 when his wife was only 16 years old. They have a daughter named Princess. They are living in the rural village of Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. The young couple says that having a family is a lot of responsibility but they are doing their best, with the guidance of their parents.

Michael operates a passenger tricycle. With his patience and sacrifices, he is able to earn a monthly income of 2,350 PHP which is a big help to his family. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP for the maintenance of his tricycle. The money will also be used for their farming needs. He hopes that they can set up another business which will be managed by his wife for extra income.

loans.use: Tricycle Maintenance

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida A. has worked in the agricultural field since she was young. Her parents instilled in her the value of hard work, which she demonstrates today. She buys and sells cattle and, in this manner, earns income for her family. Valida owns farmland but does not have a lot of confidence in agricultural production, so she has now opted to devote her time to raising animals. She uses her land now only to produce food for herself and her animals.

Valida is married and has three children. She hopes to purchase three more calves and in this way improve her living situation. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of $1,500.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en:
Servilla N. is popularly known by her nickname which is “Villa“ in Barangay Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Renato Sr. and they are gifted with three children: Renato Jr., Renante, and Revelyn. Two of them have already graduated from college and are presently applying for a job, while the youngest is still studying in the tertiary level.
