Servilla hopes that all of them will someday become successful in their professions for she knows that their success is also her success, too, because she really sacrifices a lot for them. 

Servilla manages a vegetable-vending business. She is requesting to borrow PHP 7,000 as additional working capital. Her daily income was utilized for their household’s expenditures and for the studies of her youngest child. She also is hoping that her business becomes progressive and stable.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma operates a direct selling business in her village. She sells personal items from AVON, NATASHA and MSE in Barangay Masaya Norte, over the mountainous place of San Agustin, Isabela. She is 42 years old and very determined to work hard for the improvement of her family's daily living. She would like a loan amounting to PHP5,000 as additional capital for her direct selling business.

Vilma is married to Generoso and they have three children who are Ralph Banny - 19, Hanz Alvin - 16 and Janna Kathrine - six. She hopes to give them a better future. The couple is doing their best to sustain the needs of their children and daily basic needs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Selling office supplies is the only source of income for Rovshan A., a humble 33-year-old young man who's been doing this for 8 years. Rovshan is a married father of one son. His son is the reason that he works hard, in order to provide him with the best, brightest future. This young man has many projects for his own future. The main project is that Rovshan wants to open his own store where he would be able to sell not only office supplies but also a great number of books. His wish is to add more office supplies, therefore have more to offer to his clients. Rovshan would pay back this loan and with the money he makes he would be able to pay for his son's education. This young man waits for your help. Let's make his dream come true.

loans.use: purchase office supplies and books

loans.name: Zurafo

texts.en: Zurafo is a widow and has a son. Two years ago she started a little business selling women’s clothing in the local city market. Today her business is doing well. Zurafo is a focused, hard-worker. Many weeks she will work without days off to make sure her dearest son has everything he needs. Because of her cheerfulness and customer-friendly service, her total number of customers is constantly growing. Zurafo would like to get a loan of 3,000 Somoni to increase her available stock. One of her long-term plans is to open a new vending facility. She believes that this loan will help her succeed in her business endeavors and boost her economic activity. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women

loans.name: Fenias Filije

texts.pt:
Fenias Fileje C. nasceu em Gaza, tem 59 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 15 aos 25 anos sendo os  dois mais novos estudantes. Para além dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua irmã que sofre de uma doença mental e que vive na cidade de maputo, gastando 1.000,00MT por mês.

Sai de Gaza com seu Comandante militar em missão de serviço para Tete (província nortenha do pais) onde trabalhou por muito pouco tempo por não concordar com as idéias e decisões do seu superior e foi é sujeito a passar 3 meses na cadeia. Após sua saída junta se a Renamo (partido Político que desencadeou a guerra dos 16 anos no pais) e foi colocado para trabalhar no pais vizinho (Suazilândia) como representante do mesmo partido, onde trabalhou a mais de 25 anos.

Assim, ele consegue construir 18 dependências de aluguer onde cobra por dependência um valor de 100 randes (o que equivale em moeda nacional 350.00MT) e conta com ajuda da sua filha esta que tem recolhido os valores naquele pais, pois ele já se encontra numa idade avançada.

 Apos sua reforma, regressa a Moçambique concretamente na vila de Namachas na fronteira da Suazilândia e constrói uma barraca que dista a 45 km da mesma vila, pois a população da quela região não se beneficiava de nenhum estabelecimento comercial.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Fenias na Hluvuku e Kiva. Nunca teve em nenhuma outra instituição aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos. Tem como melhor produto (peixe, açúcar arroz e bolachas) uma vês que esta localizada perto duma Escola Primária. Ganha um lucro no valor de 4.000.00MT e consegue poupar 2.000.00MT mensalmente e conta com ajuda dum empregado.

Propõe se a reembolsar o empréstimo sem nenhum problema e pedir um outro credito para aumenta com mesmo objectivo para responder a demanda e elevar o grau de satisfação dos seus clientes.
texts.en:
Fenias Fileje C., 59, was born in the province of Gaza, Mozambique. The father of 5 children between the ages of 15 and 25 (the two youngest still in school), Fenias currently lives in Namaacha. In addition to supporting his family he also contributes 1.000,00 mt per month toward the care of his mentally disabled sister, who lives in Maputo. Fenias left Gaza as a young men to go to Tete (in northern Mozambique) on a special mission as a military Commander, and soon after was sent to jail for 3 months for disagreeing with his superior's ideas and decisions. After being released from jail, he joined Renamo (a political party who fought against the Frelimo party in the 16-year civil war in Mozambique) and was sent to Swaziland, as a representative of the party, where he worked for 25 years. His years of work in Swaziland allowed him to build 18 rental places there, for which he charges 100 randes (the equivalent of 350.00 mt per unit). He counts with the help of his daughter to manage the places and collect rent. As a reformed military he moved back to Mozambique and settled in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, where he has since been running a grocery store (located 45 km from Namacha and near an elementary school) serving people who prior to that had to travel much further to find a commercial establishment. Fenias bestselling products are fish, sugar, rice and crackers. He has one employee and earns 4.000.00 mt per month, which allows him to support his family, pay his helper's salary and still save about 2.000,00 mt. This is Fenias' first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva (he has never applied for a loan before). He will use it to increase his stock, and expects to repay it without a problem. He plans to apply for more loans in the future, to keep investing in meeting the demand for his products as well as increasing the level of satisfaction of his clients.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more groceries and basic products to sell at his grocery store

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en: Kwasi is forty – two years old. He is married and has given birth to two children, both sons and still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Kwasi is a trader. He trades in food stuffs and cereals such as plantain, yam, beans, maize, etc. He sells in his community and also supplies to other food vendors. Kwasi procures the goods from nearby communities. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Married with five kids who are currently in school, Victoria is forty-seven years old. She sells foodstuff like cassava, plantain, maize etc. in the local market of her community. Selling for the past twenty years, she has lots of experience to win customers. She treks to farming communities to buy her foodstuff from the hands of local farmers which saves her from middlemen who inflate the prices. Victoria is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with a quality education for their future careers. 

She requests a loan to top up her working capital to enable her to buy stock in bulk each trip to meet the demand of her customers. Being able to buy in bulk is very advantageous. It means fewer trips to fill the demand and it is a hedge against the rapidly rising prices. She therefore wants the loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff in bulk.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela B. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin. She is 60 years old, married and has one adult child. Miguela's income comes mainly from her corn sales, which she has been doing for over 35 years now and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Miguela joined GDMPC to access their financial services with the plan to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguela has successfully repaid her first GDMPC loan which was in the amount of 5,000 PHP. She is requesting a new second loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. She plans to improve her family's living conditions with the additional revenue generated by the business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Sambuu

texts.en: Sambuu B. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest daughter currently works as a librarian, her youngest daughter is a university student and her youngest son is in kindergarten. B. operates a vegetable selling business in her town. She started her business in 2000 with capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD), and has since built a stable operation. She has found success in her trade and attributes it to the good reputation she has built with her many customers. Today, her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). For the future, B. hopes for continued business success and says, "I would like to expand my business and hope to one day own my own workspace." She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tor

texts.en: Tor C. is a 53-year-old widow and mother. She has two school-aged children, as well as a grown daughter who is married and lives with her own family. Tor C. earns a living by planting various crops on her own farmland. She currently plants a watermelon crop, which she will harvest when they are mature. Recently, her crop is requiring more fertilizer. Because of that, Tor C. has decided to seek a loan to buy more fertilizer which she will use to improve her crop yield. She will use the other half of her loan to purchase a used moto for transport.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a transport moto.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 41-year-old married woman with 5 children. To earn a living, she sells foodstuffs, drinks, and cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. She explains that she sells her various products for long hours to ensure that she can put food on the table in order to feed her immediate family. She has been in this business for a long time.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of N70,000 ($425) to purchase more foodstuffs and cooking oil for resale purposes. Indeed, this is the high season for sales, so she hopes to generate higher profits by satisfying the increased customer demand. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by purchasing additional foodstuffs and cooking oil

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita F. is 46 years old and their 7 children are between 13 to 25 years old, 6 of whom are still attending school. They live in the village of Batang Himamaylan City Negros Occidental. Her husband Ricardo helps her in running the business. She dreams that her children will finish in college and have a stable job, to help her husband improved their living and to look for an opportunity where she can develop her business and earn an income for a living.

Teresita's business is to sell different kind of ready to wear items like clothes, pants, hats, sacks and many more. They need to wake up early in the morning to go in different places where there is a market day. But she noticed that she need additional stocks to compete other traders. Her problem is that she lack capital.

In the year 2000, she joins NWTF-Project Dungganon to find additional capital for her ambulant business. Her stocks increased and her income also increased, aside from this she also put up her general store adjacent to her house. Her businesses are a big help to her family especially for the education of her children. As her loan increases her opportunity to invest in other business was high, so she expanded business into Food Vending and puts the finished product in her general store. Now she earns Php 15,000 per month and she save most of her income for the education and family expenses.

Her previous loan of Php 26,000 was use as additional capital for her business especially in ambulant vending. She maintain her good credit performance by paying her loan on time and in full without delayed. Teresita borrows her 13th cycle loan with the same amount of Php 26,000 to be use as additional working capital for her general store.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Linda Claudia Lissette

texts.es: Linda Claudia Lissette F. D. M. D. 23 años D. edad, resiD. en Cojutepeque, departamento D. Cuscatlán y Vive junto a su esposo. Ella posee una venta D. ropa para mujeres y hombres, así mismo venD. accesorios para el cabello y carteras. Linda tiene 6 años D. poseer el negocio, el cual día con día ella desea sacarlo adelante y D. esta manera poder ampliarlo. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar ropa al por mayor, así mismo comprar ropa para niños. Linda cuenta con el deseo D. se mejor cada día y superarse en su negocio, sobre todo porque piensa en un futuro tener hijos, pero antes ella quiere poder brindarles una vida estable como se la merecen y es por esto que se esfuerza a diario por mejorar las condiciones D. su venta.
texts.en:
Linda Claudia Lissette F. D. M., 23, lives with her husband in Cojutepeque, Cuscatlán department. She sells women's and men's clothing as well as hair accessories and purses. Linda has been in this line of work for 6 years and she works hard every day to see it succeed and to enlarge it. She is requesting financing to buy clothing at wholesale and to buy children's clothes. Linda hopes to improve every day and to do well in her business because she plans some day to have children. However, she wants to be able to give them the stable life they deserve so she puts in the daily effort to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Severina

texts.es: La sra. Severina tiene un pequeño restaurant ubicado en la Av. Circunvalación de la zona de Pampahasi, atiende por las noches con platos sencillos, como silpancho, chorizo y asado, tiene ya mucho tiempo en esta actividad, es muy conocida por la zona, vive con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan para ayudar en los gastos de la casa a su mamá, ya que su papá los dejó, y no vive con ellos, doña Severina se ocupa sola de sus hijos. Tiene también su minibús que trabaja en el transporte público. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una caja para la movilidad, hacerla reparar para que trabaje con un chofer del sindicato en el que está inscrito.
texts.en:
Señora Severina has a small restaurant located on Circunvalación Ave. in the zone of Pampahasi. She serves simple dishes, like silpancho (a dish made with meat, potatoes, rice & eggs), sausage and barbeque in the evenings. Sh has been doing this activity for a long time and is well known in the area. She lives with her children who are students and work to help their mother with the household expenses, since their dad left them and he does not live with them. Señora Severina takes care of her children alone. She also has a minivan and works providing public transportation. The loan that she requests will be invested in the repair of the minivan so that she can work as a chauffeur of the union in which she is a member.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her minivan so she can provide taxi services

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence M. is a businesswoman of forty years old. She is married, with two children. She owns a beauty salon and she has been carrying out this business for over eight years. She is using the loan to stock salon items such as hair chemicals, combs, creams, hair relaxers, hairspray, and so forth. Her aim in taking out this loan is to expand her business. Her dream for the future is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To stock salon items such as hair chemicals, combs, creams, hair relaxers, hairspray, and so forth.

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is a hard-working woman and she is very determined to excel in her business and family life. She sells sarongs, clothes, shoes and bags at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is mechanic and he also supports the household. She is indeed grateful to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria del Carmen C. O. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután. Vive en compañía de su hija de 15 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Gloria posee una venta de cosméticos, ganchos para el cabello, peines, decorados para uñas, esmaltes y otros productos más. A pesar que todos sus clientes  son del sexo femenino, Gloria obtiene muy buenas ganancias, es por ello que ya cuenta con 20 años de tener este negocio, a través del cual ha podido brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija, como también solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que ella desea poder aumentar su inventario sobre todo para este mes de febrero en el cual sus ventas aumentan  y posteriormente en el mes de abril, debido a las vacaciones de verano. Es por esto que Gloria solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos y de toda la variedad de productos que posee, de esta manera  aprovechará el hecho de poseer muchos clientes que desde hace muchos años compran sus productos y así mismo obtener clientela nueva.
texts.en:
39-year old Gloria del Carmen C. O. lives in the department of Usulután with her 15-year old daughter who is a student. Gloria owns a business selling cosmetics, hair and nail accessories, combs, nail polish etc. Although all her clients are women, Gloria makes a good living and has already had her business for twenty years. She is able to provide her daughter with all the basics and also pay for household expenses. Now she would like to expand her inventory, especially for the month of February when sales increase, and then later in the month of April, when the summer holidays begin. For this reason Gloria is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetics and the other items that she stocks. In this way she will continue to attract the many regular customers who have bought her products for many years, and she will also attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair accessories

loans.name: Xiomara Mercedes

texts.es: Xiomara Mercedes tiene 41 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos. La actividad económica de Xiomara es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que su actividad, le ha brindado la experiencia de trabajar y administrar muy bien su dinero para invertir en materia prima. Los propósitos de ella son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que todo lo que tiene actualmente le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y no lo perdería. Es por eso que solicito ayuda a Fundación León 2000 con el fin de comprar más productos para su negocio. Sus deseos son de establecer una pequeña tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Xiomara Mercedes, 41, has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time, and this is not the first time she has requested a loan. Her business is selling general merchandise, which she has been doing more than 11 years, a business that has provided her with the experience of working hard and managing her money so she can buy the raw materials she needs. She plans to continue with her business, since she has invested a lot of hard work and does not want to lose it. This is why she is requesting the help of Fundación León 2000 with the goal of purchasing additional stock for her business. She would like to establish a little shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Antoinette M. a 45 ans elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis 9 ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 18 fois de suite. Elle est vendeuse de fruits et en particulier des bananes. Elle achète son produits en gros pour revendre au détail dans son quartier. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Antoinette M. is 45 years old and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” for nine years and has had a good experience with borrowing. She has received 18 consecutive loans. She sells fruits and especially bananas. She buys her products wholesale and sells them retail in her neighborhood. Her profit will allow her to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her fruit selling activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Davaasambuu

texts.en:
Davaasambuu G., 27, is married and the father of a 6-year-old son. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent) in a rented yard in Hovd province, Mongolia. Davaasambuu operates a clothing trading business at the local Ih Buyan market. He has been operating his business since September 2009. 


Davaasambuu used to study and work with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has since moved with his family to Hovd province. He has been working hard to provide a better life for his family. Davaasambuu is an open person. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more clothing for his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta G. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 18 juin 2002 et a 10 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. C'est un membre très fidèle et dynamique. Aucune fois elle a eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse de légumes dans son village. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d'investissement en achetant plus de légumes et faire plus de bénéfice afin de pouvoir soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Anta G. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 18 juin 2002 et a 10 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. C'est un membre très fidèle et dynamique. Aucune fois elle a eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse de légumes dans son village. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d'investissement en achetant plus de légumes et faire plus de bénéfice afin de pouvoir soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Développer son acivité de vente de légumes

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is a single parent who takes care of her only boy child. She has no formal educational background.  Adwoa sells cloth by moving from one household to the other at Abura. 

Adwoa uses the income she generates from her sales to look after her young but growing child.  Adwoa will use the loan to purchase assorted cloth for sale. With the new earnings from her extended business, Adwoa plans to save towards her child’s education. At the time of our visit, Adwoa was yet to get her new consignment.

loans.use: purchase assorted cloth for sale

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en: Nyamdavaa D. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and a child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His 22 year old son runs a business at Narantuul market while Nyamdavaa and his wife operate a religion items sales business at the same market. They started the business in 1999 by selling valuables and religion items which are sold from their two stalls in the market. Because he has been in business so long, he has gained many business skills, a lot of business knowledge and purchased a plot of land and a house. He says, “Our family wants to improve its living environment by planting greens and plants around the fence”. He is very hard working and open minded person. Nyamdavaa is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan so that he can build a garage and plant more trees and greens.

loans.use: To build a garage

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 28-year-old woman who lives with her husband in an area called Gandheyan autad, which is situated in a city called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. She is not an educated lady but she hopes that if God blesses her with children, she will give them better opportunities for education so they can make their future bright and never face problems in their lives. She manages the domestic chores and helps her husband in his livestock business.  

Her husband, M. Hayat, is 28 years old. For the past six years he has been selling the milk produced by his buffalo from his home. This has become their family business because Naseem also helps him in getting and selling the milk. They enjoy working together. 

Naseem has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her husband. With the amount he will buy another buffalo and expand their milk-selling business.

loans.use: Purchase buffalo for producing more milk to sell

loans.name: Sharon Andrea

texts.es: Sharon Andrea B. B., tiene la edad de 27 años, está soltera, y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 6 y otro de 1 año de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para realizar las costuras. Ella cuenta con una máquina de coser, pero desea aumentar el inventario de materiales para ofrecer a sus clientes. Tiene varios años de  dedicarse a la costura, y  cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer variedad de telas, y de tener los materiales necesarios para realizar sus costuras y así poder ofrecer calidad en sus productos, además de aportar mayores ingresos a la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le brindaron siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como profesional.
texts.en:
Sharon Andrea B. B. is 27 years old and single. She has two children, aged 6 and 1. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make clothing. She has a sewing machine, but she would like to broaden the range of materials she offers to her customers. She has worked as a tailor for several years, and she has very good customers. For this reason, she feels the need to offer a wider variety of fabrics and stock the necessary supplies to make a range of clothing, so she can offer high-quality products and also contribute more income to her household economy. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR, and she is very grateful for the terms that they always offer. In the future, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and more economic stability, and to continue growing as a person and a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies to make clothing

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: Prudencio tiene 59 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en casa  de un familiar. Se dedica en la venta de piezas de carros desde hace 10 años. Estas piezas las adquiere de las compras que hace en algunas carrocerías y almacenes de carros viejos en desuso, para luego revenderlas por partes en talleres mecánicos de su zona y a un mayor precio. En ocasiones su hijo mayor le ayuda, pero su principal instrumento de trabajo es su camioneta que le sirve para transportar las pesadas piezas o chatarras de los carros. Adicionalmente a este trabajo, compra y vende  objetos reciclados, aprovechando que la gente que lo conoce, siempre van a dejar un objeto viejo o malogrado. Prudencio ha visto la rentabilidad de su negocio en todos estos años por lo que se ha decidió implementar con más herramienta.  Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita lo complementará con unos ahorros que tiene para lograr comprarse un carro nuevo, ya que el actual que tiene esta muy viejo.
texts.en:
Prudencio is 59 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He’s been in the business of selling car parts for the past 10 years. He gets these parts by buying old cars from junk yards and obsolete automobile warehouses, then sells the to car repair shops within his zone parts for a profit. Sometimes his son helps him, but he primarily uses his van to transport the heavy pieces or metal parts. He also buys and sells related items, taking advantage of the fact that people who know him often drop off old or unneeded items to him. Prudencio has seen the profitability of his business over the past few years because he decided to work with more tools. This will be his first loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support. He is also happy to be a part of a communal group because all of its members are responsible and very supportive. He is also grateful to those people who are making this loan possible; it will be very helpful for the advancement of his business. He will use the money from this loan, along with money from his own savings to buy a new car because the one he has now is too old.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completar el pago de un carro nuevo.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has two grown up children. She sells women's clothing at a small market in the Zaporozhye city. Valentina has been in this business for 10 years. 

Valentina has a competitive advantage: when new clothing arrives at the wholesale market, Valentina receives a call from the wholesale apparel managers from whom she buys her inventory, and she gets her new assortment earlier than her competitors. This is because Valentina maintains a good relationship with the wholesale managers and always pays them on time.

Valentina enjoys selling women's clothing and would like to develop her business further. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of fall clothing.

loans.use: to increase seasonal assortment

loans.name: Sam-Try Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Sam-Try Group. They run small-scale businesses based in Makama, on the outskirts of Makeni, in Northern Sierra Leone. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living conditions will improve:  they will at least be able to provide three meals a day for their children, pay their school fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them falls sick. 

Aminata K. is the leader of this group. Aminata was born in Makama village. She is 42 years of age, married to a lorry driver and they have one child who is attending secondary school. Aminata sells rice, cooking oil, pepper, etc. She has been running this business for seven years now. With the help of this loan, Aminata will buy more stock to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es: El Sr. Elio es el hijo mayor, vive con su Papá y una Hemana en un departamento en calidad de anticrético , su Mamá se encuentra en España  por razones de trabajo desde hace 2 años; ayuda en la mantención de su casa. Elio es un joven trabajador y responsable  que apoya económicamente a  su hermana  para que ella pueda estudiar , trabaja como transportista  propietario en una línea de radio taxis  que se encuentra en  la zona de Irpavi, Elio necesita comprar una radio de comunicación  para que pueda generar mejores ingresos y por otro lado necesita hacer  algunos tramites de cambio de nombre de su movilidad razón por la cual  solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en:
Elio, an eldest son, lives with his father and one of his sisters in a rented appartment. His mother, who has been in Spain for work reasons for the last 2 years, helps them with their home expenses. Elio is a young and responsible worker who is supporting his sister financially so that she can study. He owns a car and works as a driver for a taxi company in the Irpavi neighbourhood. Elio has requested the Kiva loan because he needs to buy a car radio to communicate with the company so as to increase his income. He also needs to do some paperwork in order to change the name that appears in the car documentation.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy car radio and pay for paperwork.

loans.name: Mirian Yolanda

texts.es: Mirian Yolanda P. Rodríguez es una joven de  28 años de edad, reside en la Comunidad de Palestina, Patuca, Olancho y se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos. Mirian aprendió del negocio ya que laboraba en un consultorio médico y con el transcurso del tiempo fue obteniendo el conocimiento y la experiencia necesaria en el manejo de cada producto. Luego decidió que para tener un mejor ingreso económico ella debía establecer un negocio propio, así que fue comprando productos farmacéuticos en pequeñas cantidades y actualmente tiene una pequeña farmacia. Una de sus dificultades es que padece de presión y siempre está en tratamiento médico. Ella necesita el préstamo para incrementar su inventario y contratar a un empleado porque extenderá su radio de atención haciendo las ventas de casa en casa. Con el apoyo de este financiamiento espera aumentar sus ventas y a la vez obtener las ganancias suficientes para poder seguir pagando su tratamiento y su sostenimiento. Es su cuarto ciclo en FAMA y gracias a los préstamos que ha obtenido su negocio ha crecido y su nivel de vida ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Mirian Yolanda P. Rodríguez is a young 28 year-old woman who sells pharmaceutical products and lives in the community of Palestina, Patuca, Olancho.  Mirian learned the business from working in a medical office.  Over time, she gained the necessary knowledge and experience in how to use each product.  Then she decided that she should establish her own business in order to have a better income.  She bought pharmaceutical products in small quantities and now she has a small pharmacy.  One of the difficulties she faces is that she suffers from high blood pressure, so she is always under medical treatment.

She needs this loan to increase her inventory and to hire an employee, which will extend the area she is able to cover when making sales from house to house.  With the support of this financing, she hopes to increase her sales and to earn enough to keep paying for her treatment and to support herself.  This is her fourth loan cycle with FAMA and thanks to the prior loans she has received, her business has grown and her quality of life has improved.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert O. and his wife had worked in the construction business for many years when Albert decided he was ready to be self-employed and start his own construction company, OCI Construction, LLC. With a loan from ACCION Texas, Albert is going to pay for construction software, company registration fees, and an online database that will notify OCI Construction of potential projects. Albert would have a difficult time getting his company off the ground without this loan.

A constant challenge for Albert is that property management companies only want to contract construction companies with whom they have had past experience. Although Albert has completed a variety of construction projects, these have not been under the name of his construction company. Therefore, OCI Construction will have to start with small projects and build up slowly.

For the future, Albert hopes that OCI Construction will be contracted to do significant commercial jobs such as schools and hospitals. He foresees his company becoming a well-respected, customer-oriented, affordable construction business. 

Feel free to visit his website at www.oci-construction.com

loans.use: To pay for construction software, company registration fees, and online construction database

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es: Arnoldo O. U. de 40 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a dos hijos menores de edad. Arnoldo posee una parcela en la cual se encarga de criar ganado y luego comercializarlo. Gracias a sus excelentes estándares de calidad, Arnoldo cuenta con muchos clientes, esto ha pesar de que cuenta con poco tiempo de dedicarse a este trabajo como propietario de su negocio, aunque posee mucha experiencia debido a que se ha dedicado toda su vida a este oficio junto a su padre. Arnoldo solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de alimentos para su ganado, y así mismo comprar dos vacas lecheras, para comercializar la leche y así mismo para consumo de la familia. Arnoldo espera mejorar su negocio y de esta forma brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en: Arnoldo O. U. is 40 years old and lives in the town of San Juan Opico, in the department of La Libertad.  He lives with his wife, who looks after the household chores, and their two young children.  Arnoldo owns a small farm in which he raises cattle to sell.  Thanks to his excellent quality standards, Arnoldo has many customers in spite of the fact that he hasn't been in charge of running this business for very long.  However, he has a lot of experience since he has been in the business alongside his father for his whole life.  Arnoldo is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more feed for his cattle and also so that he can buy two dairy cows to sell their milk and use for his own family's consumption.  Arnoldo hopes to improve his business and therefore be able to provide his wife and children with a  better life.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly Lusuuda is a 35 year old married lady.  She is blessed with three children who are in school.  She sells livestock to earn a living.  Her business is just one year old and she has managed to employ four people.  In addition, she sells clothes for extra income.

Nelly dreams of owning a ranch in the future.  Being a member of Diamond Women group in Faulu Kenya, she has been guaranteed a loan of 34,200 Kenyan shillings by the group members.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and goats

loans.name: Hajiraan's Group

texts.en:
Hajiraan (pictured with her hand raised) is a 53-year-old, married woman. She lives with her family in an area named 34-WB, which is located in a city known as Vehari in Punjab Pakistan. Vehari, she explains, is known for its agriculture industry. Hajiraan is married to F. S.. They have been living in this area for many years in a 2-room brick house. She is a housewife, who prefers to stay at home and to carry out her responsibilities at home.

Hajiraan is a new loan applicant of Asasah. She is applying for a loan for the benefit of her son, who is a butcher by profession and who runs a butcher shop in the local market to earn a living. From his shop, he sells chicken meat to his customers and thereby earns income for the family. He plans on utilizing the loan proceeds to buy chicken in larger quantities so that he can both satisfy customer demand and generate an increase in his income. He only has 2 years of experience in this business, but due to the quality and freshness of his meat, he has been able to attract a loyal client base in a short period of time. Hajiraan is hopeful that, with the loan proceeds, her son will be able to bring about positive changes to his business and to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To expand her son's business by purchasing chicken in bulk

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Chheng S. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Since 1990 has owned and operated her farm and cultivates a rice crop, from which she earns a daily income. Chheng S., 36, is a married woman and she has given birth to four children. All of them are single. She has life partner with her husband who is employed as a building worker in his community. Chheng S. said that her husband always goes to his work place by taxi. He wants reduce the cost for traveling expenses. So, Chheng S. will use her loan for her husband to purchase a second hand motorbike in order to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a second hand motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Maria Lucita

texts.es:
La señora María Lucita Rodríguez C., vive en Coapilla Estado de Chipas México, es casada con el señor Constancio Pérez Pérez, y con él procreo cuatro hijos  y son: María Elena  de dieciseis años de edad, la otra es Rocío Guadalupe de trece años, la otra es Gladis Antonia de  nueve  años y el último es Luis Antonio de siete años.
           
         Se dedica a vender pollo aliñado (destazado), donde comenta que le va muy bien en su actividad, a pesar de que lleva pocos meses le ha dejado buenos ingresos en su hogar, como también  en su logrando estar ahorrado para su familia.
       
        Por su propio mérito decidió poner esta actividad ya que para apoyar a su esposo tiene que  tener un trabajo  en el cual le dejara ingresos y así poder aportar ella también  en los gastos que se generan del diario.

        De la ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte  comprando otras cosas que también le hacen falta y así su actividad crezca día  a día, pues para ella es muy importante en agrandarlo más.
         
        Otra actividad que realiza Maria Lucita es la elaboración de pan, por el momento solo lo hace ocasionalmente pero ésta actividad le gusta mas que la venta de pollos.

         Su deseo es comprar un local en donde pueda poner su negocio  de pollos, como también la venta de panes que es la actividad que más le agrada tener ya que para eso ya tiene su clientela del cual le compran al mayoreo.
texts.en:
María Lucita Rodríguez C. lives in Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas, in Mexico.  She is married to Constancio Pérez Pérez and they have four children: 16 year-old María Elena, 13 year-old Rocío Guadalupe, 9 year-old Gladis Antonia and 7 year-old Luis Antonio.

María sells seasoned, cut-up chicken.  She tells us that her business is doing very well.  Although she has only been in the business for a few months she has made good income for her household and she has also managed to save some money for her family.

María decided to set up this business on her own initiative since in order to support her husband she had to find work that would make her some income so that she could help with their daily expenses.  

María invests her profits in her business, buying other items that she needs and, consequently, her business grows day by day.  It is very important for her to grow her business.

Another business activity that María carries out is baking bread.  At the moment, she only pursues this business activity occasionally but she likes it more than her business selling chickens.

María's wish is to buy premises where she can set up her chicken business and also sell bread which is the business she likes the most since she already has customers for this business who buy from her wholesale.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell seasoned and cut up

loans.name: Éric

texts.fr: Eric N. est aide mécanicien, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il est célibataire, et né a Rwanda.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des tôles et madriers pour renouveler sa maison d’habitation.  Apres la construction d’une belle maison d’habitation, Eric voudrait se marier, et avoir une famille.
texts.en: Éric N. is an assistant mechanic. He has been a client of the microfinance institution Amasezerano Community Banking S.A. since 2007. He is single and was born in Rwanda. He will use his loan to buy metal sheets and beams for the renovation of his house. After the reconstruction of his beautiful home he wants to marry and found a family.

loans.use: To buy metal sheets and beams for the renovation of his house

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Mrs. Thea K. is a 44-year-old widow with three sons who are in school. She lives in a village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Sothea has been selling fruits and flowers for almost ten years. She buys them from fellow villagers and transports them to Phnom Penh and sells them at the market.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and flowers for resale

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia Elizabeth P. D. G., resiD. en municipio D. Sacacoyo del departamento D. La Libertad, junto a su esposo Don Maximiliano quien es albañil y trabaja largas jornadas fuera del hogar tratando D. proveer el hogar,  e hijas Natalia y Veronica. Sonia posee en su misma casa D. habitación, venta D. ropa, cosméticos, perfumes, lociones y otros productos D. belleza más; estos los comercializa en la populosa colonia en la que resiD., con sus vecinos y personas que transitan el lugar, quienes le prefieren por contar con una gran variedad D. productos y precios al alcance D. personas con menor capacidad D. pago.-
Sonia ya tiene varios años D. trabajar con el apoyo D. créditos, y en esta ocasión no es la excepción, ella sueña con que su negocio crezca aún mas D. lo que ya lo ha hecho, ella necesita en esta ocasión comprar otra cantidad D. productos que demandan sus clientes, como mas ropa D. verano, variedad D. fragancias y shampoos; y considera que con su empeño, responsabilidad, buena actitud y una cuota D. ayuda D. Integral, S.A. podrá hacerlo, por el bienestar D. toda su familia.-
texts.en:
Sonia Elizabeth P. D. G. resides in the town of Sacacoyo in the Department of La Libertad. Her husband Don Maximiliano works as a mason and works long hours outsiD. of the home in order to proviD. for their household and their daughters, Natalia and Veronica. Sonia has a store in her home where she sells clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, lotions, and other beauty products. These items are sold to people who live in her same area, including neighbors and customers who pass by her establishment. Sonia offers her customers a wiD. variety of products at prices that are affordable even to people who have the least capacity to pay.

Sonia has already worked with the loans from Apoyo Integral for many years, and this occasion is no exception. She dreams of growing her business even more than it already has. Sonia needs to buy an additional quantity of products that her customers demand, such as summer clothing and a variety of fragrances and shampoos. She believes that commitment, responsibility, a good attituD., and the help of Apoyo Integral will help her accomplish her goal, which will enable her to proviD. for the welfare of her entire family.

loans.use: Purchase summer clothing, fragrances, shampoos, lotions, hair gels, hair creams, and other personal care products

loans.name: Firuzamo

texts.ru: Тешаева Фирузамо жительница города Куляб. Ей 42 года. Она замужем, имеет двоих детей. Образование-среднее. Работает на рынке Саховат. Она в основном занимается продажей женских платьев и парфюмерий. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Firuzamo T. lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 42 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education and works at the Sahovat market.  Firuzamo primarily sells women's dresses and perfumery.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana lives in Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city, known for its textile industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Medina town for the past 18 years. She is 39 years old, married to N. M., and has two children. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  

Her husband works in a private company. His income is not enough to cover the basic needs of the family that’s why, a few years ago, Rehana started sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She learnt this art from her mother and has become an expert after considerable practice.  She is a very responsible person. As a mother she is also taking care of her family very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she  will buy a new sewing machine because her old machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes a lot of time to sew a single dress. The new machine will help her complete orders on time and make more profit.  She hopes that the investment will bring positive changes to her business and improve her financial position.  She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application through Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mwingo

texts.en:
Mwingo K. is a 25-year-old single man. He runs a grocery shop in Mkoroshoni and has been in this business for the past year. 

Mwingo's business is doing well and this will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase cereals, cabbages, tomatoes and a sack of potatoes, which he will add into his current business stock. He hopes to direct the anticipated profits into the expansion of his business.

His dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: purchase cereals, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes to sell in his grocery store

loans.name: María Raquel

texts.es: María Raquel M. M. de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus  dos pequeños hijos, que por el momento se encuentran estudiando. El sueño de  María es ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales,  esto es lo que impulsa a esta mujer a trabajar y luchar día a día ya que sabe que solo de esta manera podrá dar  a sus hijos lo que necesitan. Ella posee una pequeña granja de pollos y gallinas en su casa de habitación ubicada en El Cantón Los Sitios del Municipio de Talnique,  Departamento de La Libertad, lo que hace ella es comprar el pollo o gallina a partir de dos días de nacidos y crecerlos con el debido cuidado que amerita este tipo de animales hasta alcanzar las 6 semanas de vida, fecha a partir de la que los pollos logran pesar 5 libras o más y están listos para su reventa. Últimamente la demanda de sus hermosos pollos y gallinas a aumentado por parte de los clientes de los alrededores del lugar que ya posee y muchas veces no puede satisfacerles a todos. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para invertir en su negocio y comprar mayor cantidad de pollos y gallinas, así como los materiales necesarios para el mantenimiento de los mismos tales como: Concentrado de crecimiento y engorde, y vacunas para prevenir cualquier enfermedad. Con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta forma su situación va a mejorar y podrá dar a sus hijos una mejor vida.
texts.en:
María Raquel M. M., 30, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two small children who are currently in school.  María’s dream is to see her children become great professionals.  This is what pushes her to work and struggle daily because she knows that this is the only way she’ll be able to give her children all they need.

She has a small poultry farm at home located in Los Sitios canton in Talnique municipality in La Libertad Department.  What she does is buy the chicks or chickens two days from hatching and raises them with the necessary care this type of animal requires.  When they reach the age of 6 weeks and they weigh about five pounds or more they are ready for sale.  

Local customer demand for her beautiful chickens has increased lately and sometimes she can’t meet all the demand.  Because of this she’s decided to ask INTEGERAL for a loan to invest in her business and buy a larger number of chicks and chickens as well as supplies needed to maintain them such as: concentrated feed and vaccines to prevent illness.  She has faith in God that these measures will improve her situation and she’ll be able to provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia F. is from the village of Kiraging, South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Letecia is married and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap & electronic loads from several networks like GLOBE & SMART in the local community. Her husband provides multi-purpose cab services. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used towards working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & electronic loads. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & electronic loads.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana tiene una tienda donde comercializa telas de polleras y mantas y también las confecciona. El crédito requiere para la compra de telas en diversos colores y diseños. Vive  en alquiler en casa de sus tíos ubicada en la zona de Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto; es madre soltera y tiene dos  hijos.
texts.en: Ana owns a store where she sells fabric for 'polleras' (traditional skirts) and shawls.  She also makes these items.  She needs this loan to buy different colored fabrics in different designs.  She rents from her aunt and uncle whose house is located in Villa Esperanza neighborhood, in the city of El Alto.  She is a single mother and has two children.

loans.use: to buy different colored fabrics for making 'polleras' and shawls to sell

loans.name: Ana Reyna

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Ana le esta haciendo falta el vitro piso en toda la casa. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleada de  un restaurante, ya que su esposo el señor Francisco se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como jefe de almacén de una tiene comercial. 
Desean que sus dos hijos tengan la comodidad y la seguridad cuando estén en casa.
texts.en:
Ana’s house lacks tile flooring throughout.  She is asking for a loan to buy the material because she lacks the necessary funds to carry out the improvement.

She plans to repay using the salary she earns as a restaurant employee since her husband, Francisco, will take charge of family expenses with income he earns as a warehouse supervisor at a department store.

They hope that their children will have comfort and security when they are at home.

loans.use: to install tile flooring in her house.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a thirty-one year-old married man with six children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the produce business for three years and he has been able to reap tangible results. His hardship is pests that affect the food while in storage.  His dream is to have a large food store  and to educate his children.

Jackson needs a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with two school aged children.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Mejumaa has operated a food vending business for the past two years, selling in a shop to her neighbours and school going children.  She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.  Mejumaa dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, cooking fat oil and wheat flour.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, cooking fat oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 62 years old and is a married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She and her husband are both farmers. She helps him till the land, where they grow rice crops. Alberta works hard to support her husband in providing for their family's needs.

Alberta requested a loan to purchase seven bags of fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies. She is hopeful that this loan will help them achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seven bags of fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Joel Humberto

texts.es:
El Sr.Joel tiene 35 años de edad, está acompañado con la Sra. Lilian, tienen 2 hijos juntos, todos en edad escolar y viven en la cuidad de Carapeguá.
Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante decidió trabajar como ayudante de albañil, en poco tiempo logró juntar un poco de capital para empezar a comprar mercaderías y llevar a vender por la capital del país, donde ya tiene una buena clientela formada. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse una motocicleta la cual  utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por buscar un mejor futuro para su esposa e hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frazadas, fajas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Joel is 35 years old, has a partner called Lilian, and they have 2 children who are both in school. They all live in the city of Carapeguá. He comes from a humble family but had a strong desire to get ahead in life so he decided to work as a bricklayer's assistant. In a little while, he was able to raise a small amount of capital to start buying merchandise and started selling goods in the country's capital, where he already has loyal customers. Thanks to his work and effort, he was able to buy a motorcycle, which he uses to make his sales and keep a good customer base. He comments that everything he does is aimed at securing a better future for his wife and children.
He is requesting this loan to buy blankets, sashes, and sheets as he has many requests for these products.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sashes, and sheets.

loans.name: Tamarrana Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamarraneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Emma. Emma, 42, was born in a town called Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a farmer and the couple has four children – one in secondary school, two in primary school and one in college. For 15 years now, Emma has been selling food at the local market. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy fish, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), peppers, tomatoes, onions, and salt in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy fish, Maggi cubes, peppers, tomatoes, onions, and salt in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Bernandina

texts.es: Bernardina, es una mujer alegre, de 37 años. Su familia lo integra su esposo Emerson, y sus 5 hijos todos ellos menores de edad; en armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Sabe que el camino  para el progreso es largo, más aún cuando tiene hijos por mantener y educar. Pero esto no la desanima, ya que es una mujer laboriosa y trabajadora. La agricultura es su principal actividad económica. Sus cultivos constan de café, plátanos y palta, ya tiene 13 años dedicándose a ello, y lo que más le gusta es comenzar la rebusca (búsqueda de los primeros granos maduros de café) en el mes de apertura para la cosecha. Su dedicación y el amor que brinda a sus cultivos, hacen que sus productos sean de buena calidad. Además de renovar constantemente sus plantaciones de café. Cuenta que ella misma embolsa las semillas que germinarán en un vivero, donde permanece la mayor parte del fin de semana, en cuidarlos y mantenerlos. Por ello conocedores de su buen trabajo los comerciantes de café de la ciudad de Villa Rica, la buscan constantemente. Para el futuro desea seguir mejorando en sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de unión palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura podrá salir adelante con la ayuda de todos ustedes, además agradece el apoyo monetario de todos ustedes; prometiendo ser puntual en el pago de la cuotas. Bernardina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus plantaciones de café, medianos y grandes. Además de comprar semillas de café nueva para hacer viveros.
texts.en: Bernardina is a happy, 37 year old woman.  Her family includes her husband Emerson and their five children, all of whom are minors.  In the harmony of a close family, they live in their own house, located in the community of Unión Palomar (central Peruvian rain forest).  She knows that the road to progress is long, and more so with children to nurture and educate.  However, this doesn't discourage her, because she is a diligent, hard-working woman.  Agriculture is her main source of income.  Her crops consist of coffee, plantains, and avocado.  She has worked at this for the past 13 years and what she enjoys the most is beginning the "rebusca" (searching for the first ripe coffee beans) at the start of the harvest.  Her dedication and the love that she bestows upon her crops is what make her products the good quality that they are.  Besides working constantly in her coffee fields, she also bags the seeds that germinate in a nursery, where she spends the greater part of the weekend taking care of them.  Because the experts know of her good work, coffee merchants from the city of Villa Rica seek her business constantly.  In the future, she wishes to continue improving her crops.  She belongs to the communal bank “Prestatarios de unión palomar” and this is her second loan with MFP, where she is sure she will be able to move forward with the help of all of you.  Moreover, she is grateful for all of your monetary support, promising to be punctual with her payments.  Benardina, upon receiving your support, will invest the requested money in buying various natural fertilizers to spread on her medium and large coffee fields as well as to purchase new coffee seeds to start nurseries.

loans.use: to purchase coffee seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell cosmetics from catalogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a gate

loans.name: Toloso A Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is the facilitator of the Toloso group. Everlyne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Everlyne  takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will invest in raising livestock and buy more land as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Toloso A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the picture above, all Toloso group members are present, although group member Victorious is being represented by his wife.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gilbert Shisakwa

texts.en: Gilbert is a 25-year-old, married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 3 years. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a furniture making business where he sells items such as couches, cupboards, dining tables and doors. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge as poor road networks that affect timber transportation. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy timber. His business goal is to put up a big workshop within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will purchase a pick-up to facilitate the running of his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 46 years old. She has seven children who are between the ages of 8 and 23. All her children attend school. Her husband works in a public institution which serves the vulnerable. Her loan will be used to increase her stock of items such as salt, sugar, rice and cooking oil. She would like to buy a plot of land with the profits she will make from the business. She would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as salt, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is 23 years old and single. For the past year, he has been a dairy farmer and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. Boaz is a member of KADET LTD and has taken out a previous 40,000 KES loan. 

Boaz is requesting a loan to purchase a dairy cow.  He will use his profits to repay his loan and to invest in a fixed asset. In the future, Boaz hopes to be a prosperous dairy farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is a 31-year-old entrepreneur from Kakamega County, Western Kenya. He is married to Christina and they have four children.  

Calvin operates a cereal business in Kakamega town and has been doing this for the last eight years.  He makes a monthly income of KES 10,550. He is taking his first loan which he will use to buy additional stock of cereal to sell.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business because he hopes to have the best and biggest cereal shop in Kakamega town. His desire is to be able to meet his family’s expenses like food, clothing and shelter.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cereal to sell.

loans.name: Yorhans

texts.en:
Yorhans is a 41-year-old widower. He is responsible for supporting and looking after his children (Ervan, seven, who is studying at kindergarten and Risky, five) since his wife passed away two months ago. 
Yorhans owns a kiosk business. He has been involved in this business for seven years; he sells a wide range of household products such as detergent, soap, dry bread, biscuits, sweets, shampoo, etc. 
Previously, Yorhans’s business ran well but when his wife became ill he could not run the business as usual. He had to look after his wife while she was hospitalized. The stock in his kiosk decreased and his income was spent on his wife's treatment and their daily needs. Since the death of his wife, Yorhans thinks that he has to continue his life as his two adorable children still need his love. He intends to add more stock to his business and to purchase chicks to raise and fodder, but he needs money to do so. 
By chance, Yorhans met a TLM field officer and got information on TLM’s individual lending program. He is interested in joining the program and has requested a loan of 6,000,000 IDR. Yorhans really hopes that TLM will approve the application.

loans.use: to purchase more kiosk stock, chicks to raise and fodder.

loans.name: Itacua Poty Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se han unido con el objetivo de poder a sus hijos y familiares. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras, quienes desean salir adelante por medio de su trabajo individual y también trabajo grupal.
Una de ellas es la señora Maria, quien se define como una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Ella se tiene una despensa bien equipada, con la cual ha podido ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos del día a día. Ella desea que algún dia que su negocio sea más grande y de esa forma poder atraer a más clientes y a la vez tener mayores ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, fideos, arroz, lácteos y demás artículos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Thirteen women from the city of Caacupé have joined together with the objective of empowering their children and families. They are hardworking fighting women who want to get ahead through their individual and group work.

One of them is Maria, who describes herself as an enterprising, hardworking woman. She has a well equipped store room with which she has been able to help her family and cover the day-to-day expenses. She hopes that some day her business will be larger and that she will be able to attract more customers and at the same time have higher earnings.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy soft drinks, noodles, rice, dairy products and other staples.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, rice, dairy products and other staples

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Nat, 46 years-old, is married, and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fruit vendor. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Three of her children are employed as hotel staff. Due to the difficulty of transporting her fruit to sell, Nat is asking for a loan of USD 1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike to carry fruit to resell. By doing so, she can transport her fruit to resell faster and in bigger amounts. She hopes she could support her youngest child to study until he graduates from high school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry fruit to resell.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Luis Eduardo a sus 48 años es viudo y tiene a su cargo un hijo de 13 años. Se dedica a la confección, actividad que ejerce desde hace 5 años cuando aprendió a través de un curso. Sueña con tener un gran negocio y poder generar empleo para toda la población de bajos recursos, por lo que inicialmente requiere de la compra de insumos para su taller como telas e hilos y ampliar los productos ofrecidos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Señor Luis Eduardo, age 48, is a widower and cares for his 13 year old son.  He is engaged in sewing, a business he has carried on for 5 years and which he learned through a course.  He dreams of having a large business and being able to provide employment to people with few resources.  Initially, he needs to purchase raw materials for his workshop such as fabric and thread so that he can increase the products offered to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as thread and fabric.

loans.name: Yolanda Ester

texts.es: Yolanda Ester de 32 años, reside con su grupo familiar, sus hijos de 5 y 10 años y su compañero de vida. Su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera. Yolanda es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora posee una venta ubicada frente al kínder de su localidad, vende artículos para niños como: dulces, vejigas, juguetes, colores, entre otros. Es muy conocida en la zona donde reside porque con esfuerzo ella ha tenido el valor de día a día brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijos.  Yolanda desea incrementar las ventas de su negocio y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como: cereales, dulces, juguetes, entre otros para llamar la atención de mas clientes que en su mayoría son ñiños. Tiene la seguridad que con la ayuda recibida su vida y la de sus hijos mejorara y espera saldar la deuda antes de lo previsto.

loans.use: para la compra de materia prima como: cereales, dulces, juguetes, entre otros.

loans.name: Aska

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Aska, a youthful 42-year-old mum, a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Mumbu. Kenyenya, in the Nyanza region of Kenya. Aska is happily married and together with her husband, blessed with eight lovely children. 

For the past 10 years, Aska has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been growing maize, tomatoes and also, she keeps dairy cows. Aska has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Aska joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a micro finance institution that assists smallholder women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Aska is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge and she has suffered many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetable and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price and through this loan Aska is going to achieve her dream and goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is a big problem but Aska feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women.
