The benefits of this loan cannot be underestimated because Aska will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market and hence increase her income level. With your loan, Aska will improve her living conditions and assure her 8 children of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport produce to market.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a beautiful woman of 41 years, a person who enjoys independent work, who has big dreams and aspirations for her life.Speaking with her, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. 

She lives in a humble home in the town of Kapsowar, along with a handsome husband and their five angelic looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. 

She has been doing agriculture for 10 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys ploughing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity. 

Nelly is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Nelly and her family.

Like Nelly, thousands of smallholder farmer from Africa are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan.

loans.use: To buy farm implements such as fertilizers and good quality seeds

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra needs the loan in order to continue making improvements to the business. Although the front part of her store, which is pictured, is made out of cement, the inside is still wood and is vulnerable to damage from heavy rains. She also wants to invest in toys to sell from her store for the Christmas season.

Alexandra is 40 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is her right hand man in business and in life. They are a very united family and believe firmly in the value of education for the children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to continue making improvements to the business

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani is married with only one child left as her other four died when they were young. Her husband died 7 months ago, therefore she has to work. With the initial capital from selling her TV, she uses a small table in front of her house to sell some snacks and candies. After joining MBK as a member, she is now able to increase her income. She hopes to get a bigger loan to buy more snacks and candies.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela A. is a married mother of three. Pamela is a hairstylist, and she will use the loan to expand and diversify her business.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Business Description

Jesús has eight years of experience in her industry. She started selling cosmetics for another individual, and then she was able to open her own business with her savings. Because of her hard work, she has been able to build a more sturdy, cement house. It accommodates a small store inside. She works every day of the week from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m.

Use of the Loan

She will invest the loaned money into the purchase of cosmetics, jewelry, and gifts. Because of the service she provides, demand for her goods has increased.

Personal Information

Jesús is a 33 year old single mother. She has one child. Her baby attends a school near her home. She hopes that with these new funds she will be able to begin saving and provide better security for her home by creating an enclosure around her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Jesús tiene una experiencia de 8 años en la actividad del comercio. Se inicio vendiendo cosméticos para otra persona. Luego con sus ahorros decide tener su propio negocio. Gracias a su trabajo ha logrado construir su casita de cemento. Adecuo un pequeño local dentro de ella. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos, bisutería, joyas y regalos. Gracias al servicio que ella les ofrece su demanda ha aumentado.

Información Personal

Jesús es madre soltera. Tiene 33 años y 1 hijo. Su bebe estudia en una escuela cercana a su domicilio. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder ahorrar. De esta manera comenzar a dar seguridad a su domicilio. Realizando un cerramiento a su casa.

loans.use:
She will use the funds to purchase cosmetics, jewelry and gift items to sell in her store.

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos, bisutería, joyas y regalos.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina T., a 37 year old married woman from Falevao has a look of contentment as she is pictured here with her children in her retail shop. Like the other women who have been assisted by SPBD, Felina is very thankful for SPBD and the assistance it gives. Felina shares the same sentiments that are seen in many stories told by women who have received help from SPBD.

Without the assistance from SPBD, there is no way Felina could have started a retail shop as financial institutions have very strict lending criteria. According to Felina, her children and her family have really benefited from her small business and SPBD is to be given thanks for that.

Before SPBD came along she depended to a large extent on her husband as the sole breadwinner for the family. Now she is able to stand on her own two feet without depending too much on her husband or on other members of their extended family for help. Like women from other centres, Felina said that she will continue to utilise the assistance from SPBD to help her with her business for as long as help is needed.

loans.use: To diversify her inventory

loans.name: I Made Parma

texts.id:
Living in a humble house with bamboo wall has not discouraged Made Parma and his family at all. Despite this situation, he became more motivated to work for a better life by raising cow. Fortunately, the cow's food materials in his neighborhood are quite abundant. Due to limited capital, he can only raise 1 cow. The cow was bought with price Rp. 3,500,000 (about $387) and in 4 months he could sell it for Rp. 5,000,000 (about $553) so his net profit was Rp. 800,000 (about $88) after subtracting the cow's food expenses. Although the profit was not much, he is very thankful because he can cover his family's daily expenses. His dream to repair his house has encouraged him to save some money from this business. After getting the loan from DINARI, he will work harder in this business because the loans will make his hope to expand the business become reality.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di rumah yang sangat sederhana yang hanya berdinding gedeg tidak membuat Made Parma dan keluarganya patah semangat dalam menjalani kehidupan. Segala kesederhanaan itu justru membuatnya bersemangat dalam bekerja untuk bisa hidup lebih baik lagi yaitu dengan memelihara sapi. Hal ini dilakukannya mengingat situasi lingkungan yang mendukung yaitu dengan tersedianya pakan yang cukup bagi keperluan ternaknya ini. Terbatasnya modal yang dimiliki mengharuskan Made Parma hanya memelihara 1 ekor sapi . Sapi itu dibeli dengan harga Rp. 3.500.000,- dan dalam waktu 4 bulan berhasil dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 5.000.000,- sehingga keuntungan bersih yang diperolehnya Rp. 800.000,- setelah dikurangi biaya pemeliharaan. Walaupun keuntungan yang diperolehnya tidak banyak tapi Made Parma tetap bersyukur karena keluarganya bisa hidup dari hasil usahanya tersebut. Keinginannya untuk memperbaiki rumahnya membuatnya terpacu untuk mulai menyisihkan sedikit hasil usahanya ini sehingga setelah terkumpul banyak nantinya Made Parma bisa memperbaiki rumahnya. Setelah menerima pinjaman modal usaha dari DINARI Made Parma menjadi lebih bersemangat lagi dalam usahanya karena harapannya untuk mengembangkan usahanya bisa terpenuhi lewat pinjaman ini.

loans.use: To purchase baby cow and cow food

loans.name: Celestino's Group

texts.es:
Martha and Celestino are partners of the Yanapanakusun Communal Bank, the quechua word that means “Let’s Help Eachother”, Martha sells candies and popcorn that she makes herself and sells them traveling in the parks and schools when there are events. On the other hand, Celestino works as a teacher in a school far from Ayacucho and it was also far from his family and so he decided to take up carpentry to be with his family. The loans of Celestino and Martha are for 400 soles and 600 soles, respectively, a total that will be invested in the purchase of candies, gum, cookies, caramels, corn, oil, woods, and other materials for carpentry respectively. Celestino will utilize his savings to buy sophisticated machinery, on the other hand the savings that come from Martha are to buy land and construct a house. The dreams of Celestino are to have a sawmill, that his children will become professionals and will be happy, Martha’s dreams are to have another business to sell vegetables, to have her own house and to continue with kids.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirtha y Celestino son socios del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun, palabra quechua que significa “Ayudémonos”. Mirtha vende golosinas y “canchas palomitas” que ella misma elabora teniendo como insumo al maíz y los vende ambulatoriamente en los parques y colegios cuando hay eventos. Por otro lado Celestino tiene su carpintería, negocio que inició hace 5 años. Antes de este negocio, Celestino trabajaba como Profesor en una escuela lejana de Ayacucho y estaba lejos de su familia y por ello decidió poner la carpintería para estar junto a su familia. Los préstamos de Celestino y Martha son de 400 soles y 600 soles, respectivamente, monto que invertirán en la compra de golosinas, chicles, galletas, caramelos, maíz, aceite, maderas y otros materiales para la carpintería respectivamente. Celestino utilizará sus ahorros para comprar maquinarias sofisticadas, por otro lado el ahorro que viene haciendo Mirtha es para comprar su terreno y construir su casa. El sueños de Celestino es tener un aserradero, que sus hijos sean profesionales y puedan ser felices, mientras que el sueño de Mirtha es tener otro negocio de venta de verduras, tener casa propia y salir adelante con los hijos .

loans.use: The loans of Celestino and Martha are of 400 soles and 600 soles, respectively, the total will be invested in the purchase of candies, gum, cookies, caramels, corn, oil, woods, and other materials for carpentry respectively.

loans.name: Thoy

texts.en: Thoy C., 46, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together selling a variety of fruit to the people in her area. Two of her children are at school. Thoy hopes to use this loan to purchase more fruit to fulfill her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and fulfill her growing customer demands.

loans.name: Eli Haryati

texts.en: Eli is 47 years old, and married. Her husband is currently unemployed, and to support her family, Eli sells a variety of foods and other supplies. Eli earns a total profit of $1 a day . She joined MBK and is now requesting a total loan of $125 to expand her current business. She plans to repay her loan in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baking ingredients and improve his bakery

loans.name: Maota B Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
The four women pictured in the photograph are borrowing from SPBD for the first time. They all have undergone four weeks of training in business management and maintenance of a savings account, and have passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments, and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and in repaying their loans on time.

Faatele S. (35, married, 2 children) and Metu L. (45, married, 3 children) both grow and sell taro, a staple of the Samoan diet. They are requesting a loan to purchase a weed killer, pesticides, a bush knife, and a knife sharpener.

Aolipa T. (38, married, 8 children) makes pancakes (round lumps of fried bread) for sale five days a week. She will use her loan to purchase a stove, a fryer, yeast, sugar, and flour.

Me F. (46, married, 6 children) is starting a food stall at the Salelologa market. She will sell pancakes, chicken, rice, and curry. Her loan will be used to purchase a stove, sugar, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of noodles, and wheat.

loans.use: Purchase of a weed killer, pesticides, a bush knife, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Esperanza Group

texts.en:
E. is a sweet 35-year-old woman who lives in the community of 30 de Marzo with her 4 kids and husband. As we walked to her house to chat with her about the new business she wanted to start and to meet her family, we learned that there had just been a drive-by shooting in the community. There were 4 bullet holes in her neighbor’s wall, and all of the women were eager to explain what had happened. 30 de Marzo is one of the most dangerous areas in Puerto Plata, with drug usage and prostitution overwhelmingly prevalent in the community. Our group of 10 women genuinely want to see a better life for themselves and their families. E. lives in a one bedroom shack with her entire family. She, her husband, and two of their kids sleep on the one bed, while the two other children sleep on the cold, hard floor.

With this loan, E. wants to start a small business selling clothing and shoes around her neighborhood. Esperanza is excited to see what will happen in each of these women’s lives, and we want to thank all of the lenders in advance for their support and generosity. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun P., 55, and her husband, Mr. Thaung You, 59, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1970 and have seven children, four sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Two of their children have full time employment. Of the other four children, two are in school and two weave silk at home. They have two looms in the family.

Mrs. Yoeun has been a silk weaver since she was young but now she has stopped weaving and transferred her looms to her daughters (one is shown in the photo), who continue the business of silk production. Now Yoeun sells fish in her village and a nearby village, while Mr. Thaung has been a fisherman since he was seventeen years old.

Now she is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase silk materials for her daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: José Amos

texts.pt:
José Amos D. is 43 years old and was born in the province of Tete. He is married and father of 6 children – 3 girls and 3 boys. All of them go to school except the youngest, who is 2. Besides his children, he also supports his mother in-law by sending her food supplies.

José completed the 4th grade, at which point he had to stop because he was drafted into military service. He was wounded in war, and is handicapped as a result. He married in 1994.

José currently lives in his own house, although it is still under construction. He receives a monthly pension of 4,500 MT, none of which he can save because of building expenses.

This is José’s 3rd loan. His first one was for 6,500 and his second for 7,000. Both previous ones were designated for purchasing building materials, like this third loan. With future loans, José intends to eventually build a store to increase the family’s income and to better educate his children.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva volunteer.

José Amos D. tem 43 anos, natural da provincia de Tete, casado maritalmente e pai de 6 filhos sendo 3 meninas e 3 rapazes, todos vão a escola excepto o mais novos de 2 anos. Alem dos filhos sustenta a sogra más não vive com ela na mesma casa só manda comida ou géneros alimentícios.

José estudou até 4ªclasse e deixou por ter ingressado no serviço militar obrigatório. Foi desmobilizado e é mutilado de guerra (deficiente físico) em 1994 casou se maritalmente. Neste momento vive numa casa própria apesar estar ainda em construção.

José é pensionista e aufere mensalmente 4500,00mt deste não poupa nada porque está investindo na construção. Este é o terceiro empréstimo do José os dois primeiros de 6500,00mt e 7000,00mt ambos destinados para compra de material de construção e o terceiro pretende também continuar com a compra de material de construção.

José pretende futuramente com ajuda de empréstimo construir um estabelecimento comercial para aumentar os rendimentos da família assim acha que será fácil a educação escolar dos filhos.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.id:
After successful first loan from DINARI, Ni Wayan S. gained higher motivation to grow her kiosk. Her kiosk is now gaining more clients. This is also due to the training assistance from DINARI, in addition to the loan. Her kiosk now appears cleaner. Ni Wayan S. intends to grow her kiosk further by increasing the product offering. She plans to sell more main supplies like rice, soap and cooking oil. Therefore Wayan S. needs another loan that is larger than her first one. Especially now she plans to sell goods with higher prices. Currently she earns about $8 per day in profit. She hopes to gain more profit with the help of the loan.

Translated from Bahasa Inconesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Setelah mendapatkan hasil yang cukup lumayan pada pinjaman tahap pertama, Ni Wayan S. semakin semangat dalam mengembangkan usaha warungnya, warung makanan miliknya kini semakin ramai di kunjungi pembeli. Hal ini tak terlepas dari binaan yang telah Ni Wayan S. terima dari Dinari sehingga kondisi warungnya kelihatan lebih menarik dan tampak lebih bersih.Wayan S. bermaksud untuk mengembangkan lagi warung ini menjadi lebih lengkap khususnya untuk barang –barang kebutuhan pokok seperti : Beras , sabun dan minyak goreng. Untuk itu wayan S. masih memerlukan dana pinjaman lagi , bahkan dengan jumlah yang lebih besar ,mengingat barang –barang tersebut harganya cukup tinggi.Dengan begitu keuntungan yang diperoleh kini sebesar Rp 70.000/ hari akan menjadi lebih meningkat, setelah mendapat tambahan modal.

loans.use: Increase product offering

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is married with two children aged 25 and 23 years old. She is a vitenge (clothes) seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Tabitha requires a loan to buy more vitenge for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge for her clothing business.

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en: Alofa S. T., 53, is married with no children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation/fishing business. She sells to the villagers and the public 4 days per week. She has had 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Alofa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her business and  husband will help her operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net, chemicals, pesticides, bush knives

loans.name: Bahati's Group

texts.en:
Bahati S. has been selling kanga and dresses in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. Kanga is a common local fabric that is decorated with any of a large variety of patterns and is often brightly colored. Kanga also contains a local adage in Swahili written at the bottom. The fabric is used for clothing, head wraps, baby slings, curtains, and many other household needs. A single kanga is sold for between $2.50 and $4.

Bahati works from 8:00am to 8:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $60 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she may expand her inventory and increase her sales.

Bahati is 26 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more kanga and dresses for her shop.

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en: Sugran baji is the wife of M. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. M. Idress is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sugran baji has a thread selling business. She buys second hand warm sweaters from the old market and pulls the thread out from the sweaters. She then washes the thread and makes a roll with it, and after sells it in the market. Sugran baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Najjanakumbi A- Dorah Group

texts.en:
Dorah N., 36, operates a bar and restaurant in Najjanakumbi. It is now 6 years since the inception of her business. She purchases her stock from various authorized suppliers in Kampala. On average, she can make Ush 60,000 in sales, from which she can earn an average profit of Ush 20,000. The loan proceeds are enabling Dorah to purchase beer, vodka, liberty and Smirnoff.

Dorah is a single mother of 3 children between the ages of 12 and 6. She also takes care of 3 orphans (nephews). She seems to be a jovial and friendly lady. She dreams of expanding and transforming her bar and restaurant into a modern classy one. When her income base increases, she would love to purchase a car and also ensure her children and nephews attend the best schools in the country.

loans.use: To purchase beer, vodka, liberty and smirnoff.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Mrs. P. is 54 years old, and she lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is married with three children, all of whom are teenagers and in school. Mrs. P. and her husband, Mr. Vong, 61, are rice farmers. The rice crop is the only source of income for the family, so Mrs. P. needs to take care and improve this business. Thus, she is asking for a loan to purchase four oxen to use on her farm.

loans.use: Purchase four oxen

loans.name: Faraja S.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Faraja C. from Mbeya. She is single with three children between the ages of seven and 12. Faraja has been running a grocery business since 2006. Her business is to purchase items wholesale and sell them on a retail basis. She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee and one family member. Faraja currently earns about 70 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 450 USD in order to buy more drinks in bulk. In the future, she plans to move the business to a better location, to increase her stock and to open a new business. Faraja thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Umc Primary School, Makump Bama Village Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the United Methodist Church Primary School, Makump Bama village (UMC). Makump Bama village is about five miles from Makeni city, the northern provincial headquarters. This school was founded in 1970 by the United Methodist Church to give education to the children of the community and to build up the church. It is the oldest school in the community and one of two schools in Makump Bama village. It currently has a population of 297 pupils and a staff of six teachers.

Many children from this village and the surrounding villages passed through this school. The school has a proud history; it has produced alumni who are teachers, lawyers, and many other professional workers. Some former students are currently in colleges and universities.

One major constraint the school is currently facing is the lack of adequate furniture, especially benches and desks. In 2000–2002, rebels made Makump Bama village a base. During their stay in this village, they used all of the school’s furniture as firewood.

Edward N. J. is the Headmaster of this school. Edward was born sixty years ago in Yoyema village in Moyamba district in southern Sierra Leone. He is married with four children and four dependents (nephews and nieces). Two of his children are already grown-ups and the other two are in tertiary institutions. The four dependents are still in school. Edward has been a teacher since 1970. With this loan, he will pay the fees for his two children who are in tertiary institutions.

loans.use: Pay fees for children in tertiary institutions

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa T. C. is 24 years old. About a year ago she was widowed with three young children. Teresa lives in the city of Tecpan and works with her family in weaving güipiles (traditional clothing). Teresa is a strong and enterprising woman and says that although it has been hard since her husband died, she is not afraid. Teresa is the leader of their small family business and she works closely with her father and siblings. The business needs more capital in order for them to purchase thread for the güipiles and for the labor that is invested in creating each one. They also have started making sweaters for babies and hope to grow this business as well. Teresa’s dream is to have enough capital and to be a successful business owner. She also wants her children to have better food, housing and education throughout their lives. 


*********************************************************************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow.
*********************************************************************************************


Doña Teresa T. C. es ahora de 24 años de edad, hace un año se quedo viuda, con tres hijos, de edad pequeña, Vive en el Municipio de Tecpan, desde pequeña a trabajado en elaboración de Güipiles, ella no le teme que esta sola, porque es una mujer emprendedora, su papá es parte de su trabajador, sus hermanos, creen que ella es la líder, por lo que  necesita un capital mas para, comprar, mas hilo para los güipiles, capital para mano de obra; tienen una producción de suéteres para bebes; su sueño es tener el capital propio para salir adelante, cuando crezcan sus hijos puedan tener mejor alimentación, casa, estudios mínimos, ser una microempresaria exitosa.

loans.use: Thread and materials for weaving

loans.name: Odette's Group

texts.fr:
A. Odette est née vers 1956 à Bohicon dans le Centre du Bénin. Odette est veuve depuis onze (11) ans; elle a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Depuis plus de vingt (20) ans Odette est dans le commerce de divers: condiments pour la sauce, riz, haricot, liqueurs, boîtes de conserves, pâtes alimentaires, pâte de maïs, charbon de bois, bois de chauffe, etc. Odette a déjà eu un prêt de ALIDé grâce auquel elle a amélioré le niveau de son activité et qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour renforcer davantage son activité Odette sollicite un deuxième prêt auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
A. Odette was born around 1956 in Bohicon in central Benin. She has been a widow for eleven years and has five children, all schooled. For over twenty years, Odette has been doing commerce in various goods: condiments for making sauces, rice, beans, liqueurs, canned foods, pasta, corn mash, charcoal, firewood, etc. She has had an Alidé loan before, and thanks to it, she's improved her business activity. She has repaid the loan. To bolster her business more, Odette is requesting a second loan from Alidé. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, boxes of milk, drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Khusrav

texts.ru:
Хусрав молодой парень 33 лет, женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Жена сидит дома и смотрит за ребенком. Хусрав имеет профессию строителя и поэтому постоянно работает. Так как жена дома имеет достаточно свободного времени Хусрав решил получить займ и приобрести домашний скот. Это и дополнительное питание для семьи, и доход дополнительный если скот перепродать с наценкой. Сейчас Хусрав планирует приобрести бычка и корм и поэтому подал заявку на займ на КИВА.
(на фото жена Хусрава).
texts.en:
Khusrav is a young, 33-year old man. He is married with one child. Khusrav's wife is a stay-at-home mom. Khusrav is a construction worker by training and he is constantly working. Since his wife is a homemaker, she has quite a lot of free time. This would help support the family. Khusrav decided to apply for a Kiva loan in order to purchase a bull calf and fodder. The photo features Khusrav's wife.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf and fodder

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan  F. es una persona de mediana edad, vive con su esposa la señora María de Jesús, ellos viven solos, ya que todos sus hijos se casaron, el es albañil independiente desde hace 6 años, su esposa la señora María es empleada de la florería de una Funeraria conocida de la ciudad. 
Ya tiene empezado un proyecto que es la realización de una ampliación del frente de su casa, solamente les estaba haciendo falta mas material; motivo por el cual tramitan este crédito.
texts.en:
Juan F. is middle aged. He lives with his wife, María de Jesús. They live alone since all of their children are married. He has been an independent bricklayer for six years. His wife, María, is an employee of the florist shop in a funeral parlor that is well known in the city. They have now started a project to enlarge the front of their house. The only thing they need is more material. That is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge the front of their house

loans.name: Oladayo

texts.en: Oludayo A. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She sells planks.  She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more planks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is fifty-five years old, divorced, and has given birth to eight children: one son and seven daughters. All are currently in school - senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Agnes trades in vegetables such as onions, garden eggs (eggplant), pepper, tomatoes, etc., on a table in the market square. Agnes also treks to other markets to sell. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and from Kumasi. She has been in business for over two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo trabaja de transportista, tiene una movilidad de servicio publico inter- ciudad La Paz El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su esposa. Viven en casa de su suegra ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para la conversión de combustible de gasolina a gas licuado vehicular, lo cual le permitirá un ahorro del 50% de gasto en combustible, con lo que incrementarán sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado por Teofilo.
texts.en:
Teofilo works as a driver. He has a vehicle which provides transportation service to the public between La Paz and El Alto. This is the main source of income with which he supports his wife. They live in his mother-in-law´s house located in the Pasankeri section of La Paz. The loan will be used to convert his vehicle from gasoline to liquid gas, which will enable him to save 50% of the cost of fuel and increase his income. This is his first loan with Impro and an evaluation qualifies him for the loan he requests.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To convert his vehicle from gasoline to liquid gas.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is 50 years old, married with 9 children some of whom are still going to school, and a resident of Brgy. Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental.

She and her husband have been raising a head or two of cattle to sell to supplement their family income even before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998. But with 9 kids to clothe, feed and send to school, life was very tight for the L. family. This is why Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon: to get the badly needed capital to increase their family's income capacity. This venture earns them an average of PHP 3,000.00 per month. 

By the grace of God, in the 10 years that she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evelyn has kept a good credit record, and her older children have already finished their schooling.

For this 18th loan cycle, Evelyn is borrowing PHP 22,000.00 to buy more livestock to raise and sell. Evelyn and her husband continue to strive and work hard in the hope that their children will have a better life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Adolfo Candido

texts.es: El señor Adolfo M. de 51 años, reside en la comarca de San Isidro, en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa es comerciante, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y trigo y la venta de carbón es un trabajo cansado ya que desde horas temprana tiene que andar en los riegos y viendo que no haga plaga para poder tener una buena producción . Esta  asociado en una cooperativa en la siembra de papaya el cual les da financiamiento y asesoria Taiwanesa.  Tiene cinco años de vender el cual inicio con fondos propios y con la venta de ron y gaseosas, este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo  para sus mejoras en su inventario. Con este crédito va a comprar granos básicos, gaseosas  para mejorar las ventas. Su objetivo es  poder obtener lograr un mejor patrimonio para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar granos basicos, gaseosas y productos de consumo

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Hilda es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Hilda vende quesos de casa en casa que adquiere en las diferentes ferias, también compra cereales que luego comercializa en la ciudad de Lima.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Hilda son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the village bank Kausachun which means "¡Que Viva!" or "Living" in Quechua.

Hilda is married, 38 years old, and has two children. Hilda sells cheeses house to house that she buys at different markets in addition to cereals that she buys in the city of Lima.

Hilda needs a loan of 900 soles which she will invest in buying more cheese.

Hilda's dreams are that her children will become professionals and to better her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses

loans.name: Florah's Group

texts.en:
Florah K. is the leader of her lending group in Ntungamo. Forty years old and married with five children ranging in age from 22 – 12 years, she also takes care of three dependents. For the past seven years she has been both a pineapple dealer in the Kafunjo trading centre and a retail shop operator. She is able to make weekly profits of 30,000 UBX although her pineapple business is faced with fluctuating prices and substantial transportation costs.

A friendly lady who would like to expand her business by acquiring a storage facility for her pineapples and educate her children to be able to fend for themselves, Florah is requesting a loan to restock her retail shop as well as buy more pineapples for resale.

loans.use: Buying more pineapples and restocking her retail shop.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta S. is a 27 year-old woman living in the town of Vaimea. She is married and has 3 infant-aged children. Jacinta owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Jacinta has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 450 WST a month from these activities. Jacinta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacinta has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Jacinta is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Jacinta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel L. is 41 years old and lives with her two daughters in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her oldest daughter currently attends university and her youngest is in high school.

L. operates a small cafe in her town. Her cafe specializes in making a variety of traditional Mongolian meals and is a popular dining establishment in her community. L. started her cafe in 2000 and has built a successful business over the years. She continues to build on her business experience and always tries to attract new customers.

L.'s business is very important to her and her family and she works very hard to improve her children's quality of life. She hopes to continue to provide for their education and help them become responsible people. For the future, she hopes to continue to expand her business and customer base. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase food supplies for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Hog raising is the business of Mary Ann A.. She is 49 years old and is married to Anacleto A. Sr. They are thankful because they are blessed with eight children, two of whom are married. The single ones are: Arlene-21 years old who only finished grade-IV due to financial problems; also  Anabelle-18 years old who only finished 2nd year high school; Milbert-13 years old who  finished grade-IV; Anacleto Jr.-10 years old, a grade-III pupil ;Angelita-6 years old, and the youngest is Michelle-4 years old. Mary Ann and her husband work hard to support their family. 

Due to insufficient capital, Mary Ann is asking for additional capital from  KIVA lenders amounting to Php4,000 for the maintenance of her hog raising business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her hog raising business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her café business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, esposo y padre de 4 niños, trabaja en una MARMOLERIA, actividad que la realiza desde que era joven, es allí donde forjo sus habilidades de escultor, tallador y fabricador de mosaicos de piedra granito para pisos y gradas. También realiza la adaptación de lavaplatos y lavamanos en mesones de mármol,  realiza lapidas y cualquier tipo de trabajo que le sea requerido donde se utiliza el mármol o la piedra granito, que es traída de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Hace dos años que se independizo, actualmente cuenta con un ayudante y con la ayuda de su esposa que se han dedicado completamente a trabajar en su pequeña microempresa. Vive aun en una casa familiar que se encuentra bien ubicado, cuenta con mucha demanda ya que su trabajo es muy bien reconocido, puesto que sus mismos clientes son los que lo recomiendan con  muchas otras personas. En Un futuro desea tener una empresa bien consolidada, comprarse su propio vehiculo y ver a  sus hijos profesionales. Cliente antigüo en banco de emprendimiento, actualmente trabajando con crédito individual en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Mario is a married father with 4 children and works in a marble and granite shop. He began this activity when he was young and it was then he shaped his abilities as a sculptor, engraver and builder of granite stone mosaics for floors and stairs. He made adaptations to kitchen and bathroom sinks in marble counters and made gravestones. He does whatever type of work that is brought to Cochabamba that requires marble or granite. He has worked independently for two years counting the years he worked as an assistant. With the help of his wife, he is now completely dedicated to his small business.

He lives in his family house that is well placed. His business is well recognized thanks to lots of demand. His customers are the same ones that recommended others to his business. In the future, he wishes he could have a stable business, buy his own car and see his children become professionals. He is a longstanding client of Emprender and is now an individual borrower at Emprender.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials, granite for counters

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo que acude a la universidad publica de Cochabamba. Vive con su madre que es mayor de edad.

La Sra. Irma y su familia viven en una zona enteramente lechera y agricola. la Sra. Irma se dedica a la lecheria desde hace unos 28 años, primeramente aprendio el manejo del ganado lechero gracias a su madre y despues logro independizarse para comprar su propio ganado lechero.

Solicito el credito para poder terminar de construir un galpon para su ganado lechero. Esto mejorara las condiciones en las que se encuentran sus vacas evitando que se mojen si llueve y les llegue el sol directamente y se deshidraten, lo que evitara que contraigan muchas enfermedades.

En un futuro desea poder solicitar otro credito para comprar mas cabezas de vacas lecheras para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma is 41 years old, single, with a son who attends the public university of Cochabamba. She lives with her elderly mother.

Mrs. Irma and her family live in a dairy and farming zone. Mrs. Irma has been dedicated to milk production for about 28 years. Thanks to her mother she learned to manage the dairy cows and later she became independent as she bought her own dairy cattle.

She requests the loan to finish building a shed for her cattle. This will improve the conditions of her cows as they will not get wet when it rains and they can keep out of the sun and keep hydrated, so they avoid catching many diseases.

In the future she would like to request another loan to buy more dairy cows and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a shed for dairy cows.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefanía tiene 62 años, es madre de tres hijos ya emancipados y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Motupe, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que su esposo ya es de edad avanzada y no puede trabajar, hace año y medio Estefanía se vio en la necesidad de adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que sustenta los gastos familiares. Este vehículo es trabajado por uno de sus hijos y cubre rutas entre Motupe, sus caseríos y el cercano distrito de Olmos.

Los caminos de la zona son muy accidentados y, debido al tiempo de uso, el vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas en el motor que requieren de urgente reparación, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Estefanía es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su más grande anhelo es poder adquirir otra mototaxi para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su marido
texts.en:
Estefanía, 62, has three adult children. She lives with her husband in Motupe district, which is an hour and a half from Chiclayo. Because her husband is of an advanced age and no longer able to work, a year and a half ago, Estefanía was faced with the necessity to acquire a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used in the transportation of passengers and cargo) with which she earns income to meet family expenses. This vehicle is driven by one of her sons and it covers the routes between Motupe, its surrounding settlements, and the neighboring Olmos district. The roads in this area are heavily damaged and, due to the long time it's been in use, the vehicle is beginning to show signs of wear and tear that require urgent repair. This has led to call upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request an 800 new sol loan. Estefanía is a responsible, hard-working, family oriented woman. Her greatest wish is to have a second mototaxi in order to improve both her own and her husband's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for mototaxi service and repair.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children, some of whom are still in school. She works hard to support her husband as they strive to provide for their family. Gladys lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a mining community.

To earn a living, Gladys is engaged in the business of baking bread. Indeed, she bakes bread in a conventional oven in her community and she supplies the bread to retailers and beverage sellers. Gladys has been in business for four years and is now seeking to expand her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $725 to procure bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients in bulk to be able to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional raw ingredients (e.g., flour and sugar)

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old married man with two children. He has owned a clothing shop for the past 20 years. He’s well known in the whole region because his shop has been there a long time. With his business income, he's able to raise his children. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy new clothes and fill his shop with new collections to meet the demands of his clients.

loans.use: Buy new clothes and fill his shop with new collections

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs and cosmetics products

loans.name: Rosa Nila

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive junto a ellos en el distrito de La Victoria, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Rosa es profesora de profesión y desde muy joven se sintió comprometida con la educación de los niños, fue asi que aprovechó una iniciativa del gobierno a nivel nacional e instaló en su vivienda un centro especializado en educación de niños de dos a cinco años de edad llamado PRONOEI. 

Los PRONOEI son entidades educativas que actúan financiadas por las municipalidades y los padres de familia, su publico objetivo son los niños que provienen de familias de escasos recursos y en ellos se brinda los conocimientos y herramientas necesarios para desarrollar en los niños su capacidad de aprendizaje.

El PRONOEI de Rosa no sólo les brinda conocimientos académicos, sino que también tiene contratados a dos profesores, uno de música y uno de danza. Ella desea mejorar la cobertura de atención de sus niños ampliando el aula que tiene y además desea mejorar los baños, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer responsable y muy estimada por los padres que dia a dia le confian el cuidado de sus menores hijos, ella es muy feliz haciendo lo que hace y ama a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, separated, and has two dependent children. They live in the District of La Victoria, which is one of the most populated districts in the region and located five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Rosa is a teacher by profession. Since she was a young woman, she felt committed to educating children. Five years ago, she took advantage of a national government initiative and opened a center in her home specializing in the education of children between the ages of 2-5 called PRONOEI.

“PRONOEI” are educational facilities that are financed by the municipalities and the parents. They target children who come from families with limited resources and provide the knowledge and necessary tools to help them in their capacity to learn. Not only does Rosa’s school teach academic skills, but she also has on staff a music teacher and a dance teacher. She wants to improve the attention she provides to the children by expanding her classroom. Rosa also wants to repair the bathrooms. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

Rosa is a responsible woman who is well-respected by the parents who trust her day after day to look after their children. She is very happy with what she has accomplished and loves her job.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand a classroom & repair the bathrooms

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: D. Léonie est née le 18 Juin 1969 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a près de 20 ans que Léonie s'est installée au quartier Fidjrossè Kpota à Cotonou. Léonie est mariée à DJIBRILLA Ismaïla, et est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Léonie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Fidjrossè Kpota. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Léonie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Léonie exerce comme activité, la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine, de façon ambulante. Léonie vend également des tissus par le système de distribution. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Léonie achète ses produits. Léonie exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans. Aujourd'hui, Léonie sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Léonie D. was born 18 June 1969 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She settled 20 years ago in the Fidjrossè Kpota borough of Cotonou She is married to Ismaïla DJIBRILLA, and is the mother of five children, of which some have had schooling. Léonie herself interrupted her schooling at secondary level. She lives with her children and her husband in Fidjrossè Kpota, and shares family expenses with him. To meet her different expenses, Léonie has been running a retail business for kitchen utensils, as an itinerant vendor. She also sells pieces of fabric through the distribution system. She gets her products from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Léonie has been running her business for the past 15 years. She is now requesting financial support from ALIDé to strengthen her activity and better respond to customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils (iceboxes, sets of bowls, basins, pans, etc.)

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is very smart and prides herself on her patience and strong customer relations. She is 50 years old and runs a book shop. She has been operating her book shop for ten years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to use this loan to purchase a variety of reading and writing books and stationery to serve her customers. Cecilia’s shop is strategically located near both offices and schools. This enables her to sell her books and stationery to her target market. She hopes the extra profits she will generate will enable her to expand into a bigger book shop. 

Cecilia is married to an artisan. Together they have four children, ranging in age from 12 – 20 years. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted reading and writing books

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and married with three children. He owns a motorcycle which he uses for his transportation business to earn a living. He also runs a butchery to earn enough money to support his family and pay school fees for his children since the living costs are high.

John saves his money with his group in Faulu Kenya which enables him to access loans because the group guarantees his loans. He had previously taken out one loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business and which he successfully repaid.

John has requested a new loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy another motorcycle. He hopes to expand his business and build his family a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy a another motorcycle

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Antonio Manzanarez G. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Carmen Arias y tienen 3 hijos que le ayudan con la venta y preparacion de los pescados. tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
nos comentaba que hay dias muy dificiles para los pescadores dentro del mar por que la marea no es muy buena, es decir que cuando el agua sube mucho no trae peces.
Antonio todos los dias sale a vender pescado a Nacaome, Langue y Agua Fria nos dijo que las ganancias han 
bajado un poquito porque los altos costos del combustible lo hacen perder un poco de ganancia. lo cual tiene que vender mas pescados para ganar un poco mas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas pescados.
texts.en:
Antonio Manzanarez G., 56, lives with his life partner, Carmen Arias, and their three children who help him prepare and sell fish; he has been in this line of work for 6 years. He tells us that there are very difficult days for the fishermen at sea because the tides aren’t good, that is to say, when the tide is very high there aren’t a lot of fish. Antonio goes to Nacome, Langue and Agua Fría every day to sell fish. He mentioned that profits have declined a bit because the high cost of fuel eats into his profits; he has to sell more fish to make up the difference. He will use the funds to buy fish.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Lucia Adelaida

texts.es:
La señora Lucia de 56 años  de edad es socia del Banco Comunal Los Corrales perteneciente a un sector de la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, ella está casada tiene dos hijos  y cuida de dos nietos desde hace 5 años, nos comentó con tristeza que su hijo se separo de la madre de los niños y desde entonces ella los tiene a su cuidado.

Nuestra socia tiene como actividad un restáurate en una finca que junto al esposo cuidan, desde hace 3 meses la señora Lucia está trabajando con la venta de comida para los obreros de la finca, muy temprano sale a comprar los alimentos para preparar sus platos, con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo en su negocio y abastecerse de los productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y carnes.

Mientras la señora Lucia se dedica a su restaurant el esposo sale a trabajar en una volqueta del mismo dueño de la finca que le permite que haga fletes, por lo general cada salida en la volqueta le pagan 70 dólares es una gran ayuda  económica para estos esposos. El sueño de la señora Lucia es poder ver bien a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia is 56 years old and a member of the Communal Bank “Los Corrales” (The Corrals), which is located in an area of the city of Montecristi in Manabí Province. She is married and has two children. Lucia has been taking care of her two grandchildren for the past five years. Sadly, she says their mother abandoned them, so she is the one responsible for looking after them.

Lucia operates a restaurant located on a farm that both she and her husband manage. For the past three months, Sra. Lucia has been selling food to the farm workers. At an early hour, she leaves to buy food in order to prepare her dishes. With this new loan, Lucia plans to invest everything into her business and restock her inventory of rice, sugar, oil, and meat.

While Sra. Lucia works at the restaurant, her husband uses the farm owner’s truck to make freight deliveries. He is paid $70 per trip, which is a great financial help to this couple. Sra. Lucia dreams of seeing her grandchildren develop into good people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, and meat

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
A. Mukaram is 53 years old. She is divorced and has one child. For many years she tried various types of the activities. Finally, three years ago together with her son she started a business selling cell phones. Mukaram believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows her to support her family. 

However, Mukaram thinks that it is expensive to purchase the cell phones locally and it will save funds considerably to purchase the goods in China. For this purpose Mukaram requests 5,100 Somoni. Being a first time borrower, Mukaram is grateful to all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cell phones from China for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a married man of 36 years of age. He has owned a barber shop in his town since 1998. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. He decided on doing this business to use his experience. He caters to a wide range of clients from the village and its neighborhoods. He is well known in the whole region and he always tries to be up-to-date with all the new cuts. 

Mohammad wants to purchase tools for his work and also to change the décor in his house. In order to do so, he is requesting $1,000 for the first time from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. He hopes to enlarge his shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and change the décor in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a shop and purchase the necessary merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two heifers.

loans.name: Hellesy Seveni

texts.en:
Hellesy Naise is 49 years old.  He is from the town of Sigalagala in Kakamega. He is married to Phanince Cheptoo and they have one child, Sharon Libese, who is 10 years old and in primary school.

Hellesy has been running a secretarial bureau where he makes photocopies and sells stationery. He is applying for his first loan from us after being introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a client here. He intends to use the money to buy photocopy paper and another photocopier since the one he is using is old and is not serving him well. His business is situated near the Sigalagala Institute and this means that he has a huge clientele from there.

His dream is to become a very stable businessman and venture into the printing business in the future.

loans.use: Buy another photocopier

loans.name: Loryn

texts.en:
This is Loryn B., 26, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Marvin B. and mother of an energetic toddler. At this time, she is working hard to be able to afford sending him to a good school, to finish his education all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Loryn as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Loryn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Loryn dreams of being able to give her child a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes that her husband will finally be able to find work outside the country. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M. is from Dipolog City. She is 55 years old. Lydia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby C., 33, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Michael C. and mother to two elementary-aged children. By the grace of God, Ruby has managed to support her children's schooling. Now, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ruby operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at the piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business's operations, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Ruby dreams of being able to renovate her house soon with income from all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory

loans.name: Dios Proveera 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Rita is the coordinator of her group Dios Proveera 1 & 2 (God Will ProviD.). She makes her home here in a simple structure with four of the five children she had. Being a single mom, she raised and educated them, working hard and taking care of them. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to sew and spend time with her children.

Rita is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around eight years, starting with small sewing orders before she expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying a sewing machine and some cosmetics products from the Ebel catalog. She will use the profits to save and buy a computer for her children. In the near future, she wants to build a house.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed money to invest in her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some cosmetics products

loans.name: Divina Gracia

texts.en:
Divina Gracia C. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Divina Gracia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods and biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Divina Gracia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Divina Gracia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 9th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 28 year old married man.  He is blessed with two children ages 8 and 6.  He runs a cosmetics shop and a barber shop.  He has managed to employ one person in the business.

In addition, he runs a video show (small theatre showing DVDs or television programs).  He says that through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to boost his business and save his money.  He hopes to continue growing his business through Faulu Kenya.

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy electronic items for his video show.

loans.use: To buy electronic items

loans.name: Ourng

texts.en: Ourng R. is an elderly villager who lives with other family members in Kampong Chhnang Province. She cultivates a rice crop to make a living. She is a widow blessed with eight children, four are married, and the remaining four are single. Three of them are working in various occupations, and have a salary. They share their earnings with Ourng R. to support the daily expenses of the whole family. Ourng R. has another farm that she owns, but she has not yet planted crops on it. Ourng R. hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer for growing crops.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn L. is from the village of Nongnongan, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Marlyn is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods and canned goods in the local community. She is also retailing vegetables like string beans and tomatoes. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $237 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell, like eggplant and squash. This will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell, like eggplant and squash

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Francisca, tiene 60 años  de edad y hace algunos años el compañero de su vida falleció y quedo sola, pero de esa relación tuvo cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive con ella, hace varios años aprendió corte y confección.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, pero lo que mas elabora son sabanas las mismas que después las venden a clientes que le piden sus obras.  También vende productos naturales de la marca Forlive, ventas que les hace al mismo tiempo que entrega sus obras ya estas también le compran sus productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, otros materiales para la costura y productos naturales. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos y los pagos fáciles de cumplir. Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en: In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos Stadium, the members of the Luz de America Community Bank meet every fifteen days. Here we meet Francisca, who is 60. Her life companion passed away and she has been left alone, but she has four children from that relationship, all grown, one of whom lives with her. She learned dressmaking several years ago. She has a small dressmaking workshop where she has made clothing for many years. However, what she makes most are sheets, which she later sells to customers who request her work. She also sells Forlive brand natural products, sales that she makes at the same time as she sells her work. She works every day from 6 am to 10 pm, and sometimes later when she has orders to fill. She will use this new loan to purchase natural products, fabrics and other materials for clothing-making. She has been part of her Community Bank almost since its beginning, and she likes it because her loans are fast and without too many requirements, and the payments are easy to make. Her dreams are for her and her family to have good health.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, sewing materials and natural products.

loans.name: Mirembe Women's Group-Nyenje-Mukono

texts.en:
45-year-old M. Robinah runs a growing poultry business in Nyenje-Mukono. It is a business that she and her husband, with whom she has 6 children, started 9 years ago.  Robinah was previously involved in a business selling bricks.  

She says hard work, prayers, persistence and determination have been her stocks in trade. Weekly, the poultry business generates for her 1,000,0000 shillings. With this loan, Robinah says she is going to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand poultry business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 businesses: ready-to-wear clothes and pants and rice retailing. She lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Josephine has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Josephine is borrowing PHP 26,000 in order to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Josephine hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams.
